Reviews.Title: “just not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: KenLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney from Hong Kong in March. My wife and I were looking forward to staying in a very good hotel in a great location. What a let down. The room we were allocated was more likely to be found in a boy scouts hostel. The bathroom door was peeling paint. The windows and blinds were filthy. We left a pair of dirty cups and the room service ignored them,not what you would expect with the price we paid. Internet access was charged at $5 for 30 mins . What a rip off. As I said previously, we came to this Sydney hotel from Hong Kong. I suggest the management of this hotel did the reverse journey to see how it should be done. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, forgettable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hungry_TravelerUk
Reviews.Content: First of all, since last in Australia, I noted the prices had gone up and this hotel's rates were no exception. Given the location I could go with that but the rooms were still a bit pokey and the room with a view was not that great due to sealed window and no balcony. I would however like to highlight the friendly, efficient and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good base for a holiday in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OzfamilyPerthHills
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and had a view of the bridge.Its location is the best thing about this hotel - it is only a hop skip and a jump to everything with lots of food places and transport options nearby. The rooms are adequate and the beds are comfy. You basically know what you are getting with the Holiday Inn brand and this fits the formula. Make the trip up to the rooftop pool and check out the million dollar views.

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: bakem
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location to stay in Sydney, this is it. If you are looking for a great hotel, this isn't it. We arrived 45 minutes prior to check in time to find the advertised Valet parking full. We were directed to a public car park 10 minutes away, with absolutely no offer of assistance to cart our luggage back to the hotel. We were offered an upgraded room, only to find the fold out sofa bed not made, sagging and not fit to sleep in. We then had to contact reception, to downgrade again to a room that would fit 2 x adults and 1 x child. I was told when i questioned if it was necessary to book parking, that it says "it on our website" I'm still to find reference to any public car park options. Public car park ended up costing more than the hotels rate. So not only inconvenienced, but also out of pocket. We are Holiday Inn priority club members, and stayed in Holiday Inns across the world, but this one was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lilywhite107
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Holiday Inn, it is in the Rocks area and is about a 5-10 minute walk from Circular Quay..depending on your speed. The Harbour Bridge is 5 minutes away and there are fabulous views of the bridge, the Opera House and the Quay from the rooftop terrace. The pool is small but adequate. The reception area is large and the welcome was great, very friendly and efficient. We booked a king room, there was no view but it overlooked the side of the hotel and was quiet, apart from a bit of noise on the Saturday, but that didn't bother us. The bed was big and comfy. If I have one niggle about the room it is that the bathroom is very small, but it was clean and serviceable. There is a charge for wiFi but we found this almost everywhere in Australia. I paid $5 to use the computer in the reception for 30 mins...but had 24 hours to use it and as I was only doing a couple of quick checks it was fine for me. We had breakfast included in our rate and it was Ok, a typical Holiday Inn breakfast with cooked to order eggs. Taxis were readily available outside the hotel. We actually walked to Darling Harbour, it took us about 40 minutes but it was lovely, then we got the ferry back to Circular Quay. We didn't do the Harbour Cruise but took the ferry to Manly beach and had some great views from that. I wouldn't really recommend the open top bus tour..there is a lot of traffic in Sydney and the buses are old and smell of petrol fumes...better to walk or take ferries and taxis. If I ever go back to Sydney I will definitely stay at the Old Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Getting around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JohnDixon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn in Sydney in March 2012, as part of our trip around Australia. Understand it is a 4 star hotel, and would probably agree. Where it is 5 star is the location, overlooking the Opera House, and right next to Sydney Bridge. The views from the roof pool are breathtaking. The area of Rocks, is where it seemed to be all happening. It is right next to the port which takes your to most places boat. Also lots of places to eat. Only complaint we had was the general cost of everything, I understand it is to do with the UK pound against the Australian Dollar. Everything seemed to be double UK prices. Would certainly give it a 4.5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Battota_AA
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in this hotel for 3 nights. The location was superb. It was easy to reach from Circular Quey station and like 5 min walk. To be able to see the view from our room was spectacular thing. The roof is a must to get to it, and enjoy the Harbour Bridge & the Opera House. It was perfect for pics. Also, the staff were friendly. We had a very quick and smooth check in & out. The Hotel was spacious; I mean the lobby, the room and even elevators. The beds were big and comforting. Bathroom was good. Internet & wireless was there but not free. There was a good selection TV channels. One more thing, it was one of few hotels nowadays that don't put complimentary water. As to finding nearby shops & restaurants, they are at the Circular Quey & all the way inside the CBD. We would definitely stay there again if we go to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 1sue22
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Sydney was the second part of a 3 - centre break with Fremantle WA and Singapore. After having read many reviews of various hotels in Sydney, we eventually opted for the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. We weren't disappointed. This hotel deserves 10/10 for location. The Harbour Bridge was literally a 5 minute walk away and the Opera House only 10 minutes walk. Circular Quay was two streets away and the Sunday market is right on your doorstep. Our room was clean and modern with a choice of soft and firm pillows and one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in. The bathroom, however, was small. The fittings were modern and it was well equipped but if you like a bit of space this could be a problem. Sydney is noisy, bustling and busy with more bars, pubs, and restaurants than you can shake a stick at. However, if you like to eat late be aware that a lot of the restaurants seem to close by 10 so this may not suit some. Getting out and about in Sydney is very easy with ferries departing from Circular Quay to various destinations. Poopular with tourists is a round-the-harbour cruise which gives you the chance to see the multi-million dollar homes and pretty little inlets. Ratonga Zoo is another popular day out or take the ferry down to Manly Beach, a crescent of pale, clean sand patrolled by lifeguards. Manly is great for trying to learn to surf or for just sitting and watching how the experts do it. Bondi Beach is a bus or taxi ride away but some of the locals we spoke to said Manly was nicer and less crowded. A real 'must-do' is to take a trip to the Blue Mountains an area of outstanding natural beauty. On your way there call in at Faversham Wildlife Park and take the opportunity to get up close and personal with a Koala or one of the Wallabys. When you reach the Blue Mountains Heritage Site take the Skywalk Cablecar ($9) across the valley to Scenic World then take the almost vertical railway car down the the bottom of the valley. You have to hang on tight for this section of your journey. It's a bit of a knee trembler but great fun. When at the bottom of the valley wander along the rainforest walkways then ride back up on the smaller Cableway Cablecar ($21). This is a great day out and gives you the perfect opportunity to get out of the city for a while. Most trips include the costs of cablecars, railway, and wildlife park admission in the general cost. Sydney is easy to get around by any means of transport but the easier options (if you are going further afield) are ferry or rail. Buses and taxis are plentiful but the heavy traffic in and around Sydney (especially at peak times) is a nightmare. Most modes of transport can be picked up around Circular Quay. Prices generally are high and most organised excursions are expensive. The Harbour Bridge climb is extremely popular but again the cost of this may put some people off. Sydney is one of those cities that you must visit at least once in your lifetime. With its iconic Bridge and Opera House set in a stunning harbour it is still classed by many as the ultimate desination.

Reviews.Title: “needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Silas K
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel without a soul. It has a big huge atrium that makes the space seem deserted. My room was OK and had a harbor view. I was particularly irritated that they wanted to charge for WiFi. When I went to use it it didn't work. I trekked down to the desk and the manager followed me up to the room. He also couldn't get it to work until he went out into the hall with my iPad. Holding the door open with his foot he said, "here it is!". Great. They did give me free Wifi in the lobby, but it still sucked and I shouldn't have been forced to go there just to check and send an email or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: annabellequinn
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed in this hotel years ago and remembered the rooms being rather small, so we certainly weren't expecting palatial when we stayed this time - were attending a party on the rooftop. We were surprised, however, to discover that our (and this is true) cupboard under the stairs room was bigger than anticipated and it had a nice view (we were on the southern side) and looked out onto a courtyard in the Rocks. A great bonus was the 2pm checkout. This meant we could go out for breakfast, do the Rocks Markets, explore the area, have lunch and then checkout. Unfortunately, our room was a loooong way from reception and it was most inconvenient when our electronic room keys ceased to function at 11am. Wasted half an hour sorting this out - and we weren't the only ones! Some of the staff were lovely, some were not...depended who you got on the day. Our friends, who were staying three nights, were upgraded to a higher floor with great views over the harbour, but their room was small and there was a fair bit of noise from the local pubs and night life. Valet parking was expensive, but worth it. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary hotel, air conditioning noisy”
Reviews.Author: MadelineParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a beautiful part of town, central to everything, but we were disappointed by the cramped room, tiny bathroom and noisy air con unit which was not working properly. We had a sleepless night because of this. The room was not cold enough to warrant the thickness of the doona that was supplied, but it was also too cold to sleep without it. This was a supposedly secret hotel deal. However, I am convinced that this so called "secret hotel deal" is just a way to get rid of the most undesirable rooms. We were on the first floor, almost on the road itself. There was absolutely no privacy and we had to have the net curtains shut all the time. I would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hidden charges exorbitant”
Reviews.Author: andyka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was generally what we expected, great location, OK rooms, reasonably clean. Staff were friendly, although room was not cleaned one day despite the Please Clean sign being on the door all day. However we were not expecting $27.50 per day PER DEVICE WIFI charges, and breakfast was expensive at $28 pp. The Fine Food deli next door does breakfast at almost half the price and with free wifi. Interesting to see if the hotel can explain - our 2nd hotel in Sydney had a week's WIFI for $30. But reading through other reviews, there is not a single response to WIFI where mentioned by others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: BUTTERS84
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with the holiday inn at the rocks due to its location and have mixed feelings with this hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious although request a higher floor, my view was mostly blocked by trees even though I had a corner room on the third floor. The bathroom could have done with a good clean and had a strong smell of mould, obvious signs here that a refurb is due. The hotel has a small pool and a few sun loungers on the top floor, I don't think this is sufficient as most of the time they were taken. Room service is good with a cheaper "takeaway" option but I'd recommend walking round the corner to a noodle bar called wok on inn, absolutely great food to be found here. The hotels location is great and you will find many bars and restaurants nearby. No benefits or upgrades for Priority Club members and internet charges are very high, come on Holiday Inn, in this day and age web access should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a beautiful part of Sydney! It is within walking distance to many great restaurants and Circular Quay. There is also a beautiful view of the city if you go out on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Old Sydney”
Reviews.Author: andrewnp
Reviews.Content: Rooms are uncomfortably small albeit clean, and access is unduly difficult (narrow passages, long distances from the elevators, and weirdly split levels). Service was pedestrian, with long delays delivering our car, despite high priced so called "valet service". And forget about food service, the cost is ridiculous. If that weren't enough, being slugged at check-out with hidden previously unadvised costs is frankly just rude. We will not stay in this place again, and will not recommend it as a place to stay if anyone asks. This place is not a good reflection of good Sydney standards. A good location, but way over-priced considering what you get, and several better value options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically Located”
Reviews.Author: jlaway
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Sydney. It is easily accessed from the airport by the train, okay a short walk from Circular Quay. The Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Botanical Gardens are an easy walk. Most other places are easy to get to on a ferry. The rooms were clean and had all the things one needs; great bed, clean bathroom, iron and hair dryer. We suggest not eating breakfast in the hotel. It is quite pricey. There is a great little cafe just across the lane from the side entrance to the hotel. They prepare fresh, organic breakfasts and have free wifi. The hotel charges for wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankbooth
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Sydney and it was very hard to find reasonably priced accomodation in a good location. We read reviews and Holiday Inn seemed to be the one. Over all the Hotel was good. It's location is fantastic which I think is the best thing going for it. It was within walking distance to everything and the markets were right outside the front door. We had a 'king room' with partial Opera House views and they were definatley only partial - non existent when the P&O Crusie ship was docked in the Harbour. The following isn't meant as critisium, just as a guide for people with high expectations of standards. We arrived very early in the morning and knew our room wouldn't be ready. They were very happy to look after our luggage which gave us the morning and early afternoon to start exploring. We were told to come back at 2pm and our room would be ready. We got back and after a very early start we were very eager to get to our room. Unfortunately at 2, our room was not ready and had to wait in the lobby until 3pm to be able to go to our room. The rooms are very basic. Comfortable bed and very comfortable pillows which was definately a plus. For us the room was fine as we spent most of our time out and about exploring the City. There are quite a few details that I think they need to upgrade as they are starting to look rather tired. The bathroom needs a refurbishment as the tiles are all black and almost had a grubby appearance. The vanity was old and tired. Tonly other complaint I would have is that the windows were in need of a good clean. It was very obvious when you were staring at the sights. Breakfast was good, although on the first morning I ordered an omlette - unfortunately all the ingredients were raw, I avoided the omlettes for the other mornings. Coffee wasn't much good either. Apart from that the breakfast were fine. We would stay here again or try and fine more reasonably priced accomodation with out a pool. The pool wasn't fantastic! Especially when we were away without kids for the 1st time in years and we had kids bombing in the pool with parents who weren't telling them off!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sachiboo
Reviews.Content: HI, Old Sydney is a great place to stay, easy walking distance to go to Circular Quay, visit the Opera House and to catch the ferry for a harbour cruise. We had a room on the eight floor with a excellent view of the harbour. While staying there for 2 nights, we saw the Princess ships sailed into the harbour, one berthing at the OPT while the other going under the harbour bridge to Barangaroo. The room was very clean and excellent, service at the front desk efficient and staff very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked one week at this hotel as part of a world tour. There was no porter on arrival and had to man handle 6 suitcases into the lobby whilst one of us stopped out on the pavement. We had paid for a king superior room with a view of the opera house. Whilst one cannot deny the excellent location the rooms were tired and worn with extremely small bathrooms. As for the view, this was obscured every day bar one by cruise liners. Not the hotels fault but should be noted on booking as we had paid for the privilege of the view. If your room overlooks George Street don't expect a good nights sleep as the club opposite stays open until the early hours and music booms out through the open doors and revellers spill out screaming and shouting. Add to all these facts that they do not in this day and age have free Wi Fi and have a credit card surcharge we would not be stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location to The Rocks and Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: davos33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to The Rocks historic precinct of Sydney. There are fantastic views of Sydney Harbour from the top floor pool area and of the Sydney Opera House. Some good photo opportunities of the cruise ships if you are lucky enough. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and the beds comfortable with your choice of firm or soft pillows. One tip is the mini bar has nothing in the fridge so be prepared and ask reception for some midnight snacks, water or anything else you might like prior to retiring. The parking is difficult so make sure you ask when booking, get clear directions and the price is $39 valet for one night. Breakfast is very yummy and you can get eggs any way you like it cooked by chef which is always a treat. Great hotel and I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: helenandfrank
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed one night in March 2012. Received an upgrade to king room (from queen) without us asking. Room was quite good, bathroom adequate, bed very comfortable, all areas of room clean, nice view of Circular Quay out of window (although we had to stand basically one step away from window to get the view). Breakfast was good and service throughout was polite. Location in Rocks area was ideal for what we needed. Hotels in Sydney are expensive, but if you need a middle of the range hotel in a good location we can recommend Holiday Inn Old Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn the Rocks Old Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Matoluk
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a room on the 6th floor facing the Quay. We arrived at 10 in the evening. The view out of the window was outstanding. The Sydney opera house lit to stand out. If you want a breathtaking, iconic view of one of the worlds most famous landmarks, this is the hotel for you. The hotel public areas look tired and the colour scene grim. The room itself was basic with poor quality furniture, but the large king size bed was clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked well, if a tad noisy. There was always hot water and the 42" LCD Tv worked well. The was a nice variety of teas and coffee in the room. The rooftop pool and spa were nice, but be aware there is no shade. The wifi broadband service provided is expensive and rubbish. I was disconnected so many times I could not keep a connection long enough to keep in touch with my business emails. The management realised there was a genuine problem and they sorted my connection the best they could. We found the English speaking staff to be very helpful and genuinely cared about the brand. The breakfast buffet was good quality and tasty. In conclusion, we will consider the Holiday Inn should we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base!”
Reviews.Author: UKTravellersSurrey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two week stay in Sydney and it was a great choice. The location is excellent - right in the heart of the historic Rocks area and with many good bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. And the weekends brought the eclectic Rocks Market to right outside the door. The hotel staff are excellent - so friendly and welcoming and it seems that nothing is too much trouble for them - Kelly on Reception was particularly good and went the extra mile to answer our questions and help us with our plans - but everyone was efficient from housekeeping to laundry services. A choice of free newspapers was available to take away each day in the Lobby together with a wide variety of information about tours, sights, trips and activities that staff were happy to help you book. Our room gave us amazing views of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. It was spotlessly clean, well maintained each day and had great air conditioning. It was light, bright and modern and offered a great base to which to return and relax. We would recommend this hotel and its great team not least because they are keen to improve what they offer to customers and actively seek feedback on their services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: amgmhg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on George Street because it was beside Circular Quay and Opera House area. We took a cruise that left from Circular Quay so we only had to walk across the street & down to the ship - how easy is that! The location was great. The hotel is an older property, but kept up pretty well. Not as updated as most of the Holiday Inns with the new green logo - but the location was great. Staff were extremely helpful and the views of the harbour were great as well. Access to all the boats going out to Bondi etc. were right at the Quay. Walking distance to Botanical Gardens. Totally different experience from staying over by Darhling Harbour when you feel more in a downtown city.

Reviews.Title: “Some strong features to recommend and a few weeknesses”
Reviews.Author: Valencian's
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed at the Holiday Inn, Sydney, on two separate occasions in the last two weeks and enjoyed ourselves during both stays. The hotel has a lot going for it and a couple areas where improvements could be made. Firstly I have to mention the staff, they were so happy and helpful, it was a pleasure to have a question or need to have to take to them. It didn't matter what time of the day or night we contacted them they were consistently enjoyable to approach. The second strong point for the hotel was its position / location being right in the centre of all that was to see and happening on the Rocks. From the hotel, in minutes we could have walked to Central Quay, the Opera House, Botanical Gardens, the Bridge and much much more, absolutely ideal location and great views from the hotels roof and pool area. There are two areas that I would be less positive about. The decor and furniture in the hotel is quite drab in the main communal areas and non-coordinated and quite cheap looking in the bedrooms. We took breakfast in the hotel only once due to the state of the furniture and overall depressing feeling of the dining area and the bedrooms looked like a major overhaul was well overdue. I realise that the hotel has various heritage / conservation restrictions it needs to adhere to but that's no excuse for not keeping to basic Holiday Inn room quality standards. My second gripe would be to do with Internet access and cost. $25/ day for a very slow and weak Internet access is firstly robbery and secondly an insult bearing in mind how technologically advanced Sydney is and what is available outside of the hotel's walls. However having mentioned the good and not so good my bottom line is that it's a highly recommendable hotel made by its staff and location and if ever back in Sydney I'd seriously consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ozmuzziemoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located located at the Rocks, Circular Quay, Sydney. From the rooftop you are afforded first clas views of the Harbour Bridge & Opera House. Restuarant was only open for breakfast which was excellent but there are many restaurants nearby for other meals. Rooms were good however our room had an interconnecting door which meant we experienced noise from the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Jono J
Reviews.Content: Service met expectations, delicious breakfasts and rooms are clean and of a good size. Location is superb being so close to Circular Quay and transport (ferries/buses/trains). Good loyalty program and get a late check-out when you join.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sabbatical10
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded without asking about it and really enjoyed staying there. Gorgeous rooftop pool with stunning views of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Minus: breakfast is overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Great view.”
Reviews.Author: b777fly
Reviews.Content: Average 1980's hotel in need of an update. $27 breakfast is good value compared with local cafes. Observer Hotel next door has Guinness for $6.50 which is also good value for Australia. View from rooftop pool is amazing. The Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and visiting cruise liners are all nearby. As this is a small area there are only 6 loungers, so get there early.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant business”
Reviews.Author: Steveyinasia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days to attend meetings in Sydney and I am very pleased with the location, you have to check out the view from the pool deck on the eighth floor....amazing postcard view. As I primarily travel on business, the work environment is adequate however the desk faces a wall and the TV was behind, making working and watching TV impossible. The bathrooms are small but functional and my room was at the back so fairly quiet with no real view. It is an easy walk into the CBD and very close to Circular Quay and the ferries to get around. On the weekends the Rocks market is right out the front door so there is a street fair atmosphere over this time, very different from the weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ML501
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel before christmas. Our room on the top floor was quiet and clean and large enough for the 4 of us, but it had only 2 double beds with a significant additional cost to get another bed to avoid our 2 children having to share a double bed. Breakfast on 3 of the mornings was excellent, with a great variety of fresh food, pancakes and eggs cooked fresh to order and good coffee. One morning it was very different with no juice machine, a broken coffee machine, pancake orders forgotten twice and service nearly absent. We could not understand why our experience on the third of the four mornings was so very different. The location is excellent, particularly walking home after an evening performance at the opera house. We walked to Darling Harbour, about 30 min with children past interesting shops and also walked to the art gallery another day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: anonymous-john
Reviews.Content: Great location and an amazing pool view of the bridge and opera house. Nice rooms. A great Sydney destination

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: VillaPisces
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago - comfortable and very close to Sydney Harbour and rooftop pool - reasonable price and service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Expensive Area”
Reviews.Author: yidarmy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is lovely and our room had wonderful views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House but Old Sydney (or The Rocks) as its known, is very very expensive. This hotel has a rooftop pool which overlooks the Harbour which is lovely. Average prices around the area were Â£18 for a Pizza and Â£6.00 for a beer. There is a great place opposite across the harbour called the Opera Bar where live music plays during the afternoon and drinks are around Â£5 but the atmosphere is great. Sevice at the hotel was very good and the breakfast was beautiful if again a little expensive $27 per person. Definately go to Manly Beach over Bondi.....superb

Reviews.Title: “Best location at The Rocks district”
Reviews.Author: EFirmo
Reviews.Content: Great view to Opera House and Bridge from pool area and some rooms. Walking distance to everything at Sydney. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ilankon
Reviews.Content: The Rocks area is just so much fun when visiting Sydney. But this hotel has done soo little to isolate the rooms, it's like trucks are running through your room and early morning you are woken up by the noise from outside. Changed into 3 different rooms, but hotel staff explaines "its's just an old buikding..."

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney for 3 nights in January 2012 and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is easy to get to using public transport from the airport, being a 400m walk from Circular Quay station. It's also in the centre of The Rocks and within an easy walk of the Botanical Gardens, Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge etc etc. The rooftop swimming pool is quite small but provides great views of the harbour and city. The one down side was that all the rooms on the lower floors at the front of the hotel are noisy because of the quite busy road outside the hotel. That said, the staff were very obliging when we asked to be moved. We used Priority Club reward points so our stay was effectively free.

Reviews.Title: “Make Up Your Own Mind”
Reviews.Author: Roy1977_TheOne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights from Jan 29, 2012. The hotel is fine. The staff are very helpful. The pool wasn't a factor for me since it was raining during most of my visit and I was here on business. The breakfast setup is fine, but pricey, $18AUD for continental and $27AUD for full breakfast. There's an egg station for boiled, poached, fried and omelets. Scrambled eggs are on the breakfast bar but I didn't have them. Depending on which side of the hotel you're on, it can be a noisy place, especially on the weekend with all the adjacent music venues. But that's lively life for you. Your grave will be quiet enough. You might bring earplugs - I will next time. Yes, 'next time' - I will stay here again given the opportunity. The location is fantastic - very alive. And there is a taxi stand right out front, which was very helpful for me traveling to the Convention Center every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman2710
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the superb location, right in the heart of The Rocks close to Circular Quay it's an ideal tourist location. The hotel itself is perhaps in need of some refurbishment but having said that it's clean and comfortable with helpful staff. We didn't use the restuarant, there being too many interesting eating places near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: philosopherkingtomas
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views! Really enjoyed this hotel really a good value and close to Oreint Hotel bar, street fairs, shopping, the harbour. People are friendly and efficient. The views from the roof top pool are spectacular. We will come back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful loaction but the hotel is run down.”
Reviews.Author: TC182TC
Reviews.Content: We were going to a mates wedding across the road at the Quay passenger terminal, 60 seconds away. The hotel is in a great old area of Sydney, beautiful old colonial buildings, the Harbour bridge is just north of the hotel and the Opera house is directly East. The views from the roof are amazing. If you stay there make sure you go to the 8th floor and check out the views. The down side of this hotel is the fact that it badly needs a refurbishment. The bathroom we were in was tiny, seriously, no BS, I could touch both walls at the same time. The fittings were run down and not in the best of shape. The room itself was nice, clean but smaller then the average sized room. We were in the double room. The bed was cumfy as were the pillows, of which you had two firmness choices. We ordered some room service, a Hamburger at $18 is expensive but it was fast, tasty and a decent size. Breakfast was included in the room price and was nice, the selection of food was very good but I had to tell the staff when the eggs and hash browns had run out as they were not paying attention to this. This hotel is in a great loc but as stated needs a re fit badly. Would I stay here again? Only if I was wanting to stay in the heart of the Rocks. If I wanted to stay in Sydneyâ€™s CBD I would stay at the Intercontinental. Overall, a well placed hotel with friendly staff but in need of a re fit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: snjjben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for one night prior to heading off on a cruise. The location was perfect, close to everything that we needed, last minute grocery items, have a walk around and look at the sites eg Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge, circular quay. The view from the top was awesome and a bonus. The room was very clean and tidy, the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this place and would stay again. The beds were so comfortable, great nights sleep. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “No better place in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: How incredible this hotel is! Location - quiet, historical, and perfectly positioned. The hotel - again historical, beautiful, inviting and relaxing. The foyer's decor, lounge chairs and twilight ambiance are so inviting it is hard to walk past to your room without stopping. The staff - brilliant every time I stayed there. I agree the rooms are dated but they are very clean and the beds as good as any I have used. They are also quiet. I only stay in the room to sleep so they were adequate for my purposes. Over the last 10 years I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels in Sydney CBD for work commitments and short holidays. It was sheer luck I stumbled across the Old Sydney Holiday Inn a couple of years back and now it is the only place I will stay. If brand new bathrooms and amenities is more important to you than location and ambiance than it's not your hotel. Otherwise I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: SusanPerth
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to be close to the cruising port and were very pleased with both the location and value for money. The hotel is located less than 200 metres from the port. There are plenty of interesting sites to see in the area including a Sunday market which really doesn't get underway until 11am. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and we managed to find a light meal after 10.30pm at a local bar. Judging by the price of breakfast in the hotel they actively encourage you to go out and find somewhere else to eat. This would be my only criticism. For the price we paid we received excellent service and had a comfortable and clean room. Although we didn't have time to enjoy the pool, a trip to the top floor is worthwhile just to enjoy the spectacular views of the harbour and bridge. I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers who want to see the main sites of the city and are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: cpmderby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the best locations in sydney for walking to all the sights and to the ferry terminal so as to access manley and all other harbour sites.Restaurants and bars are all within walking distance as the hotel is set in the rocks area where the first fleet landed and is sydneys oldest historic area.The hotel is not the newest around but the central location makes up for this.If we were going to syndey again we would stop here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room without a window”
Reviews.Author: Mujgan
Reviews.Content: Can you imagine a 4 star hotel with no window in its guest room? We in Europe for sure can not but on the otehr side of the earth, where there are no hotels with 3 or 2 or 1 star have their rooms without a window. Plus you are paying for a luxury of 4 star :). This hotel reflects the Australian understanding of hospitality. There is nobody at reception deskt after a certain hour at night ( I dont remember exactly may be after 22 00 O clock).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Colin2109
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 travelled were in Syndey for the weekend and wanted a central location. Holiday Inn Old Sydney at The Rocks was great. Surrounded by restaurants, pubs and shops. Short walk to ferries, trains and buses. Breakfast was included in our room rate and had a great selection. Staff were always helpful and even allowed us to store our luggage after check out because our flight home wasn't until night. Room was a little small for 4 people, but fine for the weekend because we were only there to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “our first trip to oz and the holiday inn old sydney”
Reviews.Author: mark h
Reviews.Content: SMACK BANG IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROCKS AND WALK OUT THE FRONT DOOR OF THE HOTEL AND YOUR IN THE ROCKS MARKET ! we arrived at the hotel at 8am after a 24 hour flight and were greeted with a happy smiling face and to cap it all could book in early, we were given our swipe key to get into the room and when we got to the room it did not work so down i went and got a new one , that did not work either and then we found out it was the batterys in the door lock cos the third key worked.the room was very clean but the bathroom could do with a lick of paint. we then went upstairs to the pool and spa WHAT A VIEW right by the bridge and a great view of the opera house and harbour( free towels in the small room on the left if you wish to swim or use the spa ) go to the roof top at night to see the lights of sydney great views. we were given the room above the restaurant and around 5.30 to 6am you can hear people getting there food and the orange machine being used which sounded liked someone drilling. the breakfast was good and the bacon to die for , the staff are very helpful. if you want a hotel with every thing on the door step then this is the one , opera house 5 mins walk and the ferrys are only 2 mins walk and the bridge is next door . would i stay at the hotel again YES I WOULD ! OUT THE FRONT DOOR OF THE HOTEL AND YOUR IN THE ROCKS MARKET !

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location and views, but..”
Reviews.Author: JTMJTM
Reviews.Content: I had seen the rooftop pool of this hotel on previous visits to Sydney and promised myself a stay there one day. Booked a King Bed Executive room for a substantial rate expecting something special. Having flown in from Brisbane where I also stayed in a rivals Executive room I thought reception had given me the wrong keycard. I know rooms in Sydney are small, have stayed in one that was shockingly small, but not for these prices. The room is dated and the bathrooms are relics from a by-gone era. On arrival reception did not have a convertor plug they could rent out. The key entry system for the door worked one time in 10. Room service consisted on 2 days of just making our bed and re-hanging our towels, plates and glasses weren't removed or cleaned. A call to reception for some emergency toiletries resulted in "we don't have any" (it was after 6pm so I guess housekeeping had gone home). The general look of the interior is dark and dingey, but in a good way. It fits in with the surrounding buildings and history of the area and although other people have commented negatively on that, it wasn't a problem for us. Location is the key to this hotel, you are minutes away from The Opera House, the bridge and Circular Quay and all the transport that gives you. The main CBD is a little further with all the shopping malls you could want. Although initially disappointed with the room and some aspects of the service, my time there was enjoyable and the rooftop pool is such a unique selling point with its views. Would I return? Yes, but only because I now know what to expect. I communicated my concerns to the hotel through their online feedback form and hopefully they can correct the little things that they can (housekeeping/guest amenities) and have a plan for more long term fixes (ripped carpets/terrible key entry system)

Reviews.Title: “Great location in historic Rocks area of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mikinblack
Reviews.Content: As you'll know from the Holiday Inn website it is located in old part of sydney called The Rocks which is very historic area about 2 mins walk from Circular Quay. If you like historic stuff its definitely the place to stay, otherwise I'd seek out more economic alternatives with similar amenities. First a couple of gripes....like others I am always disappointed when a large hotel chain doesn't offer free internet nowadays (I mean how much would it cost to put wireless routers in, seriously) but what annoyed me more (Tripadvisor censored my true feelings) was the hefty 1.5% surcharge I was charged to pay my bill by credit card. This is not mentioned on the official website (or is well hidden) and unless you have an Australian bank account and/or carry hefty amounts of cash, how else are you going to pay. And to blame the banks for this is very poor customer service in my opinion! Otherwise this is a decent hotel. Rooms are arranged around a central atrium and appearance is frankly prison-like due to the colour scheme (yellow) but our rooms were fine. Luckily we were allocated a front-facing room on 7th floor with great views of opera house and harbour bridge. Don't worry about room location too much though because you get a great view of both from the rooftop terrace (unless there is a big cruise ship in Circular Quay which can obscure view of opera house). Our bed was very comfortable and noise wasn't a problem although front facing rooms on lower floors might get some road noise. Room was clean and regularly serviced during our stay. Air-conditioning was fine. Breakfast was buffet style with a wide choice and plenty of food available and they had a chef cooking eggs fresh in whatever style took your fancy. They don't serve lunch or dinner but there are plenty of restaurants within couple of mins walk (although be warned that many/most will stop serving early around 9 pm ish!). Hotel has a small bar serving bottled beers, spirits and wines but this also closes quite early (due to potential noise from atrium apparently). Shuttle service is offered at $14 AUD per person so if you are single traveller this is economic option of getting from/to airport. Unlike some other reviewers I found reception staff reasonably helpful (although one gave me bad advice about the closing time of a restaurant near Paddy's Market which caused some frustration to our party). Overall this is an expensive but decent hotel. You are basically paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smell awful”
Reviews.Author: Sakharam G
Reviews.Content: I had to keep my windows open - which amazingly don't open more than six inches. The reception staff was arrogant in providing information about airport transfer shuttles. Internet costs AUD 5 for 30 mins which I don't mind paying but shows poorly on the hotel's image. This place is expensive. I have never seen such a badly run holiday inn. No wonder it says in fine print 'ambassador hotel' run by holiday inn on one of the receipts. The only advantage is the location. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four and a half stars..........you must be joking!”
Reviews.Author: ayshaben
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 12th March 2011. We were completely disgusted. The room was dirty and in desperate need of a refurbish. Tap fell off in the bathroom, mould in the shower, kettle did not work. The only thing this hotel has going for it is it's location Definately do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve views fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Lucy787
Reviews.Content: we stayed for new years eve fireworks and although the staff said that the views were great from the roof top pool, I was dubious. We bought tickets with one of the boats that went out to view the 9 o'clock fireworks thinking that might be the better option. First, don;t believe anyone that tells you the 9 o'clock fireworks are bigger or as big as the midnight. They are not. Second, if you have come for the fireworks as we had, find the best possible location and stay there for the midnight fireworks as they are truly breathtaking, We did get to the roof top for mid night but it was luck as Sydney becomes gridlocked on new years eve. The fireworks and the view were spectacular and I am so glad we made it back because it was truly a once in a life time experience given the cost of staying in sydney during new years. As far as the hotel is concerned, the staff are lovely. Thank you Kelly and Hugh. The food is good, and really well priced given its a 4 star hotel. The rooms however are very small and really don't fit families that well although they try. The rooms are tired, the furniture is very tired and really do need a refurbishment given they would currently really only qualify for 3 stars or 31/2 stars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EngineerCoventry
Reviews.Content: Located in historic The Rocks area 5 mins from Circular Quay and the harbour bridge, a typical Holiday Inn, could do with a refurbish, small amount of black mould in the bathroom. Staff were very helpful food expensive lots of interesting places to try nearby or head into town, Would stay there again purely for the location and convenience

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Msmithy
Reviews.Content: * This hotel is in a great location for The Rocks area. * Staff were friendly. *Bathroom was not the best- rust stains from wall handle and mould all over the place. * Has the ability to open a window. We could also see the Opera house from the top floor window too. *Foyer was very warm.

Reviews.Title: “New years eve”
Reviews.Author: Dkkeeling
Reviews.Content: When booking the NYE dinner package read between the lines about the roof top area All was sorted amicably by the management

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve on Their Rooftop”
Reviews.Author: Dagny49
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry the other reviewer had a bad experience on NYE but I experienced the opposite. Everyone agrees that the hotel has an excellent location. I can't imagine a better one with such a great view of the Opera House and Bridge from the rooftop. The service was top notch. They might have been a bit slow to respond but it was a full house preparing for NYE. When they did respond, it was always with a sincere smile. They provided a complimentary bottle of champagne and free bubbly on the rooftop for all guests. The rooms were fine. I don't know why everyone is going on about the rooms being horrible. I thought they were fine. Our room had a black out screen so absolutely no light got into our room when my daughter took a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaser146
Reviews.Content: The Situation: My partner and I came to Sydney to see a concert at the Sydney Opera House. We stayed 2 nights and wanted to be walking distance to the Opera House. The Good: The Holiday Inn is located in The Rocks in Sydney. This is an historic area of Sydney and you can't beat walking out of your hotel and into a historic, cobble-stoned street that has been there since the beginning of Sydney. Its a great spot within walking distance to Circular Quay (ferries to the zoo, other parts of the city, train station, and more), the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Another great thing about this hotel: the rooftop pool has views of the Bridge and the Opera House! Just amazing - you can go for a swim and marvel at Sydney's beautiful harbour! The Bad: Its an old hotel, so the decor is old, and it looks a little bit tired. They have clearly upgraded all the rooms (nice new Samsung flat screen TV) but the lobby is still dated. Having said that, the rooms have everything you need and are really functional. The Ugly: There was a little bit of mould in the bathroom. That's it. Overall: Great location, great functional rooms, great staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year for 'Elite' Guest”
Reviews.Author: r15xeb
Reviews.Content: Great location, but like a prison! Horrible, dated rooms and have all the staff been sacked Fromm the local 1 star hotels - not a clue how to treat the guests! Where is the duty manager? Avoid if you can - Darling Harbour is so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but too much light through the window venetians”
Reviews.Author: ozadventurers
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for Sydney. The hotel is clean and well positioned, the rooms are adequate in size,flat screen television, beds are comfy and the bathroom is fine but more like a three star in its finishings and in its size, if that matters. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooftop pool is small but has a great view of Circular Quay and the Opera House. Even on boxing day the place is relatively quiet, air con was so quiet i had to check it was working. Our checkin was quick and without a problem. I booked through last minute .com and got a better rate. The main quip we have is that the wooden venetian blinds even when fully closed allow too much light through to the room and this kept my partner awake most of the night. Breakfast was good with lots of choice , a good selection of breads, raison fruit toast was the best I've had in a hotel, birchner muesli ( needs to be a bit sweeter) , eggs cooked to your liking, lots of fresh fruit, conserves and nice jams. Get a coffee next door at "Fine foods" as the hotels' coffee is very ordinary .

Reviews.Title: “Yes- You WILL be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: deharo
Reviews.Content: Unless you don't care about a bed way way past its prime then don't stay here. The bed was apallingly old and sagging. We stayed in a king room. The bathhroom is tiny (close the door before you have room to brush your teeth or move) and very tired. The air conditioner is one they retrieved from the ark and makes a noise as loud as a jet plane but is very inefficient. Anyone who says this hotel deserves 4 or five stars is lying. You might find a more comfortable bed around the corner in the youth hostel. The location is not worth the discomfort. The location is good, the staff were nice, and things were clean but the coffee in the breakfast buffet is undrinkable.

Reviews.Title: “On the Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: judgelarry
Reviews.Content: A truly great place to stay. convenient to circular Quay and therefore to all of Sydney. helpful pleasant staff, fantastic views from the rooftop pool. only drawack is that the elevator house obscures the view of the opera house if you are sitting in the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “You will be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel_4075
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready until after 4pm, we were offered a complimentary drink while we waited which we were then given a bill for,staff kept telling us " 10 more minutes" as I explained to them , it makes matters worse when you keep telling us 10 minutes as we are waiting here when in fact if we had been told it would be hours then we would of gone to do something,at that point I was told " we don't know when house keeping will have your room ready" when you pay nearly $300 for one night, you are entitled to be able to access your room by the advertised time . When the room was finally ready it was a shoe box , the smallest hotel room I have ever had with one small window, this room was so small the wall was on an angle, it looked like a storage room converted to a hotel room. The valet parking we paid $45 consisted of our car being left on the steep ramp and no assistance or even offer to help us with our bags and it was raining. I felt like i was staying at formula one, very cheap decorated rooms, budget furniture and poor service, this would have to be the worst hotel experience I have ever had and I paid nearly $300 a night, had already paid for another stay the following week so I was committed sadly to stay again, I will not return to this hotel ever again, they appear to be massively under staffed or unorganized , still waiting for my bill to be sent out as they " were not able to print one off" when we checked out. Good location is the only positive thing I could say as we spent the least amount of time possible at the hotel so we saw a lot of the rocks and the harbour but there are many other quality hotels close by and for the same money so we will be booking elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Everything at your door step!”
Reviews.Author: Bear80
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and quite big although very basic. We stayed in a king room, we mentioned it was a surprise for our anniversary. Thought it would have been nice to have a view which we didn't. The bathroom is tiny!! Needs updating too. The walls are thin. We were woken at 5am by the noise coming from outside the hotel. Hotel bar closes early too. Staff were nice and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Short Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I take a short holiday at the end of the school year (my wife's the teacher) to get her in the mood for a break from the day-to-day. This year we visited Sydney, saw some friends and took in a show. We stayed in the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. The hotel in i the best location in the heart of the Rocks (Historic) area of Sydney and close to everything. Circular Quay and the Opera House are but a few minutes walk away. The hotel itself is fine. We had a reasonable large room with a view of the Harbour Bridge out the window. The place was quiet and while we were out most of the day, the beds allowed for a good nights sleep so we could be up and going in the mornings. Three nights were great for us. Value for money would be a 7.5 on a 10 point scale but everything is about location. Another plus for this Hotel is the taxi rank straight outside the door with no waiting for transport to dash off to another part of the city. We'll be back when we want a weekend in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4.5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: frankderf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru H.W. it said it was a 4.5 star hotel in the rocks area. We had no idea of the hotel till after booking. After arriving and checking in we felt ripped off. We paid over $280.00 for one night. The room had dirty carpets , the windows had paint pealing, there was mold in the shower walls, also there were many marks on walls. The tile work in the bathroom looke like it was done by a kid. Tolite was dirty as well. We did not complain as we were leavening early the next day. A hotel rated this high should not need to be told of the problems. Hotwire should rethink how they rate hotels, this would be a 3 star at most. Location near cruise ship is only plus

Reviews.Title: “great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2010
Reviews.Content: Have stayed 4 times before - certainly not getting any better. Rooms and facilities average. Reception poor - no help with luggage. Location great but not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for location.”
Reviews.Author: Terence57
Reviews.Content: Rather a strange hotel. Not what you expect when you walk in. 2 or 3 old buildings have been joined together with a high atrium. All very cream and brown, a bit lacking in style and a cold atmosphere. They are busy renewing all the room doors in December 2011 but I can't quite see why as the new ones are no more attractive than the old! Staff were friendly and checked me in very quickly. I got an executive room which by the look of the others I saw (through the missing doors) was a good idea. Just that bit bigger. It had coffee & tea in the room, iron, dressing gown and an armchair. A/c of course. I spent 2 nights. Breakfast was the usual hot and cold buffet overlooking reception in the atrium. Eggs could be fashioned to your desires at a special egg corner! Some have complained about the price but they are charging for location and I could find no hotels in the "Rocks" area that were significantly cheaper. I paid $175 pn for a big room with king bed. Not so bad compared with other big cities. Stay away from "rip-off" WI-WI prices though! When will HI join the ever increasing ranks of hotel chains that understand WI FI should be free? Noisy? My room (3rd floor 320) overlooked a recreation plaza where Friday night is party night. But the music was all done by 10.30, the double glazing is great and noise is to be expected and perhaps enjoyed in this area! Arriving from the airport in the rush hour? Take the train and get off at CIRCULAR QUAY. It's an easy (flat) 5 or 6 minute walk up George St. keeping the water to your right. I took a shuttle and it was a 2 hour nightmare. This hotel is fine, a bit dull perhaps but depends what you want. They never made up my room but I didn't really care - I can make my own bed. At least I had a door!! Oh, and there IS the pool and view at the top - that's worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: anhonestjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days ( 5 days) to do the sights of Sydney. First off, this is a great location adjacent to the bridge and a few metres walk from the harbour. There is a wonderul view of the Opera House from the rooftop terrace area. The hotel could be a bit prone to noise from the street and nearby party houses, but there again, we didn't spend much time in our room anyway as there was too much to see and do, and we did it. We didn't eat at the hotel as there were plenty of alternatives nearby and we preferred breakfast al fresco by the harbour most mornings. Contrary to some reviews I recall reading before our stay, we found the staff very pleasant and accomodating to our needs. Thank you. For us, this would be the only hotel we would use if ever we get the chance to return from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aussipom1
Reviews.Content: I took my niece to Sydney for 3 days for her birthday and this hotel is PERFECT, its close to everything you'll want to do, the rooms are more than adequate, the rooftop view is very special indeed - we went up there every night. My only complaint was that a previous occupant had spilt a cup of tea/coffee and it was still on the wall behind the dresser/desk. However it was immediately cleaned up when i left a note for housekeeping. Good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: raetia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first two nights on my latest visit to Australia. Arriving in Sydney on an early morning flight, I headed directly to the hotel to have breakfast and drop my bags off. Just made breakfast within the allocated time and was delighted to be offered early check in, which mean I could shower and shave before heading into our office. The positives were the location (just a few minutes walk to circular quay), the breakfast area and the rooftop pool and lounge area (which offered a view towards the bridge, opera house and circular quay). Negatives were the secondary glazing didn't keep out any noise from street level. I expected a few nights disturbed sleep after the flight from London, but the row outside was for me too much. Secondly some the breakfast staff seemed more intent on talking amongst themselves rather than manning the welcome desk, meaning many diners had a wait to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great of Locations.”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Old Sydney (located in the Rocks) was a real surprize. Located in an up-scale area overlooking the Bridge and Opera House, only minutes walk from the Circular Quay with access to all forms of transportation, is a perfect location to visit the city and surrounding areas. The rooftop pool and spa have fabulous views of the City. The hotel is typical in the terms of being clean with large rooms(nothing special), complete with flat screen tv's with satellite, coffee service, and a safe. The staff are outstanding in customer service - very friendly and helpful. Also, on the 4th floor is guest laundry for $2 each/load - powder included. Breakfast at the H.I. as all food in Sydney, is expensive. My only disappointment is that there is no free or low priced wi-fi in the rooms (very expensive). There is a business centre downstairs where the prices of internet is lower. Still - not sure why some hotels are slow to provide this service, but budget ones do. When in Sydney, purchase the Multi-City Transportation card. $20/day or $45-$57/week. With the perfect location of hotel, buses, ferries, and trains are virtually at your finger-tips. Included in the card, is all locations of the city and outside areas including the Blue Mountains - no need to take tour buses. Plus, the staff are available to assist you with your choices. On Friday/Saturday, right outside the hotel is the Farmers Market (complete with inexpensive great vendor food) and on Saturday/Sunday, again outside the hotel, is the weekend Market with lots of artisan and Australian-made trinkets. Lots to do in Sydney. Make sure to include a tour of the Sydney Opera House - well worth the $35 per person. As for the Bridge-Walk, you can walk across it without paying for a tour - you of course do not get the pleasure of crossing over the arches.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CRH160711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start of our month long holiday in australia. We chose it as it seemed fairly central and the roof top pool view. We were not disappointed. The view from the roof is stunning, our only wish was that the weather would have been nicer to be able to enjoy the pool as well. Rooms were clean and ok. When we were there sydney was having really bad weather and torrential rain (July 2011) and the room did get cold at times. Downstairs though was a fire to sit around. Happy hour at the bar was a great addition as well. Hotel is next to the rocks market at weekends which is great. A short walk to the ferry terminals for manly, toronga etc. Your are virtually underneath the harbour bridge and can look out of your window and see people climbing it. Fantastic stay from start to end and only regret that we didn't return to this hotel on our return to sydney before we moved on (we decide to treat ourselves to a "5*" hotel nearby and was a let down). Would return here again if ever back in sydney...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but drab hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonJ45
Reviews.Content: I give this a 'Very Good' rating purely based on its location, 5 minutes from Circular Quay and with great views of Sydney Harbour, Bridge and Opera House from the rooftop swimming area. As a hotel, its pretty basic and in need of a good refurb. We booked 10 months in advance through Trailfinders and asked for a harbour view room. We were shocked to be initially given the most drab, basic and claustrophobic room we have ever seen. It also only looked out onto a rocky wall. After returning to the desk and complaining that the room wasn't acceptable, we were offered a King room with a view of the Opera House for an extra upgrade fee of $30 per night. After a bit of negotiation, this was then amended to include full breakfast. As we were there for 7 nights, the King room was definitely an improvement, but nowhere near as good as those in previous hotels of the same rating that we have stayed in. 'The Rocks' area of Sydney is very quaint and follows a particular formula for design and decor which is mainly of beige colouring. The Holiday Inn follows this to the extreme, even the pictures are unexciting and drab. However, we did have a very busy and enjoyable week in Sydney, and being only a 5 minute walk from the Ferries and Trains at Circular key was a huge bonus. (Buy the zone one 7 day metro tickets for $41 and you get total use of the Ferries, Buses, Tram, and zone one trains). The other plus for the hotel was very reasonably priced and good quality room service which was also available from the small lobby bar. Would I use this hotel again? Yes, but only for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great views”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the rocks, and is walking distance to the Sydney Opera house, the Harbour Bridge, the ferries, the train station as well as some good pubs and cafes. The rooms are average and a little pricey for a Holiday Inn. But you are paying for the location. Eat out, there is a lot of choice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for wandering around downtown Sydeny”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: First off, if you're a North American traveler, Holiday Inn in Australia is a class up from what I've seen here. I was a little leery to say the least. However the pics on their site are real and true. The hotel itself is (I think) two older buildings made into one - the floor arrangement looks a little strange. The roof view is awesome - you can see the Opera House right there! There are tons of restaurants within walking distance, there was some sort of summer outdoor street market right there. Very easy walking distance to Circular Quay where all the busses/ferries/trains are. The breakfast buffet was well done. Standard large chain fair but well done. The staff was always very cheerful and nice. Beware parking is non existant so you almost must use their $35/day valet. No big deal if you plan for it, but that's one surprise that can really add cost fi you're not aware. Also, as we found all over Australia, WiFi is ridiculously expensive compared to North America. All in all a great place to explore the Rocks from.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: kd2226
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children ages 14 and 11) . We booked the Holiday Inn Old Sydney as a mystery deal and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Good: Incredible location in the historical "Rocks" area of Sydney - just a few minutes walk to Circular Quay, the ferries, the train and the Opera House and right next to the Harbour Bridge and the Rocks markets (held on Sat and Sun each weekend). We really enjoyed the markets - many lovely craft items that would make great souvenirs for anyone visiting Sydney. We also walked straight up George Street into the heart of the city - probably about a 15 to 20 minute walk. There are many restaurants around the Holiday Inn. Many of them were quite expensive - but we found a really fun German restaurant/tavern in the street running behind the hotel. There is also a Subway and other takeaway shops behing the hotel - great for a quick and inexpensive lunch. The rooftop pool has the most incredible view of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house. While the building is old and the rooms are kind of dated, we found this to be charming and in keeping with the historical nature of the building and the area. The lobby area was inviting and atrium style, with the walkways to the rooms looking down over the lobby. There was a nice little bar area in the lobby. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The not-so-good: They charge $35 per day for parking. They call it valet, but it isn't true valet as there really isn't any place to pull up in front of the hotel and hand your car over. Instead my husband had to get back in the car after a 4 hour drive and go back into heavy traffic to go around the block and park it in an alley right next to the parking entrance before any one would take it off him - so, basically he did all the hassle, but they called it valet and charged us $35 per day. Either they need to figure out a way to make it true valet or call it self-parking and lower the price. While we really enjoyed this hotel (mostly because of the location), I can't honestly say that it was good value as, even with the mystery deal, it was over $200 a night. I find it difficult to consider any hotel at that price good value - but, unfortunately, that was as good as we could find anywhere near the Sydney CBD. The bathroom was rather small and had no character. We really enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney and would recommend it. We will stay there again if we can get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: SummertimebluesUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family. Excellent location and very well trained and pleasant staff, The view from the roof was brilliant and it was excellent location to walk out from in the morning, The staff went out of their way to be helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location but product knowledge”
Reviews.Author: humbleboy
Reviews.Content: I am awed by this property and I must admit that this property has what it takes to a breathtaking scenery. Waking up being next to Circular Quayis what most people wants to see; The Sydney Opera House, the Harbour, and most of all close proximity to some of Sydney's greatest eateries such as the Quay or even the Observation Deck. The check in speed was alright though the priority went to the phone first after the Receptionist already greeted me. Of course I didn't want to say anything about it. The hotel probably needs a bit of refurb given the fact, it's supposed to be an uplifting property after Holiday Inn has been "Refreshed" globally. As a member of the Platinum Ambassador program of the InterContinental Hotels ( or equivalent to the Priority Club Platinum status), I fel something should have been done as I do not receive any amenities in my room nor do I feel special other than the 2pm late check out offer that was offered. General knowledge has often been overlooked and directions were not being able to be visualized by staffs when directing over the phone. I have to run for an appointment and I have passed on a message requesting a staff to assist me with directions but to no avail after checking out, the puzzle has not been resolved. Thankfully the Information Centre at the station helped me a lot than a hotel concierge. To sum all up, the hotel was great in the sense it made me feel at home with the old fashion building style with the Refresh mood in which many Holiday Inns around the world has offered. But lots more work needs to be done to climb up the ladder in terms of ranking here.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in September 2011 for 6 nights, we read previous review, and was unsure, but we had no worries, the room was comfortable and could not fault the location, the view from our hotel room was looking out on to the harbour, we arrived on the Saturday night, the market was on in the morning outside our room, we did not hear a thing, the room was quite on our stay, the view from the roof top was stunning, the bridge is about 300 meters away and the opera house just across the harbour, we did not have breakfast in the hotel, we used a little cafe along the road(go out of the hotel and turn right can't remember the name) we did find Sydney expensive , in fact we found Australia expensive, But we thought Sydney was fanatic, lot's to do and see, we hired a tandem from bonza bike hire, and went on a tour of the city, a good way to find your way round and had a fabulous day, captain cook sunset dinner cruise is not worth the money, you would be better off catching the ferry and going to manly beach, have a meal and catch the ferry back into the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: carolyng26
Reviews.Content: Our family stay was for just 1 night prior to an international flight so we chose this hotel, smack-bang in the middle of The Rocks area, so the kids could see a lot of sights within walking distance. The taxi fare to this hotel from the domestic airport was $45. The room itself was small which we were expecting, but even with 4 people the size wasn't intolerable for us. The beds were comfy with a choice of 2 pillows - soft or firm. The window blind was great - not one bit of daylight came through when the shade was down. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, instead we chose to eat at "G'Day Cafe" around the corner - good, reasonably priced breaky in a tiny, atmospheric old building. The view from the hotel rooftop is stunning - Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay. We caught a train over the bridge to Luna Park and a ferry back, which the kids loved.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Of A Find In Sydney's Circular Quay / Rocks District”
Reviews.Author: aussiejohn69
Reviews.Content: Must say upfront that this was not my first accomodation choice for a three day conference in Sydney, but after looking for a good hotel within walking distance of my Circular Quay conference venue this was one of the few that we're not priced in the $400 - $500 range. Checkin was a breeze with extremely helpful front desk staff and at 8.00am they found a room for me that was ready and even organized complementary gym passes at a near by Fitness First Gym as they do not have one on site. My room was on the second floor and was nicely furnished, modern and clean, with a number of different pillow choices available in the room. My room was comfy and quite and apart from a bathroom that needed a bit of a make over, this was a great value room in this location for $200 per night. Breakfast in the hotels small restaurant was amazing value with an excellent buffet and omelette / egg chef. At $18.00 per person the meal rivaled the ridiculously over priced Four Seasons buffet a few minutes further up the road. I strongly recommend this hotel for any traveller looking for good service and comfortable accommodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but ready for a refurb”
Reviews.Author: tyketyke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 26th/27th September 2011 in Room 432, paying approx UK Â£100 pppn. Basically, as most guests have observed, this is a fantastic location but the room was overdue redecoration and the plumbing certainly seems a bit antiquated. We arrived from the airport by the Sydney train link which stops at the Circular Quay, this hotel is about a ten minute walk from the station. The hotel is triangular in shape with a large open atrium. Room seemed a little on the shabby side and not too clean, a quantity of breakfast cereal was by a bedside cabinet - not gone after turnround. En suite small. The views from the room and the rooftop pool (small) were absolutely fantastic. From this hotel you can easily walk into the city or to the nearby circular quay with ferries to anywhere around the harbour (cheaper than a harbour tour!). The breakfasts are great and good value but do order your eggs before you start foraging, otherwise they will arrive long after you've finished your bacon.Silly details like that could be improved. There is no need to charge for wifi (you'll find free public access anyway) and we rather resented paying A$ 8.50 for a small bottle of beer in the bar. There are any number of friendly pubs nearby where a pint will cost you A$7. These are minor complaints - the location sells this hotel - you'll pay less to be in the suburbs but then you have to pay to get to the centre. Top tip in Sydney - find the Brooklyn Hotel and enjoy superb steak for only A$ 10 - a bargain!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great location”
Reviews.Author: ScientistOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in the ancient quarter the rocks with lots of bars and restaurants nearby and all sights at walking distance ( opera house, habour bridge, darling habour, circular quay). We had a room on 8th floor not far from the roof terrace. From the terrace we had a spectacular view towards the harbour bridge and the opera house.The room size was ok for 2 people with 3 suitcases and perfectly clean and had air condition. The room was not cold, although the wooden windows did not insulate completely and the weather was quit chilly. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. there was cooked breakfast, toast, cereals, fruits, even an juicer. The best was the egg station were you could get omlettes and french toast at your choice. Staff was very friendly and hepful. We would always stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Jennie M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location but the hotel needs some renovations. Very comfortable bed and pillows abut bathroom tired. No mini-bar in rooms which is non-standard for Holiday Inn. I woke in the morning and wanted a cold drink and there was nothing there.

Reviews.Title: “cheap buffet breakfast (but not that nice)”
Reviews.Author: benandlara
Reviews.Content: You cant argue about the location and they will let you have two kids in your room unlike many CBD options....the higher floors may see bridge to the north or opera house to the east (I guess room 830 has both). The buffet breakfast looked like a buffet breakfast but tasted of nothing....not even my kids were excited about it. Order you eggs as soon as you get downstairs or risk checking out before they are cooked.
