After four days I would have rather had a good cup of coffee and a nice pastry just outside down the lane than endure the buffet. The steps half a block south on argyle street lead up to the bridge. There are lots of excellent expensive restaurants nearby (david thompson,neil perry, doyles...) but lots of expensive average restaurants. There are not many cheaper meals in this area. There are lots of places to drink nearby so perhaps friday/saturday nights will have a rougher crowd on the streets. The sauna is now a storeroom and the token pool is about 5*10m ....but you can swim and look at the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and location”
Reviews.Author: Paula C
Reviews.Content: Our family have stayed here several times - location is grear, the view from pool is amazing, rooms and service are good value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect possition”
Reviews.Author: jollygilly
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 9 days with my husband in Sept 2011. The hotel is in a perfect area - close to ferrys and walking distance from bridge, opera house, shops and harbour. Hotel itself is clean and the staff are very helpfull. The buffet breakfast is worth paying for in advance - great choice - and as Sydney is very expensive, it's better to have a strong breakfast before you set off for the day. Hotel also has a laundry room which is a bonus. If I went back to Sydney, I would stay at this hotel again. Hop-on, hop-off bus stops in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “holiday inn ols sydney”
Reviews.Author: colhogg
Reviews.Content: just spent 8 nights there sept 2011, loveley hotel , nice clean rooms ,breakfast was fantastic , ideal location for visiting sydney , staff very welcoming , only fault was we had a room next to where the market was and it could be a bit noisy around 4.30 am , on the whole though very good had a great time would definateley recommend this hotel 9/10 mr and mrs hogg

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, good breakfast in The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: lexie12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in August and again for 2 nights in September, at the end of our Aussie trip. The room was ready on arrival early morning from Canada, which we so appreciated. The staff was friendly and helpful and our room was upgraded for the first 2 nights. The location is, I believe, the main selling point as it is in The Rocks within short walking distance to the Bridge, Circular Quay, Opera House, etc and The Rocks itself is a charming area with many restaurants and pubs. The view from the rooftop is terrific, and there is also a heated outdoor pool and spa which looked clean and inviting. The rooms too were clean and comfortable with all necessities. I have only two negative comments: the internet access is fairly expensive, and although our upgraded room on the fourth floor had a wonderful view of the harbour and Opera House, we were awakened in the wee hours of the morning both nights due to drunken revelry on the street below, and on our return trip, were awoken by a false fire alarm (we overheard staff saying it was due to a guest having a steamy shower). We recognize both things were not under the hotel's control, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: aloisw8
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the crack of dawn from Singapore expecting to spend the day camped out on chilly Circular Quay awaiting our check-in time...know the feeling? However the delightful reception staff upon seeing my 'priority club' card offered us a newly refurbished room overlooking the beautiful opera house and harbour...we are eternally grateful for this element of personal recognition. The hotel management are always available to contact should the need arise The hotel may not be 5* but doesn't promise to be, but they sure know how to treat their guests. Fabulous location, caring staff and a view to die for at a reasonable price by Sydney standards. I only wish that the internet access charges weren't so unnecessarily high....but this will not put me off returning to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab pool and view”
Reviews.Author: sarahlivSouthport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in august with my partner and 15 year old daughter. All the usual trimmings you,d expect with a holiday inn. Very comfy. Extra bed wasn,t there on checking in but was quickly brought up. Helpful staff and free brollies to battle the rain we had!! It is well located near to the bridge and 5 mins to the ferry terminal where you can get to manly island etc. The icing on the cake is the pool right at the top of the hotel where you can have a hot tub and enjoy the sydney skyline. Breakfast selection ok. There was a voucher put through the door overnight for reduced price hot breakfast so maybe worth hanging on before pre booking!!

Reviews.Title: “Got a great last minute deal here, but worth seeking out.”
Reviews.Author: sfendt
Reviews.Content: I had a couple personal day on my business trip to Sydney, and needed a last minute place to stay. I was referred here and very glad I was. Rooms was spacious and clean. I had an 8th floor room and a view of the opera house from my window. Staff was helpful and friendly through the stay. Internet access was pricy, but unlimited and very fast. A very nice place to stay, and enjoy The Rocks and Circular Quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrsSBJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently with our two children & were so impressed with everything about the hotel. The rooms were clean with great views over Circular Quay & the views of the Opera House and the bridge from the rooftop pool were absolutely spectacular. The hotel is located within a short walk to all the things you head to Sydney to see. The price was pretty great also, we really didn't expect a great deal as we got the room so cheap but when we got there it was a very pleasant surprise. The buffet breakfast is also worth a visit as the kids eat free so worked out to be better than eating elsewhere. We will definately be back to stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all bad”
Reviews.Author: YorkieGorilla
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome. The hotel itself is fine but becoming slightly dated. Once you got used to the odd design of what was an internal courtyard then it was fine. We upgraded our room - the bed was extremely comfortable, the TV was large but the room footprint was pretty small - I hate to think what size a standard room is! Bathroom was showing its age. But - the staff were unanimously pleasant and friendly. The breakfast was extremely good and location, location, location is what this is about. The Observer pub next door is an added bonus - Cascade Pale Ale or Fat Yak - yum, yum!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Gemma W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location just a short stroll from the harbour bridge and opera house. Room was very light and spacious with everything you could need. Beds were extremely comfortable. Had views over the city. Only crticism is the bathroom was a little dated and could do with a facelift but that really is being hyper critical. Foyer and bar area was nice and a great meeting point. The highlight of this hotel is the rooftop terrace complete with pool and stunning views over the harbour and the opera house. Excellent location - would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TF3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Australia and would reccommend the Old Sydney Holiday Inn. The rooms were comfortable but the location at the Rocks was ideal. Right by the Bridge and Circular Quay. Great views from the hotel roof.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but don't forget your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Superpear
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews about this hotel and was somewhat worried about making a booking. However, nearly all of them turned out to be unfounded. The location of the hotel cannot be faulted. You are in the beautiful area of The Rocks (the oldest part of Sydney) so you can explore the alleyways full of eateries and shops, plus there is the excellent market on Saturday's and Sunday's. Circular Quay for the ferries, buses and trains is less than 5 minutes walk away. Our room was adequately sized plus they have been recently refurbished. While we were there, you could see other rooms being re-carpeted and worked on, so things are improving at this hotel. The open central atrium did not create a problem for us with hearing doors close or noisy kids. The buffet breakfast was very good, the in room TV's were huge, storage was good, and the views from the roof of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge are spectacular. Now for the faults. The swimming pool is small and only suitable for 'a dip' and not lengths. The bathroom was compact and the quality of tiling in our room was dubious. The aircon was ridiculously noisy and fortunately Sydney was cool enough in August that we could leave it off. However, the biggest problem we had was external noise, hence you need your earplus. We stayed 3 nights (Sat, Sun & Mon) and was on the 4th floor. On the Saturday night the bar across the alley was very noisy through to 2am. Fortunately there was no noise from the bar on Sunday and Monday night. But if you are staying a weekend, bring your earplugs. One other complaint:- the bed was very hard!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ke1thred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the start of our Australia trip. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Old Sydney has some excellent restaurants and many of the City's attractions are within walking distance. Circular quay is 2 minutes walk, the bridghe 5 minutes the opera house and botanic gardens 10 - 15 minutes. The hotel itself is standard holiday inn, well laid out, clean and comfortable. We only used the restaurant for breakfasts which were very good. The staff were all helpful and friendly. A great City break can be had from here as a base. We enjoyed relaxing on the roof top but as this was Aussie winter the pool was too cold to risk! The views from here are good too.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: 84Cedarhouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed briefly at this hotel whilst attending a wedding in Sydney with my daughter and 2 week old grand daughter. The hotel was very handy (walking distance) to "The Garrison Church" where the wedding was held and followed by the Reception (walking distance again) at "The Waterfront" restaurant. The hotel itself is clean and tidy, the room that we had was on the 3rd floor so the view was looking between 2 buildings towards the water, smallish in size but serviceable for what we required. The furnishings in the room are modern, the bathrooms are showing a little wear and tear now but still very nice - all white, the baths could be replaced as they have lost all their shiny enamel from them. The room contained a fridge, electric kettle, 2 coffee mugs, 2 teaspoons, 2 wine glasses, 2 drinking glasses, various tea and coffee condiments but only 1 packet of biscuits containing 2 cookies) Come on Holiday Inn, if the room caters for 2 guests provide 2 packets of biscuits - a little stingy I thought. The walls are thin in the rooms as we could hear the people in the next room talking and laughing. Also I would like to point out to management was we received a knock at the door in the afternoon from one of your staff wishing us a welcome to the hotel and a Happy Birthday greeting. Wrong room, wrong person, she had been instructed that a Mr Hogwart was staying in our room (was someone from Harry Potter visiting). Your staff member did apologise and was very embarrassed by it all, and needed to check with services to find the true Mr Hogwart. He was not traveling with us I can tell you that. The main foyer (atrium) is very light with plenty of lounges in pocket areas around to sit on and a lovely fireplace area that was very popular to sit by. Please remove the fake library books from the foyer area they look very tacky. All of the rooms open from this main atrium so it looks like verandahs on the inside looking down. When my daughter made the initial booking through the hotel she did advise reservations that she was traveling with a 2 week old infant but unfortunately we were given a corner room that required getting up and down 6-8 stairs; very impracticable when you have a pram which is kind of necessary with a 2 week old infant. Checking in to this hotel if you arrive by car is difficult as they only have 2 x 15min parking bays at the front. And if these 2 spots are taken good luck with checking in. Parking was another issue we were advised to arrive early to secure parking space at the hotel and were advised at the time of booking that as long as we arrived by 2pm we should be able to secure a spot. We arrived early at 1pm and parking was all booked out. We were given a map of the closest Wilson parking station which was around a 200m walk from the hotel at a reduced overnight rate of $25. Inconvenient when you are traveling with an infant and so you could not come and go to your vehicle with ease. All staff at Reception were friendly and courteous. I did not eat breakfast here so cannot comment on that experience, nor did I visit the pool area. The hotel is handy to the Rocks area, but advised don't bring your vehicle to this hotel especially if you need to use it during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: pepper1108
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay. Very close to the bridge which comes handy if you would like to do the climb. Friendly and helpful staff. The pool on the roof top is very tiny. The room didn't smell too fresh but it was clean.I only stayed for a night so it was okay.I had a higher floor request at no additional cost and got it .The view was pretty cool as i saw Harbour Bridge and Opera House from my room

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two teenage children. The Holiday Inn Old Sydney Harbour Rocks is clean, spacious, modern and comfortable. We requested adjoining rooms which were not available on arrival but this was rectified in the morning with an up grade. Great location! We recommend a room with Opera House/Bridge views. Breakfast was a little expensive but there are lots of places to eat in this location. Try the BBQ restaurant Phillip's Foote on George Street for an Australian BBQ experience! The roof top terrace pool is small, but has stunning views over the city. The harbour bridge climb is a MUST DO activity! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great views, walking distance to everything!”
Reviews.Author: suziwong65
Reviews.Content: So enjoyed the closeness to everything in the Rocks area. Did not need a car. Great markets! Wonderful restaurants, had a lovely dinner at Peter Doyles, great view & huge servings. Staff of the HI really helpful. Lovely room, nice view of Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but in need of a big refurb”
Reviews.Author: Yellabrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to an early departure from SYD the next morning. We booked using priority points so can't really complain when in effect we stayed 'for free'. The staff were friendly and efficient on check in. Our room was on the fifth floor to the front of the building and we just missed out on a harbour bridge view by a few metres. The room was pretty old and shabby, the carpets worn and the bathroom in dire need of replacement, but it was clean and the beds two double beds were comfortable with a great selection of pillows to choose from. Having lived in Sydney for the last few years I'd walked past this hotel many a time, but never stepped inside. It's pretty impressive upon entering, with an atrium that reaches right up to the top of the hotel, and all the rooms surrounding this central space - it looks good, but didn't prove practical as we could hear people chatting in the bar and the doors of other peoples rooms slamming shut well into the earlier hours as it reverberated around the huge space. We were also diwssapointed to find the restaurant, which we'd found menu's etc for on the internet prior to booking, was only open for breakfast - we'd made arrangements to meet up with friends to say goodbye and while the bar menu ended up sufficing this was a bit of a dissapointment. I'd imagine most people chosing to stay here would be visiting as tourists - my advice... there are much better hotels in the viscinity to enable you to get the most out of your holiday with a decent nights sleep and comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kiwiKento
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a base to explore Sydney for the weekend. The great thing about this hotel is that it is just a stones throw from the Sydney Harbour Bridge and therefore many of Sydney's other key attractions. The Holiday Inn Old Sydney is located in an area also known as "The Rocks" and is a very short stroll to Circular Quay where you can enjoy the many restaurants or as I would suggest - catch a ferry to any of the stops throughout Sydney Harbour. (Darling Harbour is a great spot to get off and have a walk around.) The Holiday Inn for its great location, is a very underwhelming hotel and at best could only be considered average. I am usually pretty generous in my reviews, however it is quite difficult to be generous when reviewing the hotel layout or rooms. The floors are split and therefore half of the rooms on every floor are half a level lower and make you feel like you are walking down towards a dungeon. These half level hallways are dark and dingy and not at all welcoming. The rooms themselves are very small and quite expensive - you are definitely paying for the location at this place!! In terms of the amenities: there is a very cool pool and jacuzzi up on the roof with great views of the Sydney Inner City, however is only any good in the summer as in the winter (when we were there) it is ridiculously cold and unusable. The bar downstairs is small and we found ourselves waiting a long time to be served. We also witnessed the bar staff on numerous occasions fail to make the cocktails correctly as per their own menu. We had a look at the breakfast on offer and it looked in no way appealing so decided to find a nearby cafe on Circular Quay. I would not recommend this hotel if you are after a decent room, there are a number of other hotels nearby that offer far better rooms. I would however recommend it if the room does not matter at all and you require a good location to explore Sydney's famous landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too expensive.... for the old and tired.....”
Reviews.Author: redsienna
Reviews.Content: A great location but a tad tired with patronizing reception staff. I booked for two adults and one child and when we got there they gave us a double bed. When I called they said they would give us a single bed at no chargeâ€¦. Big deal as I had already paid a huge amount for two nights. When I went downstairs one of the receptionists tried to give me a lecture about booking onlineâ€¦ It was totally unnecessary as I book online around the world constantly. If the hotel had been serious they would have sent me an email before I arrived. We were also given a room with a bathroom for a wheelchair so apart from feeling like you were in a hospital when you went to the bathroom, the lecture in online booking the hotel was OK, but certainly not even close to one of the best we have stayed in around the world. We did find a fabulous French restaurant across the road that we were very impressed with. But I probably would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! A tad run down.”
Reviews.Author: BearsTravels
Reviews.Content: Was over visiting for a short period of time in Sydney and wanted to spend a night in the Rocks area. As far as location you can't get any better. Skip paying for the upgrade for a view and just head up the the 8th floor deck. Mind blowing view...and you are allowed to bring up your own food and beverages. Highly recommend a drink at sunset. The rooms themselves are below average and a tad musty. It was fine for one night but would have been unhappy if my whole trip was booked there.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: OzyFreddles
Reviews.Content: I stayed for an overnight business trip. The hotel is in a fantastic location, being in the centre of the Rocks , with fantastic view of the Harbour and Bridge. Unfortunately the staff do not seem to recognise Priority Club Platinum status, no upgrade, no additional welcome, no newspaper, and sadly the room I was given was very tired and in need of a refurb. Directly opposite the lift it was extremely noisy for most of the evening, fortunately I was up early so was not disturbed in the morning. I stayed on a cold wet winter evening and had difficulty warming the room ( only seemed to get cold air out of the fan). Out of choice, only the location would be the saving grace if I was in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room size a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Contessa22
Reviews.Content: Having had 2 weeks on the gold coast we were looking forward to visiting Sydney. My Sister who lives in Australia had booked the hotel for us - and it was in a great location just off Circular Quay. The hotel is clean but food wise only offers breakfast or room service meals. We felt that they could have made better use of the large open space in reception. We are a family of 3, and the room was very small once the extra bed was put in. We did have a view of the Harbour Bridge and the view from the roof is lovely. Upon check out, we were surprised that we could not claim any points on our card as the room was booked though a third party, also "you have not even eaten in the hotel" was a comment made by the receptionist as part of the reason for us not being given our points - well I didn't want to sit in a hotel room to have my dinner - when there were fantastic restaurants so close by. To summarise - this was just a room with a bed - clean - good location - but didn't have any great wow factor .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views.”
Reviews.Author: turcottejt
Reviews.Content: I checked out of my original hotel to check into this hotel. It was fun, conveinent, and cheaper than the original booking. I recommend this to the solo or couple traveler. Free breakfast was excellent, and the staff was super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Diedre_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney because we hadn't been there in some years; it's next door to the great Rocks Markets at the weekend and within walking distance of the Quay. Reception staff were helpful with bags, parking etc. ($35 a night) but the room was quite small, although it had a great view over the harbour. Breakfast was included in the tariff and was good. Only problem we found was the family next door who constantly entered and exited their room, banging the door every time. The children in the family were extremely loud and cried all night. Additionally, a group of drunken women entertained the world in the corridor around 3am for half an hour. Walls are thin, pity, the hotel is in a great position and we'll probably go back sometime. Staff provided an umbrella immediately when rain started, and the bar with open fire in the lobby was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views! Wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: VCATL2010
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip through Down Under Answers (a travel company in the US) our wonderful agent, Matt, suggested this hotel for our trip knowing the area well. I had looked at the reviews and pics online and expected that most were likely taken with a long camera lens and was just hoping we could at least have a glimpse of the opera house from the roof (though my expectations were low). I was beyond overjoyed the first time I stepped foot on the roof...I COULD NOT BELIEVE the view of both the opera house AND Harbour Bridge. They were SO close and the pictures I was able to take on my own were just beautiful! Having arrived from the US, we awoke pretty early the 1st morning and were able to take advantage of seeing the sun rise over the Opera House. It was just an incredible way to start our trip. If I ever return to Sydney, I will be sure to stay at this hotel again. It was FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Terryl-55
Reviews.Content: The key to this hotel is where it is. In the heart of Sydney's historic Rocks district, in the shadow of the Harbour Bridge. minutes from Circular Quay and the Opera House. The hotel started life as a Park Royal in the 1980's when I was living in Sydney. Since moving I have come to appreciate it as a great place to stay especially when you want to be in the heart of Sydney. The rooms facing George Street have views to kill for. The rooms in the back are quiet, all rooms open out to a large atrium. Just make sure you enjoy a sunset from the roof top pool deck with a drink of your choosing.

Reviews.Title: “a four night stopover from hong kong via sydney to perth”
Reviews.Author: 186390Graham
Reviews.Content: the hotel was chosen by travel bag, excellent choice we had a room at the top we looked one way was the sydney harboure bridge and the other way was the sydney opera house with a lovley swimming pool on the roof

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mosey26
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Rocks Area. View from room of the bridge, and from the roof add the opera house too. Our room was spacious, crisp linen changed frequently and very quiet. Lots of tourist options within walking distance including craft market outside the front door. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for anything”
Reviews.Author: writerstout
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with large clean rooms and accomodating staff. That makes it a good hotel. Where it sits makes it a great hotel. Located in the heart of 'The Rocks', the original section of Sydney where the convicts were unloaded after their voyage from England, the hotel is squished in almost under the Sydney Bridge. A great feature is the roof-top pool area and viewing section giving an unobstructed view of the Sydney Opera House and the ferry boat depot. When you walk out the door, it is constant action, great restaurants and rocking Aussie bars, most with very loud live music and lots of beer. On the weekends some of the streets around the hotel are closed for a street market where just about everything is for sale. My wife and I loved it and would stay at this hotel again should we return down under.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and rooftop pool - getting a bit tired...”
Reviews.Author: wombatdavid
Reviews.Content: You stay here for the location in the centre of the Rocks historical area in Sydney. The hotel was a large atrium area and we were welcomed in a friendly way and allocated a room on the top floor as requested. We used our reward points to stay here which also gave us a newspaper in the morning (which never showed up - never mind!). The room was large with a nice modern looking bed, but did not have any pictures up so was a little "cold". The bathroom was tiny and needed a renovation. We had a large TV with all the digital channels and a fridge with a "minibar menu" (but not stocked so you would have had to call - isn't this room service not a minibar?). The highlight of the hotel is the small rooftop pool with amazing views over the Opera House and city. Overall, a pleasant stay as we were using points, but the hotel is a little tired - eg some paintwork not in good condition, window frames need replacing, bathroom very old. I would stay here again if I could get a good price, but this is not luxury - you are paying for the location. Another negative is that there are only 2 lifts which took a while to come.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Savy_Sydney_Lily
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on 10 July 2011, unfortunately for one night only. We booked online, the morning we checked in. Check in was quick and uneventful, even though we arrived prior to midday. The keys to the room played up a bit, but they can do so at any hotel i guess. One of the staff members showed me a method at making the key work every time, which did the trick. The room itself was comfortable. We were on the 3rd level but had no problems with noise at all - maybe because we were there on a Sunday night?. No issue with noise from the lobby area nor the nearby Rocks market which our window faced directly over. Bathroom (particularly bath tub) a tad small. The only real complaint would be the Movies channel. We tried watching a movie, and about 20 minutes into it, it kept cutting out, which meant we had to restart the program again (we were ultimately only charged once), but could not fast forward. After 3 attempts, we gave up and went to sleep. The best part of the stay for me was the quiet and cosy lobby area, where i sipped tea for hours. It was so relaxing after a long day walking about the City; with a nice open fireplace to boot. I really liked the atrium aspect of the hotel (very pretty), and the hotel's great location. I would love at some point in the future to stay here again, as i have very pleasant memories of our stay here. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CecileK3
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the lady that checked me in provided wonderful service. She mentioned that they had a roof top view. When I went up there it was an awe inspiring sight. The Harbour bridge lite up and the Operal House in all her glory. The location is wonderful to all the sights and they have plenty information on tours. My room was nice and I slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: Jules3377
Reviews.Content: This very popular Holiday Inn is in a fantasic location but is showing the signs of being very well used and is a little tatty round the edges. Having said that I would recommend the hotel and would stay again. The best thing is the location, the second best thing is the roof-top swimming pool. Its quite small but very welcome after a day of walking and exploring Sydney and has stunning views across the harbour. There was a hot tub too but unfortunately this was not working during our visit. Our room was below the pool so there was a little noise from the pumps but this was not a problem. The rooms are quite small and the bathroom was tiny with a rather worn bath and adequate shower over it. I hate shower curtains though! For the size of the bathroom it would be better to have a walk-in shower with a door and no bathtub. The staff were all very pleasant and although we were booked on a room only basis they did allow us a free breakfast one day as my husband was celebrating a special birthday. Breakfast was the usual buffet style with eggs cooked to order, it was fine. Public area of the hotel was attractive and quite cool with a lounge area where they did an evening happy hour on the drinks. A short walk from the hotel takes you everywhere you need to go in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this location”
Reviews.Author: RaeToGo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for visiting Sydney. In the heart of the historic Rocks district with phenomenal rooftop views of the Opera House and Harbour bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tazzalou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as part of our round the world honeymoon trip. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main attractions and in a really nice area of Sydney called the Rocks. It was a 10-minute walk to the marina with all the restaurants and bars and ferry stops to other areas etc. It was expensive to eat and drink around this area though. We had breakfast included at the hotel and this was one of the best breakfasts in a hotel like this we have ever had. The choice was amazing and a freshly made egg station made it even better, it kept us going for the whole day! Our room was great with a fantastic view of the opera house. There was very little noise from the road outside. The bed was large and comfortable and rooms were clean and modern. We had a bottle of champagne left for us which was a nice touch. The rooms also had tea/coffee making facilities, tv, safe, toiletries in the bathroom etc We used the Internet at the hotel which you buy vouchers for from reception and had no problem with it. The actually interior of the hotel initially looks like a prison with big yellow bricks and this would be our only very small negative but apart from that we couldn't fault it and would definitely return and recommend this hotel. The staff were very helpful, we had a problem one day with a tour that didn't turn up and the member of staff tried to ring them for us and then searched the internet and provided us with train times / routes etc so we could go ourselves and not have our day ruined. TIPS 1. Definitely do the Bridge climb even when itâ€™s pouring with rain. Yes it's expensive but it's also an incredible experience. Book online before you go and the photos are far cheaper. 2. Eating out is expensive but if you walk up from the hotel rather than into the marina area there are some cheaper pubs and many of them do deals on certain days you can pick up a little promotional book at any of them. 3. The hotel provides airport transfers which we used to return to the airport this was far cheaper than getting a taxi. 4. Pick up a free Sydney guide at the airport it has vouchers for money off certain attractions, we saved a lot of money going to the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalotuk
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for a Holiday Inn. Very good staff and rooms ok. Beds comfy but no in room bar although there is a refrigerator. No restaurant at night but room service and bar food. Overall good place and value

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and so welcome”
Reviews.Author: JockTamson
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Europe through the ash cloud and an early morning arrival in Sydney, we were promptly allocated rooms. A cot was provided for my baby grandchild and a wheelchair was arranged for my wife. Best of all we tumbled into the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and caught a few hours nap before sampling the sights of Sydney. The location was perfect and we will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS location!”
Reviews.Author: mjm122696
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot. Good number and good variety of eating establishments within a five minutes walk. Food market (on select days) was handy and fun. Easy stroll to catch bus or boat. Desk workers above average on helpfulness. (We did have one worker give us incorrect info about the internet charges, but am not grading them down for this. )Good, hot, yummy breakfast (could make your own smoothies) (One negative for us- Chef to prepare eggs didn't arrive until "late" (8:00 maybe?). We were ready to be out and about by this time. Not a serious negative.) Could see Opera House from the roof exactly as shown in photos. Has laundry facility. Would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: PattosCanberra
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night en route to Port Stephens from Canberra. Had a room with limited views of the harbour. No complaints at all. The hotel is located in the Rocks, near enough to CBD , but not impacted by noise from through traffic. It is certainly showing it's age, but doesn't detract from experience, easy walk to Circular Quay & rail/ferry network. Highlight is ease of parking at reasonable price. Have stayed at other Sydney hotels where parking is overpriced nightmare. Not so here, parking is easy access, on - site & valet offered for only $35.00/night. Buffet breakfast excellent, staff friendly & helpful, hotel will be first preference for next Sydney visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of historic Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KMCanberra
Reviews.Content: I had two nights on the top floor of this older-style hotel with views of old warehouses, Opera House and Harbour, which was fantastic. Very nice quite large room, impeccably maintained, with double-glazed windows that actually open - hooray for old hotels. Pity it is winter and too cold to want them open! My only complaint is that the room didn't get very warm despite heating being set at maximum, and the doona was very light; I doubled it over to get enough warmth. The outdoor pool on the 8th floor is a highlight of the hotel - not large, but fabulous location and views. Very nice helpful staff. Excellent breakfast which at about $20 was real value for money unlike in many of these big hotels. Being here for work I was initially a bit concerned that the Rocks area is a bit far from the business centre of Sydney, but I realised that it's only 15 minutes' pleasant walk to Martin Place and the central business area, and it's great to stay in the historic Rocks precinct. This hotel had a nice feel, is older-style and therefore not nearly as expensive as many others in central Sydney (about $200/night) and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location...Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: meandererme
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. After a fifteen hour flight, we arrived rather early, but the staff got us into our room promptly. The room was comfortable and clean. We did not experience noise problems here at all. The view from our window was beautiful. The staff was always more than happy to help us with local travel information. The location is superb...walk out the front door to the Harbor, short walk to the ferries, trains and buses. We loved this hotel and would highly recommend it for those staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn many times. I have noticed that it needs urgent refurbishment of the rooms. The furniture is starting to look very tired (i.e. damaged surfaces on desk and tv cabinet, the desk chair was broken). The mattress (we had a twin bedded room this time) was very uncomfortable and sagging. It is such a beautiful hotel and location. It's a shame that the rooms are starting to become neglected. The buffet breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: JJWA
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for one night before embarking on a cruise from Circular Quay. We couldnâ€™t have got closer accommodation if we tried. It was literally across the road and down a short walkway. The Rocks area is historic and interesting. Itâ€™s close by the bridge and close enough to walk to the Opera House. There are also plenty of eateries in the surrounding area. Some costing big bucks! So be warned. The ferry terminals are also close by. The staff at the front desk who checked us in were very friendly and informative of the local area. We arrived early and thankfully our room was available for us to leave our luggage and head off exploring. Our room was neat and tidy with 2 comfortable double beds and a small fridge. The bathroom had all the necessary complementary toiletries, plenty of towels and a hairdryer. Our room wasnâ€™t noisy as mentioned by some other guests who have written reviews, but that is possibly due to the fact we were at the back of the hotel, not overlooking the road? Breakfast the following morning was plentiful, including a self-serve juicer, pastries/toast, cereals, fruit and the usual cooked fare and tea & coffee. There was a small pool and spa on the roof top (which had great views over Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera house and surrounding areas) we didnâ€™t have time to use these facilities, but others were making the most of them. The hotel also has a storage room which we used to hold our luggage free of charge whilst we explored more of the city after checking out the following morning. Whilst staying there we misplaced our daughters Nintento DS & games and thankfully it was found and returned to us with no hassles. For that we are extremely grateful. All in all I would stay here again if in Sydney as the location is fantastic and the hospitality and service was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View for the price”
Reviews.Author: jamusaba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Rocks section of Sydney where this hotel is located. Our decent sized aroom was on the 7th floor with a view of the Sydney Opera House across from Circular Quay. No need for taxis, the hotel is convenient to Circular Quay trains and ferries and all the major Sydney sites are within walking distance. A word of warning though, the American dollar does not go very far in Sydney these days particularly if you are fond of fine dining. Fortunately, we found some passable moderately priced restaurants in the Rocks within walking distance of the hotel which BTW also provides a simple continental brekkie for $10 - 12 AUD. The nearest Coles (reasonably priced grocery store) is about one mile from the hotel. If you are travelling to Oz for an extended stay get to Coles. They are in every city. My only complaint with the hotel and it is a general one for all hotels in Oz is that the typical charge for wifi or internet connection is $25 per day. We brought an ipad and had to hoof it to McDonalds for free wifi, bummer. Sydney itself though is fabulous and this hotel could not be better located (check out the Royal Botanic Garden for great photos of the cockatoos, fox bats and the iconic view from Mrs. McQuarie's Chair). The ferry ride to Manly is awesome !

Reviews.Title: “Staff were very helpfull.”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo087
Reviews.Content: Much to my horror in getting back home and realising I'd misplaced a bag with a camera in it worth of over $5000 I rang and asked for there help in tracking down the wereabouts of the bag. At this stage i wasn't sure if i had left in the room or if it was left on the foot path or stolen maybe from trolly of luggage. With a full understanding of the situation they reviewed security footage and left no stones unturned they found the bag were i had left it. THANKYOU!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: jojozwp
Reviews.Content: After travelling with friends for a week, my husband and I had 1 night in Sydney before continuing our travels. We decided to splurge a little on a harbor view room at the Holiday Inn and were not dissapointed. On arriving at the hotel at 8.00am, we were told as you would expect that our room was not ready, but we could leave our luggage and a text message would be sent to us when our room was ready. We headed into Sydney CBD (approx 10 - 15 min walk) and indulged in some retail therapy. We received our text message mid morning and returned to the hotel around 2.00pm. Our bags had already been sent to our room. We were given our room key and proceeded to our room. The room was a deluxe harbor view room and was lovely. The views to the Opera House were stunning and the room large, clean and quiet., The hotel itself is perhaps a little dated, but we found the staff to be friendly, the room lovely and the location fantastic. The location is great, with many attractions and restraunts, cafes and bars right on your doorstep. The staff organised a shuttle to the airport the next morning, complete with wake up call. Have no complaints about this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the noisiest hotel in The Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Shortstayspecialist
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Old Sydney 55 George Street, The Rocks, Sydney 2000 Bring your earplugs!!! The hotel itself is like a mini city with a central foyer area (they call the atrium) surrounded on all sides by hundreds of hotel rooms. I think I managed about 4 hours sleep before the sound of a million doors banging repeatedly echoed around the sound chamber/hotel. The staff were friendly and courteous but I would never stay there again due to the noise! It wasn't cheap either. The only advantage is that it is centrally located - it can't beaten for location... But what good is that when you are too tired to enjoy anything?

Reviews.Title: “Dreary, tiny bathrooms, NOISY aircon - go elsewhere if you can”
Reviews.Author: LoveFrenchWine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment and certainly not worth 4 stars or even meets the usual standard of Holiday Inns worldwide. I suspect it survives because of its location (which to be fair is ideal) and its rooftop swimming pool and large patio area which enjoys panoramic views of the Bridge and Opera House. Those two points aside, the rest is very poor indeed. We were part of a larger family/friends group although we all made separate bookings and arrived/departed on different days so would not have been associated together by the hotel. This gave us an insight into whether our experience was "unique" or not - it wasn't! Three in our group of four parties had to change rooms - two were due to unacceptable noise (inside and outside, see later) and one because the kind of room booked was not available on arrival, Our "standard" room was quite roomy although this was because the room lacked furniture! The bedhead/bedside lamps etc were marked out for a king-size bed but we only had a double so there was quite a gap on either side and only one bedside table - a chambermaid kindly borrowed another from a nearby room so we could enjoy one on each side of the bed. We also had only one chair, no coffee table or anything like that. My sister had the same kind of room but she got a king-size bed all to herself and two bedside tables, two chairs but still no coffee table. All of us had the same tiny bathrooms with the smallest bath I have ever seen - it was a struggle for me and I am only 5 ft 1 inch tall ! The roof of the bathroom was very low and made up of painted plywood with a crude hole cut out of it to fit the sprinkler through and you could see up into the ceiling space (hardly surprisingly, I saw one non-identified bug/beetle thing in there). All of us endured the same noisy airconditioning which cannot even be turned off in the bathrooms so you must suffer it to some extent. One room was changed because of its exceptionally louder than usual noise. On the subject of noise, DO NOT ACCEPT A ROOM ON THE FIRST FLOOR OVER THE SIDE ENTRANCE. You will be kept awake by a live music band at the pub below and from general revelry in the street outside this pub. As well as our group member who requested and got a room change because of this, we overheard two other parties on different days discuss room changes due to being allocated rooms there. The hotel must know these rooms have a problem. The room decor itself was good albeit minimal through lack of furniture etc but the window blinds encased between the panes of glass were filthy - as the inner glass window can easily be opened, why have these not been cleaned in years? It all smacked of a lack of care. Staff were - well I suppose the fairest thing to say is "inconsistent". Some were good, others pretty clueless and one manager quite rude when dealing with a simple housekeeping query. We would be told one thing by one member of staff to have it refuted by another half an hour later - very confusing! So if you want to stay at the Rocks and are not too concerned about your accommodation, then you will enjoy the location and the pool area (which was very well maintained at least). Otherwise, if you like to sleep in a quiet, clean, cool room - go elsewhere and don't risk spoiling your trip to Sydney to save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: AusTraveller033
Reviews.Content: Looked great when going into reception but the room was very tired, mildew on the shower curtain, toilet cracked and the vanity bar in poor condition, The window blinds looked to have never been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: imrose
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Sydney with my 2 daughters and one of their friends. We stayed at this hotel and really loved the location. The staff could not have been any nicer or accomodating. In fact we arrived very early and just waited an hour or so in the lobby in some comfortable lounge chairs and the hotel rep approached us and our room was ready.He also gave us 4 free coupons so we could get our pictures taken with a koala bear at the Sydney wildlife park. There was a really nice place right outside the hotel called Fine Foods where we went and ate breakfast at every morning as it was less expensive than the hotel and the food and atmospher were very nice. Very easy to get around and you wont need a car. When we got tired of walking we took a cab. also you can pre-arrange a ride back to the airport for only 16.00 a person on your return. You would just have one of the staff make the reservation for you.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: trav060
Reviews.Content: Good location. Showing its age. Doesnt really live up to a four star establishment. Rooms small and tired

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Old Town of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CH-couple-ontheroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the old town of Sydney with view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The roof-top pool is small but the view is what makes it special. The rooms are old and a bit loud. But the size is right and the location makes up for it. The hotel service is perfect and friendly. The breakfast buffet was brilliant with an omelette and fruit mix station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first day in Australia and only night in Sydney. We arrived around 8 a.m. and of course we couldn't check in. But they offered us keys to the roof for the restroom and showers. We stored our luggage and had a very hard day of traveling. This hotel is in the Rocks and has a great location. Our room had a great view of the Harbour Bridge. On the roof they have great views of the Opera House and the Quay and Harbour. The room was the perfect temperature. The beds were comfortable and had duvets. The bathroom was clean and the shower great. I would definitely stay here again and advise friends to stay here. In the morning there is a great breakfast place right out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “great location / enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Danny1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend the opening of Mary Poppins (great show) and were impressed by the helpfullness of the staff, standard of our room and hotel provisions and of course location/location /location. Sited in the Rocks, we were a step away from the Markets and the wonderfull eateries (DARE), close to transport at Circular Quay and passed our time with a trip to Manly, Bronte and in Sydney central. The only negative was an external issue and that related to the construction work at the nearby museum and the evening noise from local hotels etc, however we coudn't fault the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: TheLightSleeper
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Sydney at 7am in the morning - having emailed the hotel the day before they allowed us an early check in. The room we were allocated was on the 3rd floor which was directly above George Street, almost at street level. This meant that we got a lot of noise from outside, the early morning garbage trucks seemed to be a constant and the George Street weekend market (although excellent) was also right outside our window, the noisy set up of which started at 3am on a Saturday morning! The room was clean and spacious but the window set up annoyed me - the blinds were tatty and some were broken. The tea, coffee and biscuits were replenished daily ( much to my husband's delight!) and the cleaner did a good job. We were also given a complimentary bowl of fruit as we were staying for 8 days. We had a bit of an issue with the card key reader for our room as the keys kept failing to work. Eventually the manager agreed to reset the reader unit which did solve the problem. The hotel itself is a bit of an odd layout, with all the rooms opening onto a balcony which overlooks the main lobby. This makes the hotel very open and quite cold as the floor is tiled. The hotel bar is oddly placed in the corner of the room which meant it had no atmosphere - we only went there once and we didn't see many other people there. Having said that, the bar food was very good. We didn't have breakfast included in our deal but we did pay for breakfast on one day. The selection was good, but the food quality wasn't great. The hot items weren't filled up quick enough and some of these had run out. There was only one toaster and there was a big queue. We felt it was hugely overpriced and went to the local cafe for breakfast for the rest of the week. On one of the days we went up to the roof - I didn't go in the rooftop pool - it was much smaller than I expected and I think the photos exagerate its size. There is a good view of the Opera House though and plenty of seating. The location of this hotel at the rocks couldn't be better and the staff were first rate - always being friendly and helpful. The onsite laundry was an absolute godsend and very reasonable at just a few dollars for a wash and dry but its just a shame this hotel is let down but its highly priced breakfast and dowdy interior. A refurb would do it the world of good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Acebab
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this Holiday Inn. To us, it was much better than expected for a Holiday Inn - and an extremely good value for the location. The rooms were very spacious, modern and clean. The bathrooms were great - again, modern and clean with everything you need. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We did not swim in the pool, but we did go to the rooftop for a view and it is truly amazing! We had planned on taking the airport train to Circular Quay and walking to hotel (which would be very easy to do distance wise), but with the kids and the luggage ended up taking a taxi with cost about $45.00 - which is about the same as the train for all of us wold have cost. It definitely was easier having the door to door service. Once you are at the hotel, everything is in walking distance - The Historic Rocks area, the Opera House, the Gardens, etc. From this location, you can catch a Ferry to Luna Park, Darling Harbor, Kings Wharf - again the location just CAN'T be beat!!! If you choose to stay here, you will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: sc358
Reviews.Content: Location central to everything. Staff friendly and helpful. Harbour View Room fabulous, was worth the extra cost. Roof terrace great for getting harbour/opera house views.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: cuddlysmith
Reviews.Content: What more can I say. Any other grumbles are more than made up for by the stunning location and views from the roof top pool. We asked for a high room, thinking we might get a better view, and I suppose if we craned our neck out of the window we could see the end of the Harbour Bridge, if we wanted a better view we had to pay to upgrade. We were on the top floor, which was a little noisy, I think it was from the generators for the pool or the lifts. We had a problem with our tv, which they fixed within minutes, but a broken blind remained broken for our whole stay. If you want a comfortable hotel with a central location and outstanding views stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KimTravel62
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night as leaving on a cruise the next day. The hotel was in a great location with wonderful roofttop views. Our twin double beds were very comfortable plus there was a choice of different pillows - nice!. Easy walk to Circular Quay and Opera House with many dining options along the way. Did not eat at the Playfair Terrace but the coffee was great. Train from domestic airport to Circular Quay one way is $15. Taxi straight to the ship cost us $8. Many thanks to housekeeping for finding my phone charger. I would definitely return and recommend the Holiday Inn Old Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, run down, expensive”
Reviews.Author: JimJudyW
Reviews.Content: This is a very tired and run down property - think economy rooms - in an older North American highway motel - understaffed, no bell help - wireless is $27.50 a day for EACH wireless device that you have - we had a "Deluxe Room with a Harbor VIew" - dirty walls - vent in the bathroom is filthy - windows are very small so your view is one that you see only when you walk up to the window. Paint is peeling off all the window casings, wooden shutters are broken....room is a good size but no seating that faces the TV so can only watch TV from the bed.....inadequate seating - part of a sectional couch with no arm on one end.......Location is good.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: AEAEngland
Reviews.Content: WE were blown away by the location only 50 metres or so from the waterfront and between the harbour bridge and the opera house. The room, although we were upgraded to an executive room' was average for this standard of hotel with a very small bathroom and view of small square at the rear. Breakfast was fine with the usual holday inn type of buffet and no other meals are available except as snacks from room service or bar. I didn't like to have to get the lift every time from the third floor and the trail to our room fromthe lift. Overall the location makes up for any shortcomings. I am really against the holday inn policy of charging for what is now an essential for most travellers - internet access. Usually in a holiday inn one can access it freely for a limited time in their business centre. Here one had to pay $5 for 30 minutes. Wonderful views from rooftop pool but unfortunately weather was not up to our using it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker69
Reviews.Content: Received a warm welcome and had a huge room on the 6th floor overlooking the harbour bridge and the Opera House. Breakfast was included and was really good. The hotel is in the historic Rocks area - a perfect location - five minutes walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House and the Rocks markets start right outside the door. There is a wealth of bars and restaurants on the doorstep. Had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BevGloucs
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, with great views over Sydney. Had a swim in the roof top pool overlooking the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: DEBROOKE
Reviews.Content: the room was very nice once we got used to the different electrical outlets and such. we really didn't like the stairs we had to traverse to get to our room once we left the elevator on the 3rd floor. the view was so-so, but to be fair we really weren't in the room long enough to look out the windows. the location was great; close to restaurants, the bridge and the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rat68
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and very clean. Bath with overhead shower was narrow. Hot water tap in shower was touchy. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Roof top pool and spa had a fantastic view. The spa was a bit average - not much pressure from the jets and it was quite small. Lovely area to sit and admire the view. Buffet breakfast was lovely, plenty to eat and topped up regularly. Chef on hand to make eggs the way you like. Beds were firm and you had a choice of soft or firm pillows - which was a great thing in our family. Windows had venetian blinds and block out holland blinds. Market noise was heard on Saturday and Sunday - but that's not the hotel's fault. Walls in room were a bit thin as we could here the children in the next room jumping on the bed. Overall, would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrJonty
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed our expectations by a mile. Amazing location in 'The Rocks' area; good amenities with a small rooftop pool with views of the bridge and opera house. The staff were very helpful and friendly with all of our requests. We really couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Upland99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Sydney. We spent our last night at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade which we took. The room was spacious and well appointed. As we were on a late flight out Monday we asked for a late check out this was granted happily. The service friendly and obliging staff stood out for us. We would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: buddhaboi
Reviews.Content: The absolute beauty of this hotel is its location in the rocks. The surrounding area and the stunning views from the roof are fabulous. However, in my opinion, this is a good 3 star hotel and nothing more. Some of the common areas are poor - particularly the landings to the rooms and the service was just ok for my stay. Did not really impact on my enjoyment but given the hotel price I would shop around for something else unless you can get a really good deal

Reviews.Title: “Great stay..location is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Lou_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family (8 and 12 yo) for four nights. We were in Sydney for a wedding and we have stayed at this hotel previously. I was perplexed by some of the reviews the hotel is getting, but as we have stayed here previously and the location is second to none we were really happy to book again. I tried to book through the hotel website but could not confirm a family room for the fourth night. I rang the hotel directly and they upgraded someone else which gave us access to the family room for the fourth night. I was really happy with this service and I am sure the other guests appreciated the upgrade. Our room was ready when we arrived and check in was easy and quick. The hotel itself is within the heritage area of the rocks so they are very restricted in regard to upgrades that they can do. The pool area is small and it isn't very deep, the view is fantastic. The breakfast had a good selection and there is an egg station where you can get pancakes and/or french toast cooked to order. The Holiday Inn's in Sydney both have Gluten Free bread on request which is great as my daughter is a Coeliac and they will make this up into french toast for her. We had friends meet us in the lobby for predinner drinks and it was happy hour and the drinks were reasonably priced. The weekend we were there the markets were on Friday night, saturday and sunday so it was great to walk out the front of the hotel and through the markets. Circular Quay is well within walking distance to catch the ferry to Luna Park and Targona Zoo so no need for expensive cabs or crowded public transport. When we booked it wasn't particularly good value for the room itself but considering the location and no taxi's etc it was overall good value. I didn't take any photos of the room but they are just like others photos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: CLVan78
Reviews.Content: Only a two night stay following our arrival from the US. Booked here based on location and close proximity to public transport. We took train from airport and walked to the hotel. The rooftop views were great. Though the rooms are older, beds were comfortable and service was good. Much to do in the area. Felt it was worth the price because of the great location. If you are in need of a resort hotel, this is not the place for you. If you want a convenient and comfortable bed in a nice area -- this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort hotel but a great location”
Reviews.Author: johndborg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. We chose this hotel as it is just across the road from the Overseas Passenger Terminal and we had an appointment on a cruise ship the next morning. It is a good hotel with standard features but not a resort hotel by any means. The best feature is its location in the Rocks and proximity to the passenger terminal. The is a great view from the roof top. We also enjoyed the happy of half price local beers between 5:00 and 6:00.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mike_n_cath
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Holiday Inns in the UK we were a bit disappointed with the quality of this one. It's definitely looking tired. Our room was tiny as was the bathroom. The view of the harbour from the roof is fantastic but the pool is again...'tiny'. There's no gym but guests have free access to Fitness First which is a 10 minute walk away. The saving grace for this hotel is it's fantastic location. It's in the heart of The Rocks - you have the Opera House and Harbour Bridge within walking distance and lots of great bars and restaurants. On Sundays market stalls line the streets outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JohnandTrish_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. As the name suggests â€œOLDâ€™ it was. Our room was very tired and the bathroom certainly required an update.. Very over priced. We were very disappointed with the service we received re our parking. We booked the accommodation in Feb last year and requested parking for the 7th as well as the 8th Jan for one car and just the 8th for a second car, as it was our daughters wedding. I confirmed the booking that week and it was mentioned that parking was noted for the 7th Jan. My husband arrived at the hotel on the 7th only to be told that we had to book another nights accommodation to receive the extra nights parking. He was sent down the road to a parking station. This was disappointing as parking was available if we book another nights stay however not forthcoming if we didn't. We were willing to pay for the extra nights parking. We then made alternative arrange for the Fri parking. We arrived to check into two rooms on the Sat only to be told that parking was not an option as the parking lot was full. What a joke. After numerous discussions we were given a parking spot in a non parking area and again my husband was sent down to the International Ferry Terminal and offered parking at a rate of $25. Why wasn't this suggested for the Fri night also that parking cost us $65. I must mention that this $25 fee was later waived due to the inconvenience for the Sat parking. I did read the ad for the room and presumed from the wording that we had Harbour Views.... this was not the case the harbour views were only from the roof top pool. The pool area was also very 'tired' however spectacular views. I was very disappointed with the way 'things' turned out as it was our daughters wedding night and we wanted to share the glory of the day. Certainly not the welcome that we had hoped for from such a well known organisation and I certainly did not feel like a welcomed guest. As for the Hospitality Promise " Making your stay a complete success is our goal" Perhaps we should have been made to feel like 'Welcome guest'

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SharronCrow
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi and the porter was there immediatley to take control of our bags. Reception staff knew our names which was incredible as the porter must of advised her before she served us. She was very polite and our room was available straight away even though we were three hours early. Check in was fast and by the time we got to our room our bags were there waiting for us. We found the staff pleasant, helpful, friendly and efficient always. The room was adequate, clean with good views of the bridge. Only down side is curtains would be better rather than blinds for blocking out the light (after an 8 hour flight you want to sleep). Views from the roof top pool area are excellent. The breakfast was good value as the kids got their breakfast for free and we went up as many times as we wanted. This is no reflection of the hotel we stayed in but beware of the taxi's as they are not the best and look and feel very tired. Our transfer back to the airport by taxi was traumatic as the taxi wouldn't start at first and then he broke down en-route. I had to get rather irrate with the driver as he tried to continue the journey on the highway with my family in the car and there wasn't any hard shoulder. He only exited the highway because I insisted rather strongly. We eventually flagged down another taxi and made our next flight!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - sound 4 star hotel, a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: OzML
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Holiday Inn Old Sydney for one night in December 2010 while in Sydney on Business. This is a comfortable but dated hotel, in a perfect location at The Rocks, with an amazing view from the rooftop swimming pool of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Staying in an Executive King room, the room was clean and well presented. Check in and check out was efficient, valet parking is available although staff do not offer to help you with your luggage to your room. Staff were friendly and efficient. A bar and breakfast room are at the property, however there is no restaurant on-site for dinner. Room service is however available. The room featured a fridge but did not feature a stocked mini-bar, rather a price list and ability to get room service to send up items. This was a bit inconvenient as it would be much easier and customary to be able to get a drink from the mini bar without needing to call room service. Unfortunately this hotel has introduced credit card surcharges of 1.5%. I find it poor that while hotels enjoy more benefits of credit card use than most other industries (booking guarantees, pre-authorisations, charging for no-shows, charging for late charges, avoiding large cash transactions), the industry has been one of the most bullish industries in Australia to introduce credit card surcharges, and that most major groups have magically chosen exactly the same percentage to surcharge. This surcharge will encourages me to look elsewhere next time I travel rather than simply rebooking at this hotel. The location outweighs any disadvantages of this hotel, however it pays to check prices of other hotels nearby when booking as often the price of this hotel is higher than several of the nearby 5 star hotels, which offer a much higher level of service than this 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Ozztraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our 3 week christmas break visiting family. This is an excellent hotel very close to all the usual tourist attractions in and around Sydney. The rooms are clean and well decorated and the beds are the best I have experienced in any hotel, and I have stayed in quite a few! The staff are friendly and very helpful, the breakfast is good and value for money. Our room had a superb view overlooking the Rocks with the opera house beyond, only blocked when a cruise liner docked in the harbour for a day. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter006
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in Sydney - about a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay and 15 minutes from the Opera House. Good and helpful service from the front desk and other staff. The hotel lobby looks good but the rooms are slightly dated. Ours had non-matching furniture with a balcony which had no furniture at all and whose railings were rusty. The buffet breakfast is quite good quality with good rates for children, although the egg station was a shambles - hardly ever operating so eggs were cooked to order in the kitchen which took ages. By the end of our stay we were joking we should ring the kitchen as we got in the elevator to get them started.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great View”
Reviews.Author: markpug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on George St for two nights. Christmas day & Boxing Day. The staff were very accomodating as we arrivedfrom the uk at 8am. They let us have a room early so we could freshen up. Rooms are good clean as all of the Inter Con Group. This hotel has a superb view of theSydney Opera House from the roof terrece where the pool/spa is situated. This was our third trip back here and would not hesitate to return. Only one grumble. Internet connection at $27.50 or Â£18.50 a day. Come on Holiday Inn it's standard these days to have this included in your tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and lovely decor”
Reviews.Author: myjules
Reviews.Content: We liked being in the heart of the action in Sydney down in the rocks. The hotel is everything you want, not cheap, but all is faultless. Wonderful stay for our family

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor, but excellent location, good service, great views.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyEngineer
Reviews.Content: First of all, I got a good deal through Expedia to stay at this hotel. I would not pay the going rate, as I think that this hotel is overpriced for what it is. The location, in the heart of The Rocks in Sydney, is absolutely perfect. You are only a short stroll to the harbour or any number of attractions, eateries and transport. The check in was smooth, although I has to make a phone call to the hotel from my car to ascertain the arrangements for parking. The hotel is valet only, and they only have 3 spots for pre-valet parking. I was given a room on the 4th floor, with a view of the Opera House and Circular Quay. The view was only partially obstructed by a heritage building accross the road, but that is to be expected on the 4th floor. The room itself was clean, but in need of a refit. The sofa had wear holes in the arm, the bathroom, although clean, was best friends with tile paint and gap sealent. You need to excersize caution when drying your hair, that you don't catch the towel on the fire sprinkler. I found the safe to be beyond my expertise to operate, as I followed the simple instructions of inserting my room card to no avail. I gave up after about 15 minutes of trying. The steam button on the iron parted company with the rest of the housing as soon as I touched it, and had to be "fixed". I attempted to turn on the TV, which was not functioning. I suspect the batteries in the remote needed changing, however, I wasn't really there to watch TV, so it didn't really bother me. The pivoting bracket which holds the TV to the wall is probably the worst designed object in engineering history. You have to fight the thing to make it move, and it leaves the TV sitting on an odd angle when extended. the bed was comfortable for my large frame and dodgey back, and offered a choice of pillow density. The room was quiet for the duration of my stay, and I slept well. I took the opportunity to use the rooftop pool. The trip up to the roof is worth it, just for the view over Sydney Harbour. The pool must have been photographed with a fish eye lens from a helicoptor, as the website shows a far grander body of water than is actually available for swimming. Having said that, it is ample to cool off on a hot day, and the hot tub is a pleasant temperature. The internal atrium of the hotel makes a spectacular light well and gives a spacious feeling to the public areas. I did notice that a bowl and an apple were left near a railing outside a room for the duration of my stay, which is a bit substandard in a modern hotel. Check out was efficient, however there is an annoying practice of surcharging for credit card use. The surcharge is only 1%, but I hate the feeling of "tacked on" charges. My advice to management; bury the charge in your room cost. The valet charge for my stay was $35, which is very reasonable for CBD parking. All in all, a nice stay, which suited my purpose and budget. If you're not too pickey about decor or wear and tear, and you want to stay close to the action, this hotel is excellent, but only at at dicounted price.

Reviews.Title: “It met my expectations and I loved it! I'd go back here in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: The location is PERFECT! It's near a lot of restaurants and shops, it's near the ferry, it has spectacular views of the harbour and the opera house, and our room was perfect. The restaurant (for breakfast) was a little pricey, so we only ate there once. But if you're budget conscious and you don't want to sacrifice comfort and safety, this is the property for you. I travelled with my mother on this trip and I hope to visit again, but with my husband. When I do, I'll definitely be staying at this hotel again. The staff was all kind and accommodating to us. Our rooms were always cleaned and tidied everyday as expected. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi are simple but all we needed. My mom and I enjoyed having lunch on the rooftop (which we got at the outdoor market just a block away).

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off!! Hotel Phone Charges”
Reviews.Author: 808Couple
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn had average rooms, but the hallways were in need of updating and they were dimly lit. The location was excellent - can't get better than the location as it is right in The Rocks and close to shops, restaurants, and ferry. The pool and hot tub were very small. We were very upset at the archaic practice of gauging customers for telephone charges. We made 2 calls within the state of New South Wales, each less than 10 minutes and were charged $48 for the privilege of that service. As oversees guests, we found this particularly onerous as we were unable to use our mobile phones.

Reviews.Title: “in dire need of a refit”
Reviews.Author: dodlestonian
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel was clean and the staff were great. We were a bit disappointed by the accommodation though. The furniture was old, dining room chairs badly scratched etc. When we arrived our room smelt musty so we asked for a different room - this smelt the same so we accepted it. The hotel is in a great position but is in dire need of a refit. The cost of internet in the room was high at Â£19.75 per day so we went to the business centre where we had to buy 30 minutes at a time for about Â£4.00. we stayed at various other hotels during our trip all were better than this one and the most we paid for internet in our room at the others was Â£10.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Position ....”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: Certainly as per everyones review on this hotel; its main positive is the position. You can walk straight in to the markets , great historic pubs, a short walk to the opera house and harbour bridge.
