Rooms are ok , small bathrooms, they are adequate, but yes for $300 + per night i expect more and would return to Shangri La, or IC at this is the same rate ( not the best position as here ) but better value. Hotel Staff friendly , room clean, housekeeping very nice. The pool is msall but worth a walk up just for the view. I recommend the Glenmore Hotel go there for lunch on the rooftop overlooking Sydney, great, and the Argyle Hotel is very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after using lastminute.com.au and getting this as the secret hotel. There are good and bad things about this hotel. Good : Staff are fantastic, professional, welcoming, friendly. The room I stayed in was on the first floor and was one with a small balcony overlooking the laneway off george street which was nice to get some fresh air in the room. The bed was comfortable and the air conditiioning kept the room nice and cool (absolute must in humid sydney in summer), Fantastic location and handy to many shops, touristy stuff, cafes, pubs and restaurants. Bad : The bathroom is miniscule in this room (116) and smelt mouldy. I found out that it is because of there being no ventilation in this room at all. The carpet is worn and looks like it needs a good steam clean or replacing. On Friday and Saturday nights this would a very very noisy hotel to stay at due to the pub next door which has loud live music on those nights (i used to work there). Though there is insulation on the doors and windows it would still be noisy especially if jet lagged. Other nights it is fine. After reading other peoples reviews and checking the hotels website I realised that for some people this hotel would be bitterly disappointing for the price they would pay (approx $300 + on the website, I paid $200). For what I paid it was barely adequate and I expected better facilities. It is a 3 star maximum hotel and is only charging such exhorbitant rates due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view when cruise ship not docked”
Reviews.Author: double07
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very helpful at all times. First room allocated was very small, dark and musty. Upgraded (at a cost to us) to higher floor with view of the Opera house, unfortunately when a cruise ship docks it blocks the view and you are treated to the sounds of the ship's tannoy system. There are draw backs to being on the front due to the noise of the late night revellers. Breakfast is nothing special but it does cater for all tastes. It is an ideal location to base your visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: suzukigsxr1000k1
Reviews.Content: A good basic hotel in a great location, go to the roof and you have some of the best views in Sydney. Before you book check the booking sites there was a Â£200 pound difference for a four night stay. It is situated close to circular quay so travel around the city is easy. Dont bother with the hotel breakfast unless in the package. Just outside of the side entrance is a very nice basic cafe that does great fresh food.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view of the opera house & sydney bridge”
Reviews.Author: pradiparora1
Reviews.Content: excellent service ,great food ,amazing view of the opera house and stone throw from the sydney bridge ,swimming pool of roof top with great view ,excellent food ,very close to best restaurants ner opera house

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: OzACT
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly is in a fabulous location but is definitely not 4+ star accommodation. Our room was clean but very basic and located at the back of the premises. The windows aren't double glazed so the noise is terrible. We were woken at 5am each day by the noise from construction work, delivery trucks, recycling bins etc.... There is no mini bar and the toiletries are not replenished each day - so don't forget your own shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: kuyperr
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I were very happy after our very long trip from the UK to be met by capable and efficient staff. The service throughout our honeymoon stay was perfect....they really couldn't do enough for us, even a bottle of bubbly and some chocolates were left as a welcome in our room. Yes, the hotel is a little dated - but location is great - we weren't aware ''the rocks'' was the trendy area. Breakfast is very good - and the wi-fi (pre-paid) helped me get through jet lag. Great!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel - 'Old' it is”
Reviews.Author: theminitraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely average. The bathroom was tiny and the rooms had a funny smell. Overpriced for what it is. Everything just seemed old and seemed like it was a retirement village for pensioners. Average age of guests staying at the hotel was definitely 60+. Found a nice white hair wrapped around the pen in my room to top it off. Only redeeming factor was the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RUINED THE TRIP”
Reviews.Author: megan2391
Reviews.Content: Just couldn't stand this hotel, I have no idea how it is rate 4 star?! for ease i will just list all the reasons that ruined my trip. - didn't get to sleep till 2 am because of the pub and loud noises down stairs.. this happened both nights - at 8 am there was extremely loud drilling in the hotel hall out side our room that went for 2 hours!! when we told reception they could not be less interested! they just said it was emergency work.. be this the truth that dosen't make it OK! a lot of people stay at a hotel for a holiday! and a lot do not like to be woken up at 8am by a drill. I recorded the sound on my phone, it was so loud you couldn't hear the other person talk in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Average, average, average!”
Reviews.Author: sherrydaigle
Reviews.Content: How this hotel is rated 4+ stars on some sites I do not understand. The rooms are dated, the service iffy, and the price expensive. Our in room hairdryer was broken, we called the front desk for a replacement that never arrived. I was not offered any help with luggage. Positive notes were the view from the roof and the breakfast buffet,which was not included in the room price. Negatives were the service, and having the full cost of the room charged to credit card as soon as you book. What other hotels do that?

Reviews.Title: “Well located but average hotel with potential”
Reviews.Author: Papabob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location in the 'Rocks' area of Sydney, probably the best location in the city, situated close to the Opera House and the Bridge. There are some good restaurants located within a few minutes walking distance of the hotel and the main ferries depart from Circular Quay which is close by. The hotel itself is of reasonable quality but is quite tired in its decor. We were upgraded to a suite with partial views towards the Opera house and Bridge. The building is one which could be a very appealing 'boutique' hotel given a major decorative overhaul. Breakfast, which is standard buffet, is of average quality. If staying on a 'room only' basis there is plenty of opportunity to take breakfast at some very appealing cafes immediately adjacent to the hotel where the quality of food and coffee would far exceed that provided in the hotel. Would we stay again yes, but it would also be worth considering the Park Hyatt which is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jaymelu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was "OK" and honestly, you can't beat the location for a trip to Sydney. The rooms are very average... good pillows. Some of the staff are friendly, some seemed it bit irritated that the guests needed their help... One young man, Thai, who checked us in was fantastic. The breakfast at $25, was an awful buffet type of thing -- really, really bad. There are plenty of places to eat right outside the door of the hotel and we wish we'd have done that instead. At the awful breakfast we were informed, rudely, that "since you've already checked out we can't charge this to your room" -- we had not checked out ... I guess they sorted it out, because the rude man never came back to ask me about it again. We'd only eaten in the hotel because we were in a bit of a hurry, and naturally when we got back to the room to get our stuff to check-out, the key didn't work! What a hastle! A trip down to the desk and back up wasn't in our time frame!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: texaskaren68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on vacation and was quite pleased. The room was a bit on the small side, but the location more than made up for it. It was just a five minute walk to Circular Quay and only a bit further round to the Opera House. The view from the roof is fantastic, especially at sunset. The room was clean and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Internet access in the room (wireless) is expensive at 55 cents a minute with a maximum of $24.95 a day. Having coin operated guest laundry was a money saver though, and quite handy when you've been traveling for several days. It was $2 to wash and $2 to dry. Be warned if you are planning to take the train and walk to the hotel with luggage. The last part of the walk is all uphill (about two blocks). My room was on the backside of the hotel overlooking a plaza. It was quite noisy early in the mornings with men setting up and/or taking down metal tables and chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DanMorgan0616
Reviews.Content: Nice location and beautiful city. Basic Holiday Inn. Don't expect more. But, that's what I wanted. No frills, just a clean room and good hospitality. It has both. The hotel is not the destination after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: L_G82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our big trip during Jan/Feb 2010. The main reason for choosing the hotel was the location and we were not disappointed, one of the best locations we could of hoped for right in the middle of everything. The hotel itself was nothing special, but clean and practical. Room was plenty large enough for the 2 of us. We had our first weeding aniversary during the trip and were hoping the hotel would do something nice, but they didn't which was a little dissapointing. But overall I would recomend this to anyone going to sydney for a short visit as for the price you get nice rooms in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit noisey”
Reviews.Author: Swimmy128
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay our last night in Sydney in the rocks area. This hotel was in a perfect location. Very easy to get to and from circular quay . We got a harbor view room. We could see the opera house well but not really the bridge. The view from the roof top pool was amazing. I wish it was not raining so I could have used it before the long flight back home. The buffet breakfast was also very good. The only problem that we had with the room was that one of the windows did not have a latch so when the wind was blowing it kept making noise through out the night. If I got a good deal on the room I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Old Sydney is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brocklebec
Reviews.Content: We recently read some adverse comments in TA brfore we arrived at the hotel, so there was a degree of apprehension on whether our choice had been correct. However, our fears were soon put to rest on our arrival. The hotel is ideally situated with views of the bridge or Opera House (depending on the room location). The rooms are perhaps looking a little tired, but everything worked, and the bed was very comfortable.The staff are absolutely trmendous, always cheerful, nothing too much trouble, and they can not do enough for the guests. They offer really good advice on tourist information, and are only too keen to make arrangements etc. Breakfasts are very substantive indeed and the quality is excellent - again the staff here are so cheerful and welcoming! I think this is a 5* location without the 5* price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise, perfect for first-time visitor”
Reviews.Author: BoiseLisaD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me as part of a business trip. What a lovely surprise! I was picked up by friends at the airport, and told to take the ferry from Rose Bay to Circular Queue, then walk to the hotel. What an adventure and fantastic introduction to this amazingly beautiful city. This isn't a typical Holiday Inn. I do a lot of business travel, and found this hotel to be perfect, definitely not 5 star, but it had wonderful amenities, beautiful views, a superb central location. Helpful staff at the desk. The exchange rate made the hotel (and all of Sydney) very expensive, but overall, the food was good, the weekend market was fun shopping, and I had central transportation to bus, train, ferry and tours. Try the Korean massage place up behind the hotel--I felt like a million bucks afterward. My only complaint was that I wasn't informed breakfast was included in my rate until day 3 (when I asked), and that internet was $25/day and movies were $17. With the US dollar almost matching the Aussie dollar, it made for an expensive week long stay. If you have a street facing room (harbor views), it can get noisy, but since I wear earplugs, this wasn't a big deal for me. Enjoyed my room and stay at this hotel, would easily return (when I can afford it!).

Reviews.Title: “The best part of this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: roselilycat
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Lastminute.com as I was attending a function at the Opera House and the location of the hotel was convenient. I found the staff friendly and efficient. I was given a disabled room on the 4th floor which was hard to find as the door was behind a wall/pillar and it was very gloomy and it was difficult to get the door open. The bathroom was totally unsuitable for an able bodied guest. The room was located at the back of the hotel with a view of the roofs of restaurants and a rockwall. It must be disappointing if you are disabled and have no choice of room as the view (or lack of it) was non existent! The cable TV chanels weren't operational in my room, which I thought was the norm, until I saw on the hotel website that the rooms were in fact supplied with cable. The bed and pillows were terribly uncomfortable and I woke up aching all over. All in all a very disappointing hotel stay and I would not stay there again and would think twice before recommending it. Maybe when you book through an internet cut price site the hotels don't really care where they put you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: JLP277
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn for three nights during a research trip. My room was on the sixth floor and had a clear view of the Harbour Bridge, which was an unexpected and very lovely surprise. The room itself was light and airy. The hotel is located towards the end of George Street, not far from Circular Quay and within easy walking distance from the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens and other major sites. More importantly for my trip though, it was very easy to find my way to all of my appointments on foot, saving me plenty in cab fares. I had room service on my first night (too tired to hunt and gather!), which was well presented and delicious. There are also a number of nice restaurants, pubs and cafes close to the hotel, a couple of which I plan to visit again on my next trip. I didn't have very much contact with the hotel staff but I found those I spoke with very pleasant and helpful. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn and will probably stay there again next time I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LOELK
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed for five nights in a King and a twin double room on the second floor. King room spacious and also had a sofa bed. Both rooms had lcd tvs, hairdryers, usual toiletries, iron, tea and coffee making facilities and fridges that we could chill our own drinks in. Bathrooms were pretty small. There is a lot of noise from the bars nearby and this can go on until the early hours especially at weekends! One minor inconvenience is that there are only two fairly small lifts which are busy in the mornings. From the foyer you can look up and see the queues of people at each floor waiting for the lifts, access to a stairs for the lower floors would have been handy, the only stairs we could find were alarmed emergency exits. Staff are pleasant, however there was nobody to help with the luggage. The location is good, restaurants in the Rocks area are a bit pricey, but if you shop around you will find special offers like $10 steaks on mondays and tuesdays etc. The view from the roof top swimming pool is amazing especially at night. Would stay here again, however it might be worth requesting a high floor room to minimise the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location on The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: English_Al
Reviews.Content: My first impression as I walked through the door was of a prison! It's something to do with the bars on all the floors around the atrium. I was a bit worried what I'd booked but luckily my first impressions were unfounded :-) The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. They were happy to make recommendations and bookings for us. Our room was nicely furnished with a large, comfortable bed. We did find the hotel to be noisy at night due to rubbish lorries, even though we weren't at the front of the hotel. The buffet breakfast was nice and after we'd eaten breakfast once, we were then offered a better price for subsequent days. The restaurant did not offer food in the evening - this may have been to do with the fact it was winter in Australia but best to check if you're staying. If you go onto the roof of the hotel, there are excellent views of the bridge and opera house. In fact the hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to the bridge - ideal if you're doing the bridge climb (which we totally recommend!). The Rocks area has lots of little art galleries and is an interesting area to stay. The Manley ferry terminal is about a 5 - 10 minute walk. OVERALL - not plush but perfectly good and liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Overrated location”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights in july/August. The hotel is typically Holiday Inn. Excellent service, helpful staff etc. I found the Rocks area very expensive for eating and buying souvenirs. Most of the restaurants are overpriced and full of poseurs. The hotel charges for internet use are a bit excessive and buying a dongle would be an excellent idea if you are staying for some time. Opposite Wharf 6 on circular quays ( 10 minutes walk) is a booking centre for AAT Kings tours. Each day they do special deals with a significant discount to brochure and hotel prices.I stayed in Sydney 5 years ago at the Cambridge in Surry Hills. The hotel was not up to Holiday Inn standard but the location was just as good. As in the review, a very nice hotel but forget the Rocks. The only decent place I found to meet genuine Australians and eat and drink at a fair price was the Orient pub just along the street from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Willowpeak
Reviews.Content: Spent an overnight there taking a break before the long trip home. Arrived very early, around 9:00 AM and we were each given our room to drop off our bags and get changed for a day of sightseeing. Only spent time in room to sleep so cannot comment on the room but it was clean with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. If the room had blackout curtains, I never figured out how to use them. Besides, I was so tired after 8 hours of walking and visits to several historical pubs on George Street, it didn't matter. Lobby Bar good with fireplace and nice reading area. I would definitely go back next time through Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Spot but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Hellstar
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night (Sat) at the hotel as it was one of only a few that doesn't require a minimum of 2 nights stay. Decided to include breakfast for two as well. Upon arrival we were told that our room had been automatically upgraded to a King which was really nice. Room was quite large, however was on the 3rd floor and next door was a pub that was open till early hours of the morning. Decor was quite fresh with a large plasma TV. Breakfast was fantastic with no chance of running out of anything and eggs were cooked to perfection. Location was fantastic and handy to everything including the Rocks Markets

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in first rate location”
Reviews.Author: l0uise123
Reviews.Content: I pondered whether to give this a 3 star or a 4 star as on some aspects, the hotel is very good but on others it is average. Customer service at front desk is excellent as is the proximity to Harbour Bridge, Opera House etc. The rooms are clean and comfortable but are a little tired and fairly basic. The pool was closed for maintenance during our stay but this was not an issue for us as we could still access the top floor for photo opportunities. On the downside, the rooms are cleaned fairly late in the day so we would arrive back at the hotel at 2pm for our toddler to take a nap and the room wouldn't have been cleaned. Also, whilst the Rocks is lovely, it is a touristy area so is thin on the ground for good value eating places.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location......rooms could do with a little renovation”
Reviews.Author: latestfilly
Reviews.Content: amazing location on the rocks next to circular quay overlooking the opera house-right in the heart of sydney! the hotel itself itself is worth it just because of its location in the oldest but picturesque part of sydney centre, the rooms however are small and could do with a little modernising. staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: enzfrnz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in the Rock, right across the street from the Ken Done gallery. Ten minute walk from Circular Quay with access to trains and buses. The hotel is older and could use some updating. It was raining very heavily during my stay and the windon leaked onto the carpet. The hotel was very quite. The bed very comfy. I stayed for free using my Holiday Inn rewards. The list price for the room was $350 and I would not have stayed here if I had to pay. It's not a 4 star hotel, but the location and staff make it a great choice if you can grab a discount price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant customer service, nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: boghaw
Reviews.Content: In our view, you would have to go a pretty long way to match the all round service by the staff at Holiday Inn, Old Sydney which is on George Street in the historic Rocks area very close to the harbour bridge and Circular Quay where the ferries come and go from. Whether it was letting us into our room early in the morning after a tiring overnight flight from Singapore, or photo-copying maps from a A-Z directory to save us having to buy one, nothing was too much trouble. What is\more, al the staff, from housekeeping staff, to receptionists to restaurant workers were friendly and helpful, unlike staff we encountered at another hotel in Sydney and at Ayers Rock resort. THe hotel itself is great too, having been developed out of an old warehouse with the rooms set balcony-style over several flors and overlooking an atrium-style middle with a breakfast/dining area on the first floor. The best bit though is the roof terrace with a swimming pool and small sun bathing area and giving panoramic views of the harbour, city, bridge and opera house. It's well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: PerthXplosive
Reviews.Content: Its the incredible staff that really make this hotel. The location is really good, and everything else is what i'd consider average. Not average in a bad way, just nothing to write home about. Back to the staff... we had a few special requirements, and all staff were friendly and helpful, unlike any other hotel i've been in before, including any 5 star hotel. For example, when we didn't like their iced coffee they made new ones then called to see if we liked them, and remembered to make them that way. They were happy to make calls all over Sydney at any time and arrange stuff we needed. Its the first hotel we have ever bought chocolates and flowers to say thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnMartin21
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay at the hotel due to the ash cloud, staff were most helpful. As the other reviewers have said the hotell is getting a little tired but the hotel is clean and comfortable and has fantastic views over the harbour bridge and the opera house

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: thereview20
Reviews.Content: we arrived from england after a long flight and was welcomed by friendly staff and pointed in the direction for local restrurants etc.we went to the rooftop pool and what a view you can almost touch the bridge and a full 360 degrees view of the opera house ,city and the bridge. it was very clean and a relaxing atmosphere i would go back due to the location and the staff

Reviews.Title: “this place knows its business and excels”
Reviews.Author: theunbeatentrack
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed, extra friendly staff and good service, the choice of bar fridge items or not, compact but still very well furbished and comfortable rooms with all the extras that you need to make your stay in Sydney truly comfortable, location is fantastic, food is tasty, fesh and well prepared, ALL staff that I dealt with over my 3 day stay were always pleasant and helpful and friendly, the room service ladies are extra nice. Rooms are clean and cleaning staff obviously know there jobs. Well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Comfy Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Natasha F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Wednesday/Thursday night during May. The room cost just over $200 per night and we had a deluxe room on the top floor (8th) The pros of the room are that it was quite spacious, very clean and well appointed. The king bed was super comfortable and there was a flat screen TV in the room as well as a chaise lounge (that became a sofa bed) The room also had 3 openable windows â€“fresh sea air is always good! Downsides- the hotel is quite old and does have fewer facilities that a newer hotel, the tea & milk were not replaced during maid service. The spa was out of order and they do not have a gym (if that matters!) There were no bathrobes â€“ which is a mortal sin to my husband â€“ but didnâ€™t bother me. Also my pet peeve happened - swipe cards were deactivated and we were locked out of the room on our last day - although we had a late checkout. Apart from the pros and cons - other things to mention â€“ the food service menu was quite reasonable slightly higher than average, but the hotel is in The Rocks where everything is more expensive. The bar fridge comes empty with a note inviting you to put your own drinks in it. The rooftop pool wasnâ€™t used by us â€“ too cold! but it is a great location to get photos as it faces the Opera House on one side and the Harbour Bridge on the other. All in all the hotel was in a great location and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, wouldn't stay in the hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Superdi
Reviews.Content: We visited Australia for a three week holiday and booked the Old Syndey Holiday inn via out travel agent. We initially booked for three nights but added a further two to prevent us hunting another hotel for the weekend. I wished I hadn't bothered three nights was too many. When we arrived we had issues over the booking but fortunately that was soon resolved however I didn't need this hassle after an epic journey to get there. When I entered the room I could not believe my eyes. The hotel is expensive and I appreciate that some of this is due to location but come on, the rooms were tired, wardrobes wouldn't close, shower over bath in a tiny bathroom. The room gave me an instant feeling that it needed an urgent refurbishment. The roof top swimming pool is very small however the views from the roof are amazing and you can see both the bridge and opera house. The breakfast was pleasant and staff were helpful but I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, shame about incompetant staff.”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many places in central sydney as I work there and we regulary stay overnight to enjoy the nightlife. We selected the Holiday Inn as we were attending a concert at the Opera House as part of my fiance's birthday present and wanted to see the night markets. While the location is wonderful and some staff were more than helpful (evening bar staff who gave us a jug of cold water to take to our room just after they closed) unfortunately the service offered by the others is just TERRIBLE! We chose a package that included a bottle of wine as we thought it would be nice to have a few glasses before we left for the concert. About 5 minutes after arrival we recieved a knock at the door and a staff member presented us with our wine. "Great" We thought, until she handed us the bottle and it was WARM! It had not been in the fridge at all and was not drinkable. We put it in the fridge and decided to drink it when we got back. The next morning at breakfast we ordered some poached eggs and were told they would be 10 minutes, which was fine as they were very busy. We waited, and waited and waited until it had been nearly 35 minutes and I thought....I think people who arrived after us have been served? Sure enough, they had. He had just skipped our order. This all would have been ok until the last incident... We went walking in the markets the next morning. My fiance loves a particular artist there so I sneakily asked her to look at something at the end of the market while I bought her favourite peice, raced back to the hotel and explained it was to be a wedding present and could they please place it in the boot of my valet parked car so she would not see it. "No worries" they said. Upon collecting my car the Valet staff member drove the car up to us, got out and looked at us both and said "Oh, I had to move some things around in the boot but I fit your present in there ok" I was furious.. she automatically knew what it was so he just ruined a $300 suprise wedding gift! Im sorry but could you be any more incompetant??????? Great location but if you expect service dont bother. This place would be lucky to receive 3 stars in my books.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location & great photo's taken from the rooftop pool.”
Reviews.Author: nzers
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the end of our week in Sydney due to its location right in the heart of the Rock's and proximity to the ferries at Circular Quay. Managed to get a great rate on Expedia otherwise would not have paid the price advertised on the Holiday Inn website - it is waaaay overpriced. All the buildings in this area are historic and this hotel has been built along the same lines. It is situated right between the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay, one block from the waterfront. We stayed on a Sunday and the Rocks market was in full swing in the lane below our room which was very convenient albeit expensive. Our room 429 was located right next door to the guest laundry and in a small alcove with 3 other rooms off it. As such we suffered thru constant noise of doors opening and closing (22 times in 15 minutes!!!) and the washer and drier operating til 10pm. I would recommend that you avoid rooms around this number if this is likely to annoy you. However the two queen beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and the bathroom was stocked with lots of cute bottles of shampoo etc. One thing I missed in the room was the folder of information about the hotel facilities - I don't know if someone had removed it and it hadn't been replaced yet, but it was frustrating not having all those details on hand. It took a while to figure out how to turn the air conditioning down and we visited the pool to learn it's opening / closing times. Speaking of the pool - this rooftop pool must have one of the perfect spots in Sydney to take photo's of the Opera House (providing there isn't a cruise ship at the dock in front). We loved sitting in the spa at dusk watching all the bats heading out for the night. We ate at the little Pizza restaurant just down the street which seemed very popular and was reasonably priced, and had desert at the Guylian Chocolate Shop as a treat (yum!). Breakfast at the hotel cost $18 ea and was more than adequate. There was a chef cooking omelettes and pancakes to order as well as a fresh fruit/vege juicer which I thought was a nice option. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my friends based on the location alone provided the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Pearl65
Reviews.Content: We always stay here primarily for the location. The hotel is dated and in need of a refurb. I agree with past reviews about the street market and pub noise and it is less than 4.5 stars. We asked for a harbour view room and they didn't have one for the first night so we moved after that. The first room we had was small with very noisy a/c. The harbour view room was worth the extra $30 a night as we had a fantastic view of the Opera House (but the window wasn't clean!), and it was bigger with more room in the bathroom to store our sponge bags. Luckily the a/c was less noisy. We also had issues with the key cards and had to get them reprogrammed. The only gripe was that the tea wasn't replaced (but we got some readily at reception), the notepad & pen wasn't replaced but the towels were, when we didn't ask them to be. They had the usual sign to hang them up if you want to reuse them but they chose to ignore it! The linen was nice and we had a quilt which we prefer and the bed was comfy. We like the fact that rooms have safes. Despite the tired look we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable hotel in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: PROUDYORKIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at Easter Weekend and were not disappointed. The service and staff at this hotel are fantastic and we were allocated a room despite arriving at 7.30am to check in following a gruelling 22 hour flight from the UK. The hotel is perfectly located in the 'Rocks' area and is minutes from the Harbour Bridge, Quay and Opera House. Indeed, the hotel's superb 8th floor roof terrace gives the opportunity to take good pictures of the Sydney vista. Breakfast is a must here and represents good value at their offer rate of $18 (posted under room door overnight) versus other expensive tourist traps next door. Would strongly recommend a stay here for the location rather than the room quality which is ok but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “what a view”
Reviews.Author: ges000
Reviews.Content: great location. rooftop pool. fantastic view - bridge, opera house, city. Hotel clean, well maintained, rooms pretty good - city view from our room was good. Best thing about this hotel was the location - walking distance to most central areas, restaurants, boats etc

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean & comfortable but bit soulless”
Reviews.Author: HectorRN
Reviews.Content: Wihtin short walk to Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge and with plenty of eating places nearby this hotel provides a perfect spot for a trip to Sydney. Was a bit noisy due to night markets and music from pubs BUT didn't go on too late thankfully. Didn't have a view from our room but we weren't in it very much so not a problem. And it did have a guest laundry which was a boon as we'd been doing a lot of travelling and needed to catch up before the next leg of our trip. Staff friendly and helpful and arranged late checkout on our last day. A discount to guests for the internet access would have been appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in fantastic Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Staffstiger
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, between the bridge and the Opera house, right by the harbour and Circular Quay. We asked for a high room with a view and they did not dissapoint we had a view of the bridge, harbour and opera house from our room. The staff here were very pleasant and helpful and the rooms are comfortable. Each morning we went to a lovely cafe at the side of the hotel called The Fine Food shop/cafe, go through the side door at the hotel and you are there. The rocks is a great area with a good atmosphere, we also enjoyed the markets there on a Saturday. A day on the ferries is great, Watsons, Bay, Manly and the fish market are all well worth a visit. The city bus tour is great to get your bearings and also for getting to Bondi.The Opera house tour is great but we also saw Nigel Kennedy there and that was amazing. All in all a fantastic location and we would definitely stay at the Hol Inn when we return to Sydney in the future. The roof top pool has a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: uglygourd
Reviews.Content: As others have said great location walking distance to the bridge and bridge climb base the opera house botanical garden . Also the market on a Sunday is on its doorstep Great staff and a good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Shinigami
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my pre-wedding and wedding night coz our reception is just a walking distance from the hotel. The room is great. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. It's only a few meters away from the Darling Harbour Bridge. So it has a fantastic location. Very good place to stay for the new year's eve. Coz you can see the whole thing at the roof top. The view is just amazing!!! if only not too expensive, i could have booked this for the NYE.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the very best position”
Reviews.Author: Amethyst31
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel and it is truly excellent venue. Right in the Rocks area of Sydney and convenient for just about everything. The staff are exceptional and the hotel is of a high standard. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff but poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_S_26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in December 2009 on a room only basis as part of our honeymoon to Australia and New Zealand. The hotel is in the most amazing location within a couple of minutes walking distance of Circular Quay. You're right in the rocks which is great for lovely bars and restaurants and the markets that they hold there regularly. It's also just around the corner from the Tourist Information Centre which is handy. The views from the roof terrace are fantastic and we loved going up there at night after dinner just to stare over to the harbour bridge and opera and house and back at the city. The only complaint here was that the biggest cruise ship I have ever seen was blocking the view of the opera house for 4 days of our stay. This was replaced by a smaller one the next day from which you could see over the top of. If you're booking a harbour view room I would check if a cruise ship is going to be in as they really aren't that pretty to look at! We used the pool and spa up on the roof twice which was good but could do with some serious TLC. We were given a room on the top floor initially which unfortunately we had to ask to be moved from as the air conditioning grate was loose and there was no way we could have slept through the rattling noise. Reception moved us without question and were very friendly about the whole thing. The room we were moved to was on the 4th floor and overlooked the Italian restaurant at the back of hotel. The air con was still noisy but nothing like the first room. The room was smart and clean (though there was a dodgy stain on the bed runner...) with modern decor and a newish bathroom. The bath's plug was broken, but this didn't matter to us as we only used the shower. One of the electical sockets by the desk-come-dressing table was intermittently broken which was odd. Sometimes I had to unplug the alarm clock to dry my hair! We paid to use the internet computers in the lobby on 3 occasions to update our family on our trip however the computers were a bit battered and slow and kept crashing which when you've paid $10 for half an hours internet access is a bit of a nightmare. With one particularly bad crash where the receptionist had to unplug the computer and start again we did get a free internet card as an apology. The bar area is very nice and we ate there once and had the odd after dinner drink. It's quite pricey but then so is most of Sydney! What we did eat and drink was good quality. All in all it's a nice hotel, with friendly staff, in a superb location but I would have expected less niggles for Â£170 a night room only. I've stayed in similar standard hotels in the UK for Â£65 per night B&B. Granted they're not in Sydney but Â£105 a night extra for location...hmmm.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Old Sydney”
Reviews.Author: NaOLis
Reviews.Content: The hotel self isn't very stylish but the rooms are neat and has enough space for a baby cot... The location is great, as it's right vis a vis from the opera, next to Harbor Bridge and Circular Quay...

Reviews.Title: “good for value with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: beaut_stuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at one of the best spot in Sydney, at The Rocks, very close to Circular Quay and Opera House. We booked a promotional rate at last minute through the hotel directly, but later found a cheaper rate on wotif. Due to their Best Rate Guarantee policy, our rate was reduced accordingly. This seemed to create conflict with the hotel when we checked out the next morning - they tried to charge us the higher rate. I think this is a poor customer service - since I have it in writing and all paid for, they should have just lived with it. In any case, after almost 20 minutes, it seemed they have confused themselves with their own promotions, and let us go. Good thing is they apologised for holding us back. The room was okay, but it was a bit noisy as we were next to a pub. Luckily we were so tired, it didn't bother us. The hotel is comfortable, but it certainly has seen better days and small upgrades would have gone a long way. We will stay here again, but definitely for the location and not for the hotel room itself.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, wonderful views, great breakfast - good price!”
Reviews.Author: D&LONTARIO
Reviews.Content: This was the place to be. We got off the Diamond Princess and were able to walk to this well situated hotel. Our room was available at 9.30am which made it so convenient. The views were great and we watched the Diamond sail away in the evening from the rooftop. So convenient to walk to the Opera House and down to the quay or hop on a bus. We were able to get a special price for our stay and wished would would have been able to stay longer. Swimming pool area not so great but this is an older hotel and we were there to see the sights. Our room was on the side where the road was and it was a little noisy until 11pm or so but would still have taken this room for the view of the harbour. Sydney is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Hotel Room we ever stayed in! Hotel Location Good”
Reviews.Author: Si17
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in October as part of an extended Honeymoon. We arrived tired after 24 hours travelling. When we got into our room it was filthy, there must have been 6 months of dirt, hair and toe nails around the edges of the room. The first member of staff we spoke to was not very helpful and on the verge of being rude. However I then asked for the duty manager to come and inspect the room, she was very helpful, I asked for our money back but she arranged for the room to be cleaned again and we moved the next day to a larger room. However there can be no reason for a room to be in such a dirty state, the cleaners and supervisors were not doing their job well at all. The location of the hotel is good, however be prepared for alot of noise from nearby bars. The Spa is nothing like it looks in the brochure, be prepared for disappointment. There are alot of nicer hotels within less than 5 minutes walk from here which are better value.

Reviews.Title: “Prior to our cruise aboard the Diamond Princess”
Reviews.Author: wowmom10
Reviews.Content: great hotel. Close to the ship. We loved the observation deck. What a view of everything. And when the ship docked the next morning, It made a great portrait of all of standing in front of it! Hotel people were very accomodating

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: sydneywebshopper
Reviews.Content: Rooms: comfortable and clean, standard size - downside is that we couldn't open our windows - considering the hotel is not a high rise I'm not sure why it was deemed necessary to do this, kind of left you feeling suffocated. Also there was only one lift working at the time of our stay so it was like peak hour traffic when guests were trying to haul their luggage from reception. Overall, the hotel is conveniently situated which is one of its drawcards and there is parking available under the hotel which is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointing end to a wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: NatD18
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty average - it's saving graces are the location (fantastic) and the roof-top pool (wonderful views of Circular Quay). We spent the last two nights of our honeymoon here and, at $350+ a night, probably paid too much. We had a pretty basic room on Floor 2 with no view except for the taxi rank outside the front door. Clean and reasonably appointed but the room was akin to only a very good UK 3 star. Would recommend on the strength of location and the pool, but not at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Ailish1973
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for New Year and the location for this time of year is excellent. When there is 1.5 million people in a city for one night, to be able to go onto your own rooftop and see the fireworks, without fighting the crowd is a real bonus! The location full stop is ideal for getting around Sydney and being close to some great restaurants. If we were to be overly critical, the hotel would benefit from some updating and decorating, but regardless of this the rooms were clean. The air con was very loud in the room so it was not possible to leave it on whilst sleeping - sounded like being in a wind tunnel! There was also some very, very loud early morning noise (4am) setting up the weekend market at the back of the hotel! Good breakfasts too, great range covering fresh juices to full cooked breakfasts - something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views from rooftop pool & jacuzzi on Opera House and Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Discover_the_globe
Reviews.Content: - Very nice location, close to Opera House and Circular Quay - Delicious breakfast buffet, incl juicemaker, pancakes, egges, ... - Stunning views from rooftop pool and jacuzzi on Harbour bridge and Opera House. The pool area itself however could use some refurbishing since it shows some signs of wear-out. - Spotless, clean rooms (not huge), but with choice of different pillows ;-)

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: KatharinaM1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location at the Rocks. Pool on rooftop, with an impressive view of the Bridge, Operahouse and City centre. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and fab roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Beth29Yorkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel- the rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff always friendly and helpful which is all I ask. So the added bonus of a roof terrace where you can sit and admire the opera house and harbour bridge is amazing! Also the location cannot be faulted especially if you only have a couple of days in sydney you are right in the Rocks and easy walk to circular quay and the rest of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scatty51
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty standard but the service was excellent. The location for the Opera house, the Quay and that end of Sydney was perfect. Fantastic view from the roof pool area and a very nice buffet breakfast. Best thing was the extremely pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!”
Reviews.Author: doug81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a sale, so we paid less than $100 per night. Having said that, it was a really nice hotel and worth a lot more for the great service and location. We arrived early on Sunday as the first stop on our honeymoon, and while our room was getting ready we walked outside and checked out the local markets. We only stayed 2 nights, but had no trouble with the noise whatsoever. The room we had was a corner room, and we could see the bridge and the opera house which was pretty cool. There was a nice french bakery around the corner, and it was only a short walk down George St to the main shopping district and Chinatown/Darling Harbour. A great start to the honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Numi2026
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel's location - right by the harbour with views from our huge room to the Opera House. The fact that a giant cruise liner was in port for a couple of days and blocked some of the view didn't detract - we could watch the comings and goings on the ship, then all the ceremony as it set sail. Staff were really helpful and had our room ready early and also made up a sofa bed for my daughter, who arrived in Sydney separately without booking anywhere to stay. An unexpected heatwave (40 degrees in November) made the rooftop pool a boon early in the morning - amazing views. Street markets in the lanes around the hotel on Friday night made it really interesting and lively. So much to see right on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: MallyBeckenham
Reviews.Content: Everything you want for a city trip to Sydney, we stayed for 4 nights. The location is fantastic, bedrooms comfortable enough, 4-star seemed stretching it a bit but we didn't intend on spending a great deal of time in the actual room. There was an in-room safe, that had to be opened/closed using a visa or mastercard and the rooms were well maintained. The view from the pool on the roof is fantastic, we had to check it out during the day and evening. The breakfast was average, we say this only because we stayed in another 2 Holiday Inns as part of this trip and it was not to the same standard. It depends what you like though, there was a fully cooked breakfast but the selection of fresh fruit, yoghurts and pastries were poor. Would stay again mainly because of the location. I found the check-in staff rude and I think they need a bit of advice on what customer service means, which was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Welshwhitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Rocks whilst my husband was working in Sydney. This hotel is in a great location just 5 min walk to Circular Quay, 15min walk to the city/shops and 5 min from a lot of restaurants. The roof top pool is not large,( the beds could have done with being replaced) but has a great view and is a nice place to sit and watch the activity in the Harbour. It would be good to have a place to get a drink up there as you have to dress and go down in the lift to the bar. The Hotel itself is a typical Holiday Inn - with adequate facilities and comfort. Considering its location I thought it was excellent value for money. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and I enjoyed my stay there and would certainly stay there again when I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, needs a bit of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: alvysinger
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the Rocks and overlooking Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay, this is the perfect location for a hotel in Sydney. The staff had been very helpful in advance in booking a restaurant and this helpful attitude continued during our stay. The hotel has a rooftop hottub and pool from which you have great views of the opera house and bridge especially at night. Even though we had an executive suite I thought the overall appearance of the room was a little bit tired. A very solid 4 out of 5. If they do a bit of a refurb, not much, just a wee spruce up, that would be a maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MSK085
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in November. Can't add anymore to the comments [about the great location, view and great value for money]. We had room 610 and it was THE BEST room in the hotel - we had a clear 6 day view of the opera house from our windows [3!!]. All the hotel staff are very friendly, helpful and cheerful. Thank you for a great stay - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: HiSueDevon
Reviews.Content: Extremely handy for all the sights.It reminded me of a prison inside when walking to the rooms.Clean and friendly,Very noisy on Saturday nights.The staff did offer us a different our room but we couldn't be bothered to pack up again!!Anyway it didn't happen other nights. Laundry very useful when travelling and powder provided!! Not luxury but great value for seeing Sydney and a clean and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyS2
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay. Best rates. My family always stays here whenever we travel to Sydney. You can't be the location.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: cariad6
Reviews.Content: Came to Sydney exactly 2 years ago & stayed in the Radisson, which was lovely, but when we visited the Rocks, which we did often & saw this hotel, we said then that if we ever came back we'd stay there! So we did! And did not regret it at all. The location is superb, right in the Rocks area, near the Bridge and Harbour/Opera House/eateries. We booked it through Trailfinders who must have informed them that we had a birthday, and was given a fab room overlooking the Harbour and sights! [don't know if this was significant, but it happened]. Easy to catch the ferries out and about the area, trains, and a short stroll to the shopping areas. We walked as well over to Darling Harbour, which was within reach. Lovely swimming pool on the roof with a great heated jacuzzi! Views from the rooftop are outstanding! Not much regarding entertainment, small bar area, but then everything you could want is within throwing distance! Staff helpful as well. Will add photos when I return home from Aus.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC VALUE FOR A$123 IN ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: juliezzz
Reviews.Content: Booked a MYSTERY/SECRET hotel in the Rocks on Wotif (4 star) for $123 as we were arriving in Sydney late at night and were initially disappointed it was the Old Holiday Inn. Our subsequent nights were booked into the more expensive and supposedly better located waterfront Sebel Pier One at $270 per night. After staying in both, we unanimously agreed that the Old Holiday Inn was a bargain. Smack bang in the middle of the action, with night markets, Arglye Hotel and restaurants right at your door. The rooms were very small, the bathroom tiny and you can't open the window. However, everything was very clean, newly renovated and staff were efficient and friendly. Despite being next door to a pub which has an outdoor beergarden, the rooms are quiet due to double glazing. There are lots of lovely places to have breakfast nearby and I wished we had stayed there instead of the overrated Sebel for the remainder of our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: YorkieCumbria
Reviews.Content: visited in September as part of a 6 week holiday. Hotel location already known to us but not the actual hotel. The location was brilliant. We had a quiet room at the rear of the hotel but the views from the corridoor in front were fantastic. The pool on the roof was superb even if I did have to duck when a swallow chose to fly low over the water! Would we stay there again of course we would. The funniest part of the stay was having an alarm call from a saxaphone player as part of the Sunday market at 10.30 which was so much nicer than an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fabulous views from the roof”
Reviews.Author: rjwalker
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the historical Rocks area for easy walking to the bridge, opera house, ferries, botanical gardens and museum of contemporary art, plus the rocks area itself. The rooms are big with arm chairs and a table but our bathroom was showing signs of wear, allthough the hotel had apologised in advance and said all rooms were being refurbished. Our room had a fridge. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, it seemed expensive compared to the cafes outside the hotel. The pool on the roof offers spectacular views of the bridge and the opera house, don't forget to view it at night as well. We were concerned about the reports of noise so asked for a quiet room, which we got on the sixth floor. We couldn't hear any noise from the pubs around the hotel but I was woken up at 6.00 am on the Friday morning by the sounds of the weekend market being set up. My wife slept through it !!. Overall, the location is the big advantage of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1night and overall was a great experience. The room was clean and tidy and very quiet. The location is great with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge just accross the road. The staff were also very helpful and stored my luggage in a secure area for free. The cooked breakfast was very good with a large variety. The rooftop pool and spa was very cool - with fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in two year and we were not disappointed. Refurbished bathrooms are nice. Room clean, bed very comfortable. Received discounted breakfast vouchers - breakfast was delicious, especially the cooked to order eggs and the coffee machine!!! Location is perfect! Booked this time as a "mystery hotel" through Last Minute - great price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Hezz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon and the location couldn't have been better, only 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 6th floor and was a good size with an amazing view of the harbour and the opera house. The room was clean with plenty of space. The bathroom was a little small and tired in terms of decoration but the hotel is apparently going through a refurbishment at the moment. Breakfast was a buffet with a great selection of hot and cold foods and a counter cooking fresh eggs or pancakes. The rooftop pool is small but the view is spectacular. Its great to have a jacuzzi while looking at the harbour bridge! In terms of location it couldn't have been better, right in the heart of the rocks and next the the visitor centre. Some reviews have mentioned noise, we were there for friday and saturday nights and despite being on the 6th floor we could hear people outside but it didn't disturb us - maybe it would have if we were lower down. All in all it was a good hotel, clean, comfortable with good services and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Ginand7
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal on a Harbour view suite at this hotel through the Intercontinental Website (Holiday Inn is part of this chain). It is excellently located in The Rocks in walking distance from Circular Quay, which has convenient transport to/from the airport. The check-in staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was spacious and nice, but not too flash. The bathroom was clean but had seen better days (eg. cracked and painted over tiles) but all of this was well worth the amazing view. Not only did we get our "harbour view" but a direct view of the Opera House. Spectacular!! There is also a tremendous 360 view on the rooftop, which also houses the pool. We were lucky though, as the day we were checking out a cruise ship arrived - which blocks the view from the room completely.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: beanb41
Reviews.Content: We initially booked our stay at the Hotel through WOTIF.com as a secret hotel which provided a heavily discounted rate compared with the rack rate and other offers available at the time. I must admit to having reservations about staying at the HI if I was to pay full rack rate. Having due regard to the many reviews available for this hotel on TA we emailed the hotel direct with a couple of requests and they were quickly dealt with and responded to. Our biggest concern was noise from the hotel next door and from the market setup on Saturday and Sunday mornings. My fears were allayed as we were given a room on the 8th floor in the north east corner well away from the offending areas. The real noisy part of the hotel is the south east corner on the lower levels right next to the hotel. Because of its proximity to the pub there is little hotel can do to stop the noise from the live bands permeating into the rooms. My discussions with the General Manager indicated that where possible they put the younger party goers in that part of the hotel on weekends. The upper floors of the hotel are still to have their bathrooms renovated. The renovations are currently on the 6th floor and should all be completed I am advised by November. Our room was adequate for the two of us and being on the uppermost floor we had views of the harbour and an obstructed view of the Opera House. The pool area on the roof offers magnificent views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and back through to Circular Quay which to say are spectacular is putting too fine a point on it. The pool on the roof top is heated to 27 degrees and the jacuzzi 37 degrees centigrade. The main pool is approx 8 metres by 3 metres and is 1 metre deep. Around the pool is a balcony ideal for having drinks and nibbles whilst enjoying the view. Pool towels and a shower are provided on the roof for guests use. We had one breakfast in the hotel during our stay and that was a typical full buffet style Australian breakfast with bacon, eggs, sausages etc toast, tea and coffee. We were given a voucher on arrival for a discounted price of $16 per head instead of the normal $24. It was very filling as expected. A guest laundry is available on the 4th floor from 9.00 am and 8.00pm which we took advantage of. Cost of a washer is $2.00 as is the dryer. Each cycles takes approx 35 mins. As a Prestige Points member ( which I joined after booking the hotel) I was invited to meet with Senior Management of the hotel to discuss my stay, an invitation I took advanatage of and had a very friendly chat with the General Manager. I was pleased to advise her that the level of service we had received during our 5 day stay was of the highest order and that all members of staff from the highest level to the cleaners were courteous, polite, friendly and extremely helpful. A previous review of this hotel made comment about the lighting in corridors or lack of it. Unfortunately the hotel is using ECO bulbs and until manufacturers can come up with an ECO bulb with the same lux( amount of light level) as an incandescent bulb this problem will continue. We come to Sydney every year around the beginning of October and we will stay at this establishment in the future. The Old Sydney Holiday Inn is situated right in the middle of the Rocks in Old Sydney Town and because of the heritage nature of the area limited improvement on the buildings is permitted. The area is full of character, a few minutes walk to the ferries and trains at CIrcular Quay and restaurants and cafes abound. My one negative about our stay would have to have been our inability to find a decent cup of coffee, that was until our last day when we were recommended to try the french cafe / patisserie in Argyle St a few minutes walk from the hotel. This is where the hotel staff have their coffees. They were not wrong. In conclusion a big thank you to Leanne Graham and her team for a very pleasant stay in Sydney and we will see you again next year. Mike from Wellington.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: girlsinging
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-night stay online as part of a Holiday Inn sale - the rate was very low ($99) and we assumed we would be put in the worst room in the place (as many hotels tend to do). We were amazed when we were handed the keys for an 8th floor room, and when we opened the window we had an incredible view of the Harbour Bridge, the Rocks Market below, and out to the water in Circular Quay. We were very impressed with all aspects of our stay, even though it was so short. From the spectacular rooftop view, the incredible location (we were fortunate to have no noise, even though we arrived during the Rocks Market), the friendly staff, the valet parking service, the room facilities and amenities ... it was all great. Yes, the bathrooms are getting a bit old, but everything was clean and tidy and on a discounted rate we had absolutely nothing to complain about - we were thrilled with our experience. Hot tip: Skip the room service (which we didn't try) and get a table at Caminetto (Italian restaurant) at the back of the Rocks, with dessert at the Guylian chocolate cafe. Fantastic 24 hours in Sydney, thanks Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AZHikerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn during the week of Sept. 20th (the week of the big dust storm). The room was a nice basic room in a super location. It was just what I wanted for my trip to Sydney; a very affordable room to sleep in after touring the city all day. The views from the roof were amazing. Be sure to bring your camera! The hotel staff were very attentive and friendly. On our first night, the night shift manager took the time to talk to my mother and make her coffee when she was unable to sleep. Noise - A lot of reviews mentioned excessive noise. During my stay I did not hear a thing at night. Another nice thing about the Holiday Inn is that it is in a relaxing area. Most of the hotels are in the CBD and they just seem to busy for me. Downtown traffic, cars whipping by, ect. When you walk out of the Holiday Inn, you are in the Rocks and surrounded by several little side streets that don't have traffic. Lastly, if you like to eat reasonable healthy, there is a Subway behind the hotel. When I return to Sydney I will stay at the Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel for a stay in Sydney, I would definitely recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Daman1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night on a weekend trip to the city, and found the Holiday Inn Old Sydney to be a very good choice. It is close to all the attractions, and the Rocks Markets are right outside the hotel. It is a short walk down to the water, where there are good views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the city as a whole. We stayed on a gift certificate and are Priority Club Platinum Members. The hotel makes a very big deal about its pool and the great view. While all of this is true, there is an infinitesimal chance that you will get the pool all to your own. There is a small spa and the pool is not much bigger, perhaps 4-5m in length. There are many tables and chairs on the rooftop where we found people sitting, having drinks or food and enjoying the marvellous view. The rooms have been recently renovated and were quite nice and spacious. We had a glimpse of the Harbour Bridge from our room, which was quite nice. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of TV channels. There was an inroom safe and plenty of closet space. We had no noise problems although there were bars and stuff that we could see outside. One thing I would like to say is that the hallways are EXTREMELY dark, so dark in fact that you can barely see the room numbers! This was completely shocking and I think the hotel needs to rectify this immediately. Also, some of the rooms are on a sort of mid-level, where you get out of the lift and have to go down some stairs. If you have trouble with stairs, make sure that you specify that you want a room where you don't need to go up or down the stairs. Our package included a bottle of wine, which was supposed to be delivered at 5:00pm. At about 6:00pm we called the staff who said they were very busy and weren't able to deliver it. We had to pressure them to bring it up to our room. When it came they did not bring the full-sized bottle that the package entitled us to, but instead just a glass of wine. I would prefer if the hotel kept to what was promised. Dining options at the hotel are quite limited. There is a room service menu available, and the same menu is available at the small bar in the lobby. Breakfast is served at the Playfair Terrace restaurant and costs $24/adult. It is a hot breakfast buffet and there was a chef cooking eggs to order. An interesting feature was the chef's daily special, which was an item that was cooked in the kitchen and brought out to the table if you requested it. For us it was pancakes, and they were quite nice. The hotel passed a letter under the door of all rooms the night before with a coupon which entitled two guests from each room to the same breakfast at a discounted price of $16, which was very reasonable. We had dinner at Wok 'n' Noodles, a small restaurant just outside the hotel which had quick Asian food at a very low price, coupled with a nice view of the city. If you would like to go there I am sure that the staff can provide directions. Another place that looked good was the Pancakes on the Rocks, which was VERY busy. As Platinum Elite benefits come, we were given a letter saying that they welcomed us and would be delighted to speak with us if we had the time, and a phone call in the evening to ask a few survey questions. We were also given a late check-out. They did not offer us the complimentary room upgrade entitlement. So all in all I would recommend the Holiday Inn Old Sydney to those who are visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & hotel especially the roof top view!”
Reviews.Author: Shorty1205
Reviews.Content: My partner & i went stayed here for 6 nights in early September and were very impressed with everything about the hotel & its location. The main attraction is the roof top pool. It has outstanding views of the Harbour Bridge & the Opera House. We watched the sunrise every morning which was magnificent, and also the view of the city by night when its all lit up. The rooms were very spacious and well equiped. The bed was very comfy! Just across the road is the harbour and 5mins walk up George st is all the shops, bus station and circulay quay etc. There are plenty of shops & restaurants close by ( Bakers Oven Cafe, Quayside food court and Argyle pub were the best!) and a newsagent next door which is open late and very handy! Overall we were extremely pleased with the hotel and its location!

Reviews.Title: “No sleep at all!”
Reviews.Author: yorkygirlCentralQld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for day and evening sightseeing and restaurants BUT beware there are many night clubs nearby AND the famous "rocks Markets" are at the door. That sounds great but the night club and street noise didnt stop until 3am THEN the council and stall holders set up for the markets from 3am onwards. No sleep at all. Our room was very large but no luggage rack and a tiny a very old bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & Service, not noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lucy7316
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Sydney and stayed at the old Holiday inn for 6 nights. Don't know what the other reviewer was talking about maybe they were in a bad room but we had no problems whatsoever with noises! the location is excellent so close to the opera house and circular quay so easy access to the public transport. Bit of a walk into the CBD to go shopping but still walkable! All the staff here we dealt with were awesome. Very friendly and helpful which makes a big difference when staying somewhere. Didn't try dinner at the restuarant but breakfast was great!! Buffet breakfast, squeeze your own juice and eggs cooked to order! we stayed in a standard queen room, it was quite nice, bathroom was bit old and outdated but we had a notice saying bathrooms were being upgraded so nothing to complain about! Would definately recommend this place and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and NOT NOISY”
Reviews.Author: kayjay22
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights and the hotel was certainly not noisy though I'd agree the area was a lot livelier at the weekend. Situated in the heart of The Rocks which must be the best place to stay in Sydney. Admittedly you have to go to the rooftop pool to get the view but far better than the other 'top' hotels which sit much further back.

Reviews.Title: “The best view in the world - room 610”
Reviews.Author: AmuseYou
Reviews.Content: We wanted a room with a view of the Opera House and room 610 is it! Just spectacular! We stayed in another room for the first part of the trip and the view was partially blocked by another building, but the 2nd time we were there (the end of our trip) we got 610. Just wow! Also- the roof top pool is beautiful, but not heated. The view is worth it. The location of the hotel is perfect to see and do so many things. Right by tons of great restaurants, pubs, shops and the Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GriffinPeter
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay. I arrived early, and as it was said before by someone else, I was allowed to check in at 7 am. Very friendly staff, I was also allowed to check out later when I was leaving. Great views from the pool on the roof. I will definitely stay there next time I'm in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Best location and view”
Reviews.Author: geofmcgregor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 14 night on our visit to Sydney. The Hotel was very good with very helpful staff and in an excellent location and was also good value although the restaurant was a bit pricey and not so good. there are plenty eating places within 200 yards of this hotel and all are very good with reasonably prices. I would recommend this hotel, even only for its location and staff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Janna64
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early....about 7:30 am but they could check us in to our room! What a wonderful suprise after traveling for 15 hours!! Staff was very helpful at the front desk and made suggestions to make the most of our time there. Try the local cafes and bakeries for breakfast for better food at lower price than the on site restaurant. The views from the roof were amazing. The only thing we found a bother was that only one elevator was working during our stay.....the other was being repaired so there were long waits for the one small elevator. The Rocks is a perfect spot to stay in the city and we were pleased with our 4 nights there. (We stayed on an upper floor so never noticed noise from the pub as others mentioned)

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget your ear plugs!!”
Reviews.Author: HKRGeelongVictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with my sister.We got a great deal for our stay. Location - great, hotel - fine and bedroom totally adequate. We were please with our choice until night time when the music and noise from the pub next door kept us awake. Thurs night til 1am, Friday night til 2pm and Saturday til 3am. When I rang reception to try and get another room at 2am I was told that there were no spare rooms and was offered ear plugs!! Having read other reviews for this hotel I am surprised that there have not been any comments about this. Our room on the 5th floor was not the only one that would have been affected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CathP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon trip. The hotel is all abouts its location. You are in possibly the best spot to sightsee in Sydney. You are smack bang in the middle of the wonderful Rocks. The weekend market is literally out the front door. As for the hotel, we paid and had the breakfast once, but there are cheaper places nearby. A bakery just down the road has a courtyard where you share your visit with wild parrots! The rooms were fine, fairly standard, and the same as every other Holiday Inn I have ever been in. We changed room after 2 nights as we were on the 1st floor and it was noisy with deliveries early morning. The other room, on the back, overlooking the cobbled street and restaurants, was much better. We paid for a taxi to and from the airport, which was Â£15 one way and Â£8 the other....either way it is the easiest mode of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for large family”
Reviews.Author: El Camino
Reviews.Content: We found the Old Sydney Holiday Inn Hotel the ideal place for our family of ten. The rooms were comfortable, with all of the normal amenities. The breakfast, included in our room rate, was exceptional, eggs, pancakes, sausages, bacon, etc, in a very nice setting overlooking the lobby. The staff were tremendously helpful, and made reservations and suggestions for tours, which turned out to be excellent. They also arranged transfers for ten to the airport at a very reasonable price. Location, Location - Said so many times, and so very true. We walked everywhere - to the bridge, to circular quay, the opera house, Botanic Gardens, restaurants. I saw no other hotel so well situated. The eighth floor roof top was a fantastic place to watch the light show, which was going on when we were there. The views of the Opera House are stunning. This hotel made our introduction to Australia a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Find in an Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: creichmuth
Reviews.Content: Peoples...if you are traveling in Australia, go to Last Minute Australia (lastminute.com.au). A friend of mine recommended the site, we were feeling gutsy, we chose the "secret/mystery hotel" and VOILA! $110AU later (the rooms go for $268+AU a night!), we got our room! Besides the deal, some of the rooms have incredible views of the Harbour, Opera House, and Bridge. It is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with good location and brilliant views, just donâ€™t leave memory cards on beds..!”
Reviews.Author: Tom81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April for 6 nights over the Easter Period, great location and a good hotel.
