Staff when checking in were very friendly, especially as I had just had to contendwith the Sydney rush hour traffic, and was lucky enough to get given a room on the top floor looking out to Sydney harbour bridge, which was pretty cool. Staff also provided a good recommendation on were to eat that evening, without going too far. I was lucky enough to have breakfast included as part of my package, and the selection was good, and set you up for the day nicely. Roof top swimming pool provides brilliant views, and during my first two nights had spent many hours up there, sadly over the Easter weekend, became crowded, but this was expected. Great social space to relax with friends with one of the most famous backdrops in the world. One down side to my entire stay was that a Memory Card went missing from my bed after two days, admittedly they are small and could have easily been over looked, and this was a disappointment, as it had photos on from previous locations around the rest of Australia. Staff werenâ€™t overly helpful and never got back to me when I requested that the bed lining for the day be checked. However despite this, good hotel and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “HMMMM!”
Reviews.Author: marstrip
Reviews.Content: â€˜OLD SYDNEYâ€™ HOLIDAY INN 55 George St The Rocks Paid A$ 173 per night On a stay 4 pay 3 Deal HMMMM! This hotel was formed about 1980 and although still seemingly acceptable as we walked across the huge Atrium Lobby to check in but it seemed weary. As we checked in we were persuaded be the receptionist to upgrade at a cost of A$ 25 per night on the basis of a larger room and bed. It was on the 5th Floor at the front. The room was large and had a view of the historic buildings across the street and with a minute peep of the bay above. The wardrobe space was adequate and the bathroom, although dated, was OK. This is in a very lively area called â€˜The Rocksâ€� with restaurants, bars and shops. It is a mere cock-stride to Circular Quay and itâ€™s lively atmosphere. Ferries go fro here to all Sydneyâ€™s famous places. We went to Darling Harbour on the Saturday and there was a Jazz Festival in progress. This is a great city with plenty of things to do. When we woke after our second night my wife found and killed a huge 5mm long Bed Bug, which was strolling across her pillow! We reported it to the duty manager Kimberley, who was most apologetic and asked us to move to another room on 6th Floor with a good view of the Bridge, opera house and Circular Quay. She removed the upgrade charges and gave us a free breakfast. The lifts created a lot of congestion due to one of the two being replaced. There was excessive traffic noise from George St well into the early hours. This hotel, if it had been bug-free, would have been acceptable but there are better situated ones at about the same price, such as the brand new â€˜SEBEL PIER ONEâ€™ on the actual waterfront past the famous bridge. Next time we visit we will stay there. I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff however....”
Reviews.Author: Nikkidesigns
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient. After arriving in our room, we were shocked to find a used tube of KY jelly and a small bottle of some unknown lotion still sitting on the bedside table! We reported this to front desk who seemed genuinely shocked. We were offered another room however we had already unpacked. A bowl of fruit (not fresh) was offered as an apology and offending items removed. Room was adequate however bathroom was very small and old, dated. Mould around taps etc. This hotel is 8 floors however one elevator was out of service leaving only one other to service all 8 floors on one side of the building. This remaining elevator then malfunctioned in the evening leaving us the choice of either climbing 7 floors to our room or taking the service elevator. We chose the latter. Awoken at 5.30am by the sound of water running down pipes in the walls presumably by someone having a long shower in the room above us on the 8th floor. Breakfast was actually of a reasonable quality. Overall, this hotel has seen better days and is now in need of a major refurbishment. The hallways are dark and dingy however the staff were very helpful. You can find better value for money hotels in Sydney if you do your research. The only thing going for this hotel is its location in The Rocks part of Sydney. If you do happen to stay on the weekend also check out the great weekend markets that are literally on outside!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive dark and pokey - Can I have a refuned please ?”
Reviews.Author: 100cc
Reviews.Content: A good location and helpful staff who sorted out a car hire problem with Avis for me. BUT - An expensive hotel with dark small pokey rooms that makes you feel you are behind bars, although this does get you up and out in the morning to look round this great city. More than a few days staying here and you could contemplate jumping off the bridge (and thats not cheap). Can I have a refund please ? We stayed at about nine hotels during this 3 week trip and this was by far the most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great views”
Reviews.Author: frofro1
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel and checked in within an hour of each other after a mess up at the other place we were supposed to be staying. We had to pay top price for this last minute booking with one of the nights (out of a 3 night stay) costing $330 which I felt was quite a lot. However, when we arrived and checked in I felt that the money spent was worth it. On check in we asked for a room with a view of the Opera House and the reception staff were able to do this for us so we were over the moon with our room and the incredible view. The room was clean and had everything we needed. I didn't think it was particularly out of date as other reviews have said but it isn't decorated with any personality and does have that 'corporate American chain hotel' feel. We were fine with that because everything else made up for it. The location couldn't be better and it was great waking up in the morning with a view of the Opera House, or on two mornings, two different cruise ships which was interesting in itself. Pool on the roof is a bonus and along with the location is the reason we chose this hotel but the pool is much smaller than it seems in the photos. The views from up there are great and it's a lovely area to chill out with lots of tables and chairs to sit at. Great hotel, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional find if you want location and not really have to pay a premium for ammenities that you don't need.”
Reviews.Author: Randall-Anne
Reviews.Content: A terrifiec headquarter for seeing greater Sydney. On The Rocks, so to speak, and very close to all modes of travel and exucsions. Roof top pool area has geat view (harbor, bridge)--day or night picture ops. Room are adequate, comfortable, pleasant . . . but not luxurious or places you would want to entertain in (at least not outsiders). Staff was well trained and very helpful. Just consider it a very pleasant place to stay close to everything or transportation to everythin . .. fun walking area. Great signts. We didn't seek out special restaurtants or high end shopping, but pleasty is available. Restaurant not recommend, unless you just want to "eat." Great access to legitimate theater and concerts. Location is the key here. We are old youngsters. Severe health problem upon return that had nothing to do with the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: rlazzara
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasent enough hotel in a nice location with lovely views and right in the heart of The Rocks (Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge etc). There are plenty of places to eat but not much in the way of shopping close by. The hotel is easy to get to (when compared to other hotels in Sydney). The staff are also nice. However, the restaurant was closed on the nights I stayed and you were directed to the bar for meals. I did have room service for dinner though and the food was reasonable. Breakfast was ok. The hotel (rooms, decor etc) is looking a bit old and tired and the place could really use a refurbishment. However, the price was reasonable for Sydney which compensates. I was travelling alone on business so it was ok but I would not recommend it as a nice hotel for a romantic weekend or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Could use a little better service. Rooms to avoid”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney near the conclusion of an extended journey through the place they call Oz, and thus I had a number of large suitcases stuffed with souvenirs. No one offered assistance in wheeling the items in - it appears that they have surplussed their entire bell staff. Nevertheless, check in was expedient and trouble free. My room was on the second floor (the hotel has eight) and overlooked an alley. It turns out that the alley is used as part of the bar and lounge for the Observer Hotel and thus is loud and rowdy until all hours - but it wasn't so loud within the room as to require different accommodation. Tips: Breakfast is $24AUD. period. This gives you a buffet of the usual faire. Whilst the restaurant opens at 0600, the customised egg slash pancake station does not open until 0700. Rooms to avoid: Unless you like the sound and smell of laundry - avoid rooms 429 thru 432 as they are directly across (within meters) of the guest laundry facility. (This is especially interesting as Room 430 is labeled as an Executive room.) Internet: Internet Access is very expensive - at $5 AUD for 25 minutes. Once there, you will find the fantastic Rocks area of Sydney at your beck and call. Don't miss the fantastic Rocks crafts fair happening every weekend just outside the hotel's front door. I usually stay at the Marriott, but that hotel was booked and this hotel turned out to be a very good alternative. Traveler's Note: Circular Quay (pronounced "Key") CityRail station is two blocks to the South, and once there you have incredibly easy access to all of Sydney. I would recommend purchase of a DayTripper pass. At a price of $17 this gives you unlimited access to all rail, bus,and ferries for the day.

Reviews.Title: “shabby dump,redeemed only by the staff”
Reviews.Author: jpaulcook
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this place is rated similarly to the Intercontinental, there is no comparison. The position is great but the rooms are basic (albeit with comfortable beds) and the bathrooms are 5 years overdue a refit, grimy and uncomfortable.The self publicity would make you believe it was 4 star but the hideous green baize behind reception gives a hint of what lies inside.As for the "fabulous rooftop pool", think glorified footbath with a musty smell and only room for a handful of sunbeds. Clearly an estate agent with a wide angle lens did the photos! I paid Â£150 per night for an "executive" room- a lot for what it is. The staff, however, were very helpful and let us check in early after an overnight flight and change rooms no problem. Breakfast was OK in a school dining room kind of way. The owners need to spend some money sprucing this place up and stop relying on its position in The Rocks to sell it.

Reviews.Title: “could the location be any better?”
Reviews.Author: atp2007
Reviews.Content: Flew down to Sydney from Brisbane for a few days. I had struggled with choosing a hotel, but finally settled on the HI at the Rocks because of the location and was quite happy when we got there. The location could not be more convenient, easy walk to the ferry at the Quay, just around the harbor to the Opera House and a few block walk only to the walkway across the bridge. Even the neighborhood around the hotel was interesting, the Info center is just behind the hotel, as are several decent shops and smaller eateries for lunch. In the morning we could walk down the street to the coffee house and have coffee and a breakfast bun outdoors. Several times we walked down George Street to the indoor shopping areas and to the Aqurium and Darling Harbor easily, and you can take the ferry back to Circular Quay. Views from the hotel roof are outstanding and our room looked toward the Quay and downtown buildings, great nightitme lighting. If there are cruise ships coming in and out you can watch them from the roof, especially fascinating at night. Walk over to the park in front o the Hyatt (?) at the point near the foot of the bridge at night , the view is gorgeous. The hotel is clean but probably could use an updating. Size of our room was fine and we had no complaints. Desk staff was very helpful. We only had to walk a few blocks to the Avis office to pick up our rental. This was our first experience at an Aussie hotel and we were delighted to find the refrigerator, real milk for tea/coffee and biscuit/cookie treat that became standard at all the rest of our stays. The hotel guest internet PC worked faster than the Info Center ones and are available all the time. I had booked thru Expedia and then found a few weeks later the price had dropped by $80 USD for the stay. Expedia refused to rebook me, at the new price so I cancelled the booking (cost $17) and rebooked with Hotels.com who guarantees the price up until you get there, not just the 48 hours after booking. We were so in love with the experience there that we hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lesley-Win
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Expedia and therefore paid in full (for 3 nights)at the time of booking, but even so, we had to check out our last day in order to spend our last night in Sydney at a real hotel, the Stamford,(which was excellent!!! and not that much more expensive)...although the location of the Holiday Inn is ideal and the skeleton front staff were pleasant and tried to be helpful, there were just too many negatives: window that didn't open, dingy, cramped and not clean enough bathroom(fingerprint smudges on door and shower tiles), tired and dark interiors, extremely narrow hallways and elevators, overall kind of depressing...

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: allanjuno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite unique - it has a fabulous and quirky layout with an atrium style interior space. The location can not be faulted being 200 metres from both circular quay and the Harbour Bridge, with a view directly accross to the Opera House. Everything was in easy walking distance and any transport was easily picked up in Circular Quay (get a green weekly pass if you are there that long) The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great - nice rooftop pool and overall just a brilliant place to stay. Only partial criticism is the room sizes which are constrained by the shape of the building but they are adequate. No hesitation in recommending at the right price. I used Wotif.com in the weeks leading to our journey and got a good rate of 199 AUD per night.

Reviews.Title: “great location - but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: TheFranceFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for first time visitors to Sydney. It's close to the Bridge climb, Opera House, harbour ferries and different wharf attractions, etc. The roof top pool area has a terrific view of them all. Also the staff are friendly and allowed us tio check in much earlier than listed (a wonderful gesture for travellers making the long-haul to Australia). However, the rooms are a little worn and the local restuarants are over-priced with indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.... But not much else”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_KR
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels quite a bit, so my expectations might be higher than some, but that is no excuse for bad hotel service. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are Ok but you need to make sure you are not on the street side. Iâ€™m sure the rooms with views of the harbour bridge are greatâ€¦ but I would know. Our initial room was overlooking a busy street. We asked to be moved but, of course, there was nothing available unless we wanted to upgrade at a costâ€¦ we did ( the room was no better) because we wanted to get away from the street noise. The service was shocking. The checking in process was far longer than it should have been and checking outâ€¦.. you better give yourself at least an hour. And none of the staff seemed to really careâ€¦ they just worked at an extremely slow pace, and didnâ€™t seem concerned with the amount of people waiting. It was unacceptable. There are so many nice hotels in Sydneyâ€¦..in spite of the locationâ€¦â€¦I wouldnâ€™t go back.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: SunGirl75
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a weekend at the Holiday Inn and loved it. Great location and fabulous staff. The hotel has a great feel to it and a lot of character. The rooms are smallish but have big windows that open right up and are very nice to spend time in. Lovely little pool on the roof. One of my favourite hotels in Sydney and a great base to explore The Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Allanna01
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at the Old Sydney was part of a six week trip to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary. The Hotel was clean, modern, and the staff were more than helpful. The roof top Jacuzzi and swimming pool were a brilliant bonus to wake up to and wind down to in the evening, whilst taking in the spectacular views. The location was second to none. It was a stoneâ€™s throw from the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, bars, restaurants, ferry terminal, train station, Botanic gardens and the Saturday market was on your door step. We had a fantastic stay at this Hotel and it will always be one of our memorabe highlights of our stay in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IFTIKARTAXIS
Reviews.Content: We had been told this hotel was superb by the travel agent perfectly located near to the bridge and the opera house the staff couldn't do enough always ready to help and advise the room was spotless as was the hotel recommend the food especially the breakfast we stayed for the new years celebration like a dream come true well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: We took the hop-on-hop-off double decker bus all over Sydney, and after seeing the whole city, in my opinion, there is not a hotel with a better location. You can walk to the ferries, restaurants, Darling Harbor. The view from the rooftop is great (pool and hot tub located on roof too). We did not include breakfast in our hotel rate and we found the "G-Day Cafe" (a three minute walk) from the hotel to be very reasonable and tasty. Keep in mind that ALL restaurants in Sydney are very expensive. We stayed in an executive room with a "harbor view". It's actually just a little window in the room, but we grew to really enjoy peaking out at the Opera House and harbor/cruise ships/ferry activity. Initially, the Opera House did not hold much interest for me, but we took the tour which was great, and the one thing I would have done differently in Sydney would have been to purchase tickets to some event at the Opera House in advance as there was an Aussie comedy show going on that we would have like to see but they were sold out. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Hotel was very clean. Would most definately recommend. They take AAA discounts. My favorite place in Sydney was Watson's Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect touristic location, affordable price”
Reviews.Author: SimoneEv
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 times in Old Sydney Holiday. Clean, modest looking, amazing location - you are 2 steps away from Sydney Bridge and Sydney Opera House. Also very close to countless wine bars and pubs, there's something in for all the budgets. The staff was friendly and helped me choose the tours worth taken in Sydney. The first time, I have spent New years eve 2007/2008 there and stayed for 5 days. My room was facing the back of the building towards The Rocks. It was nice and I thought will be noisy as the windows were facing the restaurants but that was not a problem. The room was small and modest in decoration but clean. The location of the hotel it's stunning for the new years eve ! The hotel organizes a free access party to the roof toop and you see all fire works. The access is granted to hotel tourists only. They have sent a "party kit" to everyone in a bag : chocolates and champagne. After the champagne glass on the house you have to pay for all your bar order on the roof top but I thought the deal was amazing. In Sydney you pay in a restaurant somewhere around 200 euro to stay out of the crowd and face the bridge with all the show ! The second time in January, I was returning from Hayman Island and stayed for only 3 days. This time the room was facing the Opera House and Bridge. What a change ! Larger room and modern decorations. Breakfast was paid separately but wouldn't bother. Facing the hotel there's a little organic/bio shop where you can have fresh juices and all the goodies for 15 euro per person. Having heard other tourists about the standard of Sydney hotel, I would say this is the best deal existing in town.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a swim”
Reviews.Author: TelnChel
Reviews.Content: Clean, tidy and pretty basic - but what a view from the swimming pool on the hotel roof - Sydney Harbour Bridge one side and the Opera House on the other.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: SydSider08
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn was outstanding. We stayed there around New Years last year and even though they were very busy the service was great. We were able to leave our luggage in their locked luggage room even after we had checked out so we could see a bit more of the city before we packed up and headed out of town. They didn't charge for this service as other hotels often do. The rooftop pool is a great asset to this hotel - it really provides some stunning views of the city skyline, opera house and the harbour bridge. Although some rooms are smaller in size, our room was quite large and had a great view of the Opera house. We were upgraded to a room on the front side of the hotel for free - all we did was ask for an upgrade and we received one. From my experience, big city hotels don't often do this. It was a nice touch on their part. I've been to Sydney a couple of times now and this was my first experience staying at a hotel right in the city. The location of this hotel is great - it's in The Rocks district of Sydney which is not quite the City Centre, but it's within walking distance of it. The location provides a quieter atmosphere with many small shops and a wide variety of restraunts (if you visit, you need to try Pancakes on The Rocks, it's great). You don't need to deal with the crowded City Centre sidewalks or the noisey buses on the streets. Plus, if you don't feel like making the 10-15 minute walk to the city it's only a $5-7 cab ride to downtown. Even though the stay was great, there is always room for improvement. My only gripes with this hotel are the overpriced breakfast they offer and the cruise ship docking station right across the street. First, the breakfast: You expect to pay in upwards of $15-20 per person for a buffet breakfast in the city, but this buffet was $24/person when we stayed and it certainly was not worth that much. A short walk up Geroge Street or in the other direction up through The Rocks will yeild many smaller restraunts with much more competitively priced breakfasts (and often times better tasting too). Regarding the cruise ship docking station - that was the biggest disappointment of our stay. Shortly after we arrived, a very large cruise ship came into town for the remainder of our stay at the hotel. For anyone who doesn't know, these oceanliner cruise ships are absolutley massive in size. They are so massive that they block any view of the Opera House from the hotel, even from the rooftop pool area. It wasn't a huge problem, but it was disappointing all the same. All-in-all this hotel offered a great atmosphere, great location, great service and above all, a great price. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MandyCardiff
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here while on a round the world trip. I would definately agree with previous reviews that the rooms could do with re-decorating and upgrading. We stayed on the 5th floor and only just had a brief harbour view. The rooms are clean and nothing special, but 'ok', after all you only need the room to get your head down at night, then get straight back out to see the sights! But the location is superb! We received fantastic customer service when there. Breakfast is buffet style and is delicious and with good choice. The pool on the roof is small and was lovely to use, and the view from there was amazing. The harbour is great and of course the sydney opera house is a major landmark to photograph. There is a taxi rank right outside the front door and across the road is the bus stop for the city sight-seeing tour bus. There are plenty of good shops, cafes and restaurants right on the doorstep. Had a coastal tour by harley davidson trike, which was amazing! Also went to the blue mountains, but it was so misty and foggy that day, we didnt see anything! Due to the location and great customer service, i would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Litetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for three nights at the beginning of our trip to Australia. The location was our main reason for choosing this hotel and it did not disappoint. Our room was on the thrid floor and was well appointed and maintained. We overlooked the rocks area and the only gripe was a Friday 6am arrival of a crew to errect a stage in preparation for the November Fridays live music gigs in the Rocks. On a positive note we had "front seats" from the comfort our room at the performances later in the evening! All the staff we had contact with were welcoming, helpful and friendly. For value for money,location and view from the rooftop pool choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value”
Reviews.Author: andrina
Reviews.Content: We were on a long trip and Sydney was one of the places we needed a hotel as opposed to staying with friends or on an organised tour. We didn't know Sydney at all but had been advised to look for somewhere in the Rocks or Circular Quay. I spent quite a while searching on the internet but the day before we were going i looked on Wotif and found this hotel for 6 nights with breakfast for about Â£550. It was great! We arrived too early for the room to be ready but were given a key to the roof and we couldn't believe our eyes when we saw the view of the opera house and the bridge. The room didn't have the view but it didn't matter as the pool did and we were only 2 minutes away from the real thing! Staff were very helpful, room was in need of a bit of updating but facilities were excellent. One thing - no parasols by the pool so on hot days it was a bit of a nuisance. Excellent value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Premier Room Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and from our 10th floor premiere room we enjoyed views of both Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We arrived too early to check-in but our luggage was taken into store and was in our room when we arrived after touring Sydney on the open top bus that stops across the road from hotel. What a fantastic location !!! We walked from the hotel door less than 50m and full open view of Opera House & Bridge greeted us what a start to a Sydney vacation. And less than 5 minute walk is circular quay for ferries to Manly, Darlingharbour and more. You can pay more to stay in the Shangri La - but save money and be nearer the waterfront with this hotel. Plenty of bars / restaurants for relaxation. If you want breakfast walk from the hotel to behind circular quay, locate CQ Cafe and enjoy a opportunity to feast and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cairnterrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days whilst visiting Sydney with my parents-in-law. The hotel is in a great location in the Rocks and its a 2 minute walk down to the harbourside and a great range of restaurants. We asked for rooms on the top floor as this gives you a great view of the Opera House. There's a small pool on the top of the hotel with the bridge on one side and the Opera House on the other so quite a view. The rooms were fine and what you'd expect for this type of hotel. Only minor nag is that the carpets were starting to look a litle old. The main thing that made our trip was the extremely helpful staff. I'd arranged for a birthday cake to be delivered to the hotel and they kept it in a fridge overnight and then delivered to our room on a tray with knives, plates etc. Rather than having the hotel breakfast, go out of the side door of the hotel down the lane and about 20m from the hotel door on the right hand side there's a great little cafe which does really good fresh breakfasts from muesli to the full fry so would definitely recommend going here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: young grandad
Reviews.Content: The Old Sydney Holiday Inn is in the Rocks area of Sydney. An area full of older buildings with interesting smaller shops, a good selection of restaurants, coffee shops, etc. The accommodation is adequate but a bit 'tired'. We were allocated a 'Rocks view' room which was very poor. We asked to be moved and were re-located to a 'bridge view' room which was much better. I think that this hotel trades on it's location and is in need of a bit of investment in it's bedrooms. The location is what you stay here for. 10 mintues walk to the starting point for the 'Bridge Walk'. (a 'must do'), about the same distance from Circular Quay, where all the harbour ferries start from and about 15 minutes walk (or a very short cab ride) to Darling Harbour. There is a cab rank right outside the hotel. For a great experience have dinner in the revolving restaurant on the 47th floor of the Sydney Centre, about a 15 minute walk down George Street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsC08
Reviews.Content: What a briliant location - The Rocks! If you want to stay in a briliant location in Sydney, we'd highly recommend this area and the hotel. We requested a room with a view of the harbour and the Opera House and we were given the executive room. The room was great: clean and all amenities available. The view was obviously excellent. We were given complimentary wine, as we were honeymooners. The roof top pool and spa was fantastic as there are views of the city, the harbour, the bay and the bridge. The steam room and sauna were out of action but that didn't really bother us. We never ate in the hotel, so we can't comment on the food. The staff were very friendly and helpful but be aware that they will not cash more than Â£100 in travellers cheques a day. The hotel was clean and comfortable and we would definately stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views and location!”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltravels
Reviews.Content: We were greeted perfectly by the receptionist who gave us an upgrade and complimentary bottle of wine for our honeymoon occasion! The view out of our window was also amazing how it framed the Opera House perfectly. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi is also breathtaking, with 360 views of the harbor, circular quay, the bridge and city. The location is right there in the heart of the Rocks with plenty of restaurants and shops all around and cute pedestrian streets to wander through all night. The only negative thing is the expensive parking, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Million $ View”
Reviews.Author: steve_fossil
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn. Make sure you take in the view from the rooftop pool/spa. The location is great for both tourists and people doing business in the city. Friendly staff always make my stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy...but fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: hols01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days at this hotel. Absolutely fab location within the Rocks District, just across from the Harbour. Roof top pool is great. We were on the 2nd floor originally overlooking the courtyard of the bar next door which was pretty noisy most nights and definately at the weekend ! We didnt mind too much but after a couple of days asked if we could change rooms as there was only so many nights I wanted to listen to the singer in the bar till early hours of the morning !!! The hotel were very accomodating and placed us on the 8th floor with views over looking the harbour which was great. We didnt eat in the Hotel as there are so many other great places in the area to try. Whilst there we went on a whale watching trip which was great and the hotel is very well positioned for access to all other site seeing activities. Would definately recommend staying here and we would go back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “On the Rocks, close to the Quay”
Reviews.Author: B_Boomer61
Reviews.Content: After a 15 hour flight and needing sleep, this is a quiet area of the Rocks, although the weekend market is right outside the hotel. 4 star accomodation, easy walking to Circular Quay, booked through wotif with breakfast included. Fantastic view from the roof, cockatoos singing in the morning (not on George Street side). Holiday Inn's website was about $40 more than wotif (or another $22 pp if you buy breakfast). Rocks area has lots of restaurants. We had considered staying at Darling Harbour, but the Rocks is less modern, and more authentic. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Cameron85
Reviews.Content: Located in the historic Rocks district, the Old Sydney Holiday Inn is superbly positioned. Lots of cafes, shops and restaurants are nearby, and the Iconic Opera House, Harbour and Harbour Bridge are all within a few minutes walk! We were there during the off season of the Australian winter (August) and the price for the executive room was a BARGAIN for Circular Quay/ The Rocks standards at only $150 a night. The relatively cheap cost and supreme location alone made it a good fit for us, and the executive room was certainly good enough for my taste as well. The bed was fine, the room size was okay and overall the room was just like many others i've experienced in similar 3 1/2 - 4 star hotel chains. My only slight problem was that it was pretty noisy one of the nights. The surrounding area is a popular eating out precinct, and it has a few pubs as well I think, and one night the sounds of a few loud people walking down the street seemed to effortlessly drift in the window for quite a while, but in the end that was only a minor problem and didn't do anything to ruin my stay. The staff were generally friendly, although they didn't meet you as you arrived and offer to bring your bags up to your rooms etc which I probably would have expected, but no major issue again. I didn't eat dinner there as the circular quay, darling harbour and rocks areas are so inviting to eat out at, but we had the buffet breakfast, and as a lover of a good hotel breakfast, i can tell you that this one was good with a great selection! Another thing I liked was the rooftop swimming pool/spa area. It has a really spectacular view of the opera house and harbour one way, and a good view of the city the other way. I reccommend going up there to see the night lights, very nice! All in all a very enjoyable experience. I'd go back there any day because of its great location and the fact that it doesn't break the bank (particularly in the off season) compared to a number of the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But....”
Reviews.Author: neilgleeds
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous location. We booked a harbour view room but on arrival were told that we had booked a standard. Luckily we had the proof of booking with us, but it still took some hassle to get us moved. Incidentally we were not the only ones with booking issues at the same time. Decor is dull and a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: aufcno1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location for Harbour bridge and Opera house. The rooms are just ok. We never ate or had a drink at the hotel and although the decor was average it seemed to have no atmosphere at all. Staff were helpful enough without being great. I would stay at this hotel again for the location as its not really great for anything else. Taxi Tip Ask taxi drivers for fare before entering cab as it varies from $30 to $50 for trip to airport

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiumt
Reviews.Content: Comfortable. Everything you expect from a big chain luxury hotel. And like big hotels go, a little impersonal in the service. But the location was great, right smack in historic Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Biggles18
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Rocks area. Short walk to the Harbour Bridge and circular quay. Our room had a great view of the opera house. You need valet parking as there is very limited parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: nabows
Reviews.Content: Family stayed for 4 nights with 2 children aged 12 and 14. On arrival we were allocated a room near the guest laundry, room was a little tired but ok. Unfortunately the bathroom was not acceptable, Dirty tilles (mould) with a hole in the ceiling where a sprinkler had been poorly fitted. We spoke to Kristen at reception who after inspecting the room offered various solutions and quickly arranged for us to be moved to the 8th floor which was fine. The hotel decor is rather tired but this is outweighted by the excellent location about 3 minutes walk to the harbour. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is excellant value as the Rocks area can be expensive for a small breakfast Â£35 to Â£40 for four people. The hotel bar has a happy hour which is good value. There is a small well kept pool area whith exellent views over Sydney. Overall our stay at the hotel was good value for money in a superb location. It is cheaper to take a taxi to the hotel from the airport for four people than the airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn rocks”
Reviews.Author: thomasinaLlanelli
Reviews.Content: Marvellous location - a hiccup on checking in due to a booking mixup by the hotel but it was soon corrected and we were upgraded to a better room (with a bridge, harbour and opera house view). Everything was right on our doorstep. Because we were only there for two nights we stayed in the Rocks area and explored the little lanes and shops.. The Bridge Climb was a few minutes walk away which was great as my husband had booked a clim. The harbour and opera house are literally across the road. We used the ferry to see different parts of Sydney, hopping off one and on another. As senior citizens, it was REALLY cheap!!! The hotel breakfast was wonderful and good value for money. I would recommend it to all age groups.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, great location”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn at The Rocks on my second stint through Sydney, and was pleased. This hotel is in an ideal location with great views from the roof, and that's about it. It feels like your normal average hotel. I had booked it through wotif.com and received an awesome rate which included breakfast for two. Circular Quay is literally at your feet when you walk out the door, and the entry to walk across the bridge is also minutes away. Overall, I liked the place, but next time may want to stay in a place with a little more history.

Reviews.Title: “You pay top $$ for the location and not much else”
Reviews.Author: stay_far_away
Reviews.Content: For the price rooms at the Holiday Inn usually go for, we expected a lot more. There is nothing wrong with the hotel at all - it was clean, tidy and staff were pleasant, but there was nothing that stood out as exceptional. The greatest thing about the hotel is the location - brilliantly positioned in the Rocks with a fantastic view from the rooftop pool and spa. A couple of little hiccups - we were charged full price at the bar during happy hour (instead of half price), our morning newspaper wasn't delivered as requested, the room service meals we ordered were bland and cold (they arrived without covers over the plates), and our planned sleep-in on the Monday morning was interrupted by someone vacuuming outside our door. We only stayed here because we were offered a great rate, and would never pay the full rate for it. We liked the Amora, Quay West Apartments and Sir Stamford (Circular Quay) much more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: renae830
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Right in the center of The Rocks! Yes it may need a little attention in the decorating dept. but the location can't be beat. I think it was quaint! It was a little loud in the mornings, but each day brought a different adventure! One day they were shooting a commercial outside, so we spent some time hanging out the window watching all the fun! The day we arrived they were having a chocolate and coffee festival, which we needed like crazy since we had been on a plane for 20 hours. We never ate at the hotel, why would anyone, when you walk out the hotel door and have more quaint places to eat than I can count! Pubs, small bakeries and world class restaurants are everywhere, and they are all just small neighborhood places, not fancy uncomfortable restaurants. The visitors center is right outside the door..don't miss for great info and shopping too! If you plan on climbing the Sydney Harbor bridge, which we did and I recommend, that also is just a 10 minute walk away. The Circular Quay was a 10 minute walk, with more restaurants, the train station, ferries and bus stops, and of course the Opera House! Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “location is great and it is not noisy like everyone said”
Reviews.Author: CK1Adelaide
Reviews.Content: Can I say the location is absolutely fantastic and I even saw fireworks on the harbour from the rooftop swimning pool area.There were so many reviews about the noise that I requested a quiet room and got the 7th floor and their windows are double glazed anyway.It was not noisy at all. The location is so close to the the bus and train direct to George St where the shops are.Really professional staff and polite too.I have stayed at 5 star hotels with much worse service. If you didn't get the package deal the Fine Food Store is right next door where I picked up my daily latte before walking through to Circular Quay and Botanic Gardens. One of the best value for money I paid for location.convenience and service. Would stay there again it is not in the midst of the CBD but just near enough.After all who doesn't want to stay 5 minutes away from the Harbour Bridge,Opera House and shopping...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: London_Traveller45
Reviews.Content: The location - right in the Rocks between the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House - is great! The hotel is pretty average in most regards. The rooms are small and adequate (nothing more, nothing less), but you are really staying here for the location. Most of the staff were very nice and helpful. The bellman was the only person we encountered who just always seemed to be in a miserable mood, but other than that we had all good experiences. The laundry room is a great convenience and the pool on the roof offers great views even though it is absolutely tiny. Overall, good value for the money. If you are only in Sydney for a few days than it's great to have a location right in the middle of everything, just don't expect too muh as far as the rooms go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: sandancer56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in an executive room which had great views of Circular Quay, and the Opera House. The Rocks is a great area to stay in. When we arrived at the hotel we had been travelling for 24 hours and I was hoping our room was ready, but it wasn't. The reception staff told us we could wait in the reception area and the room should not be to long. Two hours later we were still waiting so we were able to leave our bags with them and go off sightseeing. Overall we found the reception desk staff to be young and inexperienced and unhelpful. Our room was lovely when we could eventually get into it, and the views were fantastic. The hotel does look a bit tired in places and could use some redecoration. And you pay extra for the breakfasts but they were nice. I think I would try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DickieM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 night, this hotel is in the Rocks area of Sydney and is a fantastic base. The rooms were lovely, and the views are great from the roof. You are mins from Circular Quay and hence a wide range of activities. The restaurants in this area are great, and the atmosphere is electric! There is a weekend market just outside the hotel which is great. Check out the Rocks Visitor Centre where you can book trips and get some advice, well worth a visit. The hotel staff were excellent, and we loved our stay at the Holiday Inn. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights with our three year old daughter after booking online. As everyone else has said, the location can't be bettered if you're looking for something central as you're able to stroll to Circular Quay in less than five minutes. Room was a good size, with a view of the harbour bridge, but bathroom was disappointing and a bit tired looking and in need of an upgrade. We were on the top floor (8th) and just along from the fabulous outdoor rooftop pool and spa - a must to check out of you stay here, if only for the view over the harbour. Staff were fantastic, and it's hard to fault anything else about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daviesl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn after a 20 hour flight from London, we actually arrived into Sydney at 05.30am and headed straight to the hotel. When we arrived we were extremley happy with the location as we were only a stones throw away from the Bridge and Opera House. As it was really early and most hotels don't let you check in until atleast 2pm onwards we were only expecting to drop off our bags and then head to the sights of Sydney, but we were really surprised when we were told our room was ready. We thought the rooms were a nice size and everything was nice and modern, the hotel swimming pool is on the roof so we headed up there to check it out, if you like to swim then this hotel isn't for you as the pool is very very small it looks small on the pictures but in real life it's alot smaller, but the views are amazing and that made up for it. We didn't eat in the hotel so we can't comment on that At the weekends outside the hotel to the left they have a very good market and it's worth having a look around The only downside to this hotel is that it gets extremley noisey especially from the Irish bar down the road, we could hear all the music and noise but as we were only there for 2 nights we decided just to put up with it and it really didn't effect our stay Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “incredible location”
Reviews.Author: cuddlydudley
Reviews.Content: Very expensive but as a one off it was certainly worth it. The view from the roof really is amazing and if two 15yr olds can be impressed it must be good ! The location is incredible, sightseeing bus stops right outside the door, 5min walk to circular quay and ferries to Manly etc. We were really sorry to leave. The room had 2 double beds and views over the city. We arrived early approx 9am we didn't expect the room to ready but were give access to the roof and pool area it really was wonderful to sit there in the fresh air after a long flight from the UK with the views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge 'just there' in front of you. We were able to use our room at 12.00, it was very comfortable clean just what we had expected, we were not disapponted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View - not too keen on the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Something-Different!
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically positioned in the old Rocks area of Sydney. If you ask for an executive room you will be looking out to The Opera House across the harbour and Sydney Harbour bridge to the left - absolutely fantastic view! The rooms are huge with a living area and well as king size bed, flat screen tv, huge wardrobes, writing desk and mini bar. You are really close to the bars and restaurants in this area - in fact thats probably the best and worst point! It gets really noisy at night when the pubs shut! There is a swimming pool on the roof of the hotel which again gives brilliant views across to the Botanical Gardens. We were only here for 2 nights so we didn't lose too much sleep, but I don't know if I would recommend it for too much longer. Apart from the noise this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Szepfalusy
Reviews.Content: Old Sydney Holiday Inn is in a great location, surrounded by lots of nice little cafes, restaurants and pubs. All the sights are only walking distance. The staff at the hotel where friendly and helpful, everything was clean and well maintained. The rooms where fine, a bit small but overall good. This hotel is reasonably priced for the location and i would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location etc etc etc”
Reviews.Author: dugongs2
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but well maintained in a fantastic location for tourists. 2 mins walk and you are on circular key directly behind the cruise ship terminal. 10 min walks to the ferrys and then another 5 mins to the opera house. The Rocks markets are outside the door at the weekend. 10 min walk to the heart of Sydney shopping. If you like to jog in the mornings this location is heaven sent. The room on the 10th floor was small although very quiet. Even had a bit of a view of the harbour bridge although window would not open. If you want space then this is not the place to be and some of the Meriton apartments look far better value uptown however for a tourist out and about the room is just a place to sleep and was quiet and bed comfortable. Sydney is not the bargain destination for Brits it used to be and when we stayed the V festival had filled all the best hotel bargains. This place offered us a 3 night deal with breakfast which was'nt cheap but was good value that weekend. The breakfast was very good although had to make your own coffee using their expresso machine which was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Soo_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, it's the perfect place to be in Sydney, very central, not too noisy, plenty of good restaurants nearby in the Rocks area. Room overlooked Harbour Bridge which was perfect, bathroom clean but ready for a renovation, otherwise everything was great, staff very helpful, gave us umberallas for the couple of rainy days we had. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget option”
Reviews.Author: DeeMooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as the main part of our honeymoon stay in Sydney, due to its central location and its affordability. On arrival we were allocated our opera view room which was on the 6th floor, with a great view of the opera house. Could not have been a more central view, although it was often obstructed by cruise ships which docked in front of the window and blocked the opera view! The hotel itself is pretty basic in terms of the rooms, but there is everything you need for a functional stay. I had to complain while I was there as the room was not as clean as it could have been. We had stayed there for 5 nights and the bathroom floor had not been cleaned once, nor had our carpet been vacuumed. This is not what I would expect, but once I had complained twice, this was rectified. Breakfast was good, although pretty badly organised, with tables being allocated very slowly and everyone feeling a bit crowded. But the food was very good and varied. Most of the people who stayed at the hotel were older British couples who seemed to be there as part of a package. The roof top pool is nowhere near as big as it looks on pictures but is still stunning with great views and is a lovely place to relax and get away from it all. Overall, would return again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Getting it right.”
Reviews.Author: joePerth
Reviews.Content: Those of us charged with the responsibility of organising travel itineries / accommodation for ones family are keenly aware of the pressure to "get it right"! This responsibilty becomes particularly onerous when the family includes young children. My wife and 2 children ( aged four and seven) recently celebrated a relatives wedding in Thredbo, and decided to incorporate 4 days in Sydney prior to the event. The wife and kids had never been to Sydney so the trip was all about seeing the Opera House , The Bridge, Ferry to the zoo, monorail to China town...... Location was therefore a priority and this Hotel delivered in spades. Literally a stones throw away from Circular Quay, and under the shadow of the Harbour Bridge, all of the things we wanted to do and see were within walking distance from the hotel including restaurants, ferry services, and public transport. The room that we stayed in ( 2 double beds) was very clean and the beds extremely comfortable. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing George st which offered a glimpse of the Harbour bridge. The hotel is not new, but is tastefully appointed. For us mere mortals without access to expense accounts or superannuation draw downs this hotel delivers much bang for its buck. Under our package a cooked buffet style breakfast was included, and the kids ate all meals in the restaurant for free ( Meals were very tasty!). That certainly puts a bit more weight in the wallet! The staff were attentive and polite and didn't miss a beat in terms of advice or help. The kicker for the kids was the pool on top of the roof. The weather was slightly inclement but that didn't stop them ( and by definition dear old dad!) giving it a nudge. Granted the pool is smaller than those depicted on the hotels web site - but the view over Sydney taking in the opera house and over the bay is out of this world. In terms of negatives - the security card swipers to gain entry into our room were a bit hit and miss having to sometimes swipe 2 or three times to unlock the door. Thanks Holiday Inn for helping me get it right - a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: dee+ken
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised at the overall quality of this hotel. It was overall one the best we stayed in during our 2-month long trip. Located in The Rocks area steeped in history, the hotel a very short walk to the quays for trains and the ferry, the opera house and some of Sydney's best restaurants. The historical brick entry to the hotel, on a bend in the road at 55 George Street, belies the open lobby, spaceous modern rooms and comfy bar and dining room within. It was bright and welcoming. Room views were fantastic not to mention the view lying by the roof top pool watching the action in the distance over the entire harbor. This hotel is better located than the 4Seasons and other top hotels. Not inexpensive, the hotel rooms were quiet and lovely, the beds being so comfortable it was easy to sleep late! All of the hotel staff were welcoming, professional and very efficient. It was a treat to have them listen attentively and focus on our every request. Originally booked to stay two days, no wonder we returned twice more as we connected in Sydney for a flight to New Zealand and again on our way home to the US. Worth the price, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: CJH78
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the Rocks area I would recommend this hotel. Upon arrival they upgraded us and gave us a bottle of cava as I had just happened (!) to mention we were on honeymoon. The reception and room service was faultless throughout our stay. The pool looks better on the photographs here I think, it's not that big, but you can see the Harbour Bridge from it which is certainly better than the public baths... My husband thought the breakfast was terrible but he is led by his stomach. The breakfast was entirely passable - continental or greasy fried reconstituted meat (a fry-up first thing in the morning isn't my thing but it looked quite standard to me). I hadn't stayed in a Holiday Inn for a few years and was pleasantly surprised. The room was modern and clean, the bathroom clean but very dated. Location wise, it's close to the harbour bridge, the Opera House and botanic gardens (10 mins walk), 5-10 mins walk to the underground and ferry (would recommend going from their to Manly beach) and Rocks area shops and restaurants just outside.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: oggybags
Reviews.Content: booked here for our last night in oz having wandered past and seen its great location, and even better paid using the priority points so it was free - overall a great location and ok hotel - - we had room on 4th floor with a view sort of of the bay, which was a plesant suprise, room was good size, and seemed pretty clean, however bathroom was grubby, needed tarting up - and even had old towel on back of door from previous guest!! Woke up suffocating at 2am as room had got so hot and stuffy despite turning antiquated air con as cold as possible and then opening window - couldnt bear it any longer so called reception who advised me you had to flick a random switch to activate the aor con!! - shame no one had told us before! I would stay here again due to location, and the nice benefit of the rooftop 'pool' (its small dont be fooled by canny photos) -providing I got a good rate, otherwise for a much better service, and cleanliness standard would stay at the darling harbour holiday inn. (if I had to stay in a chain)

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: avevers
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with the hotel. Although it was clean, it was generally tatty - poor quality furniture, rough/old bathroom tiling and generally needed renovating throughout. And this is based on our stay at an executive corner room with an Opera House view. Great view, great location (The Rocks), disappointing room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WLDGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I am probably going to repeat a lot of what has been said before but here goes! The location couldn't be better, it is right in the Rocks district among shops, restaurants , bars (from the very trendy to the very traditional) and the market at the weekends. Right beside the bridge with fabulous views from the small rooftop pool of the Harbour bridge and the Opera house. We stayed here at the beginning of our first trip to Australia and it was a perfect beginning. The hotel room itself was nice , not fancy but clean and adequate in size. We didn't have a good view but it didn't matter as you had the rooftop pool. The pool itself is small but it also has a nice jacuzzi too, something surreal about sitting up there so near to two amazing sights! The staff were pleasant enough. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel so can't make comment on that. At the end of our trip we returned to Sydney and stayed in the Westin but I much preferred the Old Sydney holiday inn due to location (although the Westin was much fancier and expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little tired!”
Reviews.Author: AAORD1
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Nov. 24-28th, 2007. As others have said, "the location can't be beat." It's perfect! There are numerous cafes for meals, the hop on hop off bus stops right in front of the hotel, very convenient. The Opera House is a short walk to the other side of the Quay as are the Botanical Gardens. The Sydney Visitors Bureau is a 1/2 block down the street making it so easy to book tours, you can also book them at the hotel. I had a room that faced the front of the hotel, great view of the foot traffic and "The Rocks Market" on the weekend and thankfully I had packed earplugs. It's noisey in the front but I would rather have had that than looking at the brick wall in the back. The room was nice, clean and the bed comfy but I would have liked to have had a table to eat from instead of moving everything off the desk. I had an extra chair in the corner but no table...seemed to be missing. Room service (food) was delivered fast, the food was good but as all hotel food is priced, it was expensive, it's not a cheap city. I compare it to London, along with the crowds and traffic. It's a busy, crowded city. Every employee I met or talked with always had a smile and something nice to say. On return visits, I will be back...it can't be beat for location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little Jenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The location of this hotel is excellent. Circular quay is a couple of minutes walk away in one direction and the harbour bridge is about five minutes away in the other. Our room had an excellent view of the quay and we found the reception staff to be very helpful. The accommodation itself is not 'four star'. The rooms are small and the furniture needs replacing or an overhaul. The bathroooms are exceptionally cramped, shabby and dirty. Room service was slow - we requested some toilet paper one evening which took two phone calls and a thirty minute wait! The reception area terraces are dimly lit and dull making the whole place resemble an old prison. I would not stay in this hotel again as I don't think the accommodation merits the price. Also when we checked out our bill was incorrect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLH74
Reviews.Content: Booked here on a recommendation of a work collegue - so glad we did - the location and hotel were wonderful. A large group of us "poms" had gone out to Oz & we were the only couple to have booked in here - and were the envy of all our friends. The staff were helpful & friendly. The rooms were clean & kept @ the right temperature. The breakfast was good - though a little pricy - if you can venture out to a near by diner on circular quay - I would. I could rave on about the view from the roof pool - certainly has the "wow" factor. The location could not be bettered. The weekend market is literally outside the front door - and the open top tour bus stop is located directly opposite the hotel - perfect. Would not hesitate to stay here again if we can ever face the 24 flight again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: EagerTravler
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel 2 months before we travelled because it was central to "The Rocks" and close to Central Quay, and also because we had points from business travel in the UK which meant we did not have to pay for the room, only the food we had. On arrival we were not given a room with a view of the Bridge or the Opera house which we had asked for on booking. We were told the hotel was full and there was no way of moving us. Not a good start. The room was a good size and clean, but you could have been anywhere in the world, especially as the windows looked out onto a back alley. The next morning we went to breakfast and chose the continental option. However most of the food dishes were empty and not being replenished. When I queried this I was told the manager would be informed, but nothng was done to provide us with any food from the buffet, as it was our options came down to toast, tea /coffee and a baby bell cheese. There were no cold meats and no fruit. To be fair I did mention this when we checked out and the price of the breakfast was removed from the bill, but we never ate in there again. We were looking at the Tourist leaflets one morning and the concierge asked if he could help. We explained what we were looking for - a nice day out, perhaps to the zoo and something to do in the evening locally. He suggested we take a train up to the blue mountains and then come back and go to the funfair park on the other side of the river because after dark you can take alcohol in and have competions to see how many rides you have to go on drunk before you have to throw up!!!!! Hm.... The hotel TV program talked about their excellent concierge service (well we had alredy experienced that) and suggested we ask for a complimentary DVD about Opal mining. On asking the Concierge, the reception staff and the current manager on duty no-one seemed to know anything about the DVD. We were even told we couldnt watch it in the roo as there wasnt a DVD player in there. We had to explain what complimentary meant. Needless to say we did not get a copy. We were directed to the in-hotel opal shop tho and told we could have all of our questions answered there, instead they told us they were just about to close and could we come back another day. Not great as we were flying out the next morning at 4am. All in all if you just want somewhere to lay you head its not bad, but it doesnt provide the service I would have expected. If you want travelers info go to "The Rocks Tourist Information" which is next door, you'll get a much better service and speek to people who actually know what they are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Good on the outside, not so good on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Robert16
Reviews.Content: A mixture of great and disappointing. Location couldn't be bettered, and the views from the hotel roof must be among the best in Sydney. Inside though, a different story. Our room was worn, tatty, and not as clean as it could be (something surprisingly common elsewhere in Australia). Staff were full of Australian perkiness, but surprisingly ignorant about many of the things you'd expect hotel staff to know - not a reliable source of information on transport or airport transfers. Breakfast was nothing special. This hotel is basically good, but could become excellent after a refurbishment and some staff training.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location,view from rooftop pool amazing”
Reviews.Author: miblynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4th September for four nights, room was ready for us at 10AM (we had not even asked for early check in) which was excellent. The location of this hotel is fantastic for all the sights, Opera House, Ferries & Bridgeclimb only a few minutes walk. The rooftop pool is big enough for a swim and the view from the roof is breathtaking day and night. Staff are excellent, room was a good size and very clean and had everything you need. We would stay here again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gray2005
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as our first stop off on our Oz trip. We stayed here for 5 nights and totally enjoyed our. The breakfast was great..huge choice. This hotel is in a great postion near every thing you need to be near. Hotel was clean and all staff very friendly. Its a great choice..you cant go wrong. If i was to moan about anything then it would be the doors slamming..due to bein fire doors they slam behind you. But once you knew this..you just hold it shut..but unfortunatley you always get a few people who didnt have the consideration to do this. Apart from that we couldnt asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rickilakefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Location was excellent, right in the heart of the Rocks and right in front was the outdoor market on the weekends. Staff-most were very friendly and always said hello. Elevators fast. Rooms-nice size and very well appointed setting or layout of the room. Clean rooms. Bathroom very large and clean. We stayed in a large executive room, so I dont know if a regular room would be the same or not. Lots of things to see and do nearby, lots of shopping also in the rocks and near the hotel. Also near a few tv stations which you could walk to or take a cab ride to to catch a tv show tapings if you fancy to. A variety of restaurants nearby also. Overall fantastic hotel, would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Shankliniow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable and in the perfect position to see Sydney! The pool is lovely but small. Breakfast was great too. The local market is set up just outside the door at weekends so it might be worth asking for a quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shandyv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the perfect place for a short stay in Sydney. It is in easy reach of all of the main attractions, with circular quay approx 5 mins walk away. The Rocks market, on a Sunday is literally within stumbling distance. The rooms are clean and simple and make an excellent base for exploring the city. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel so can't comment on the price/quality. All in all, a great hotel with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: slja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location ideally placed for Bridge, Opera House and Central Quay. The hotel staff responded superbly to any request I made and did everything they could to make the stay easy. Breakfast at the hotel was good value and the quality of the food was very good. The front of the hotel can be quite noisy, however, the rooms at the back of the hotel were really quiet. Room size is more than adequate and the beds were also quite large. I will hopefully stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nediachick
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel. Great location. Room and bathroom decent sizes and very clean. Staff were really helpful and polite. Pool (although not overly big) and spa were great too. Also liked the lovely big lobby to sit and have a glass of wine! would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hoby1kanobee
Reviews.Content: The incredible location makes up for the less incredible though adequate rooms with a great bed. Lobby very nice and staff very friendly helpful and accomodating. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Baxie
Reviews.Content: A pretty standard hotel but in a good location in the Rocks area close to restaurants and just a 5-10 minute walk to Circular Quay where the city's rail and ferry network can be accessed. The standard rooms are clean and bathrooms ok if a little small. The hotel has wifi and cable internet access but at over $27 a day is on the expensive side. I stayed for 10 days and tried to negotiate a better rate for the internet but nothing doing which is disappointing. The food in the hotel is good but then the food in this city is of a high standard so no suprises there. Breakfast is buffet style and of a good quality. Book ahead to get cheap rates and this is a good option for a mid range hotel in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy especially at weekends”
Reviews.Author: Deisemum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights from the 24th May 2007. Thanks to a 30+ hour journey we slept on our first night. That was the only night we got a proper nights sleep. Our room was fine. The bed was very comfortable and the decor was alright. The restaurant was very nice and had a very extensive buffet breakfast selection. The restaurant and accommodation staff were very friendly and helpful but a couple of the reception staff were unhelpful. One in particular tried to charge us $25 for renting an adapator that we didn't as I'd brought my own. She wouldn't believe us when we said we didn't get an adaptor but had to eventually back down and not charge us but made it plain that she didn't believe us. About 2 weeks prior to our visit to Sydney I emailed the hotel requesting a room on one of the higher floors. We were given a room on the second floor practically above the main hotel entrance. The noise was unbelievable with modified cars speeding up and down the road until about 5am. There is also a taxi rank at the hotel entrance. The taxi drivers get out of their cars and spend the night chatting and even shouting out to other taxi drivers while waiting for fares. The windows are not sealed properly so are not sound-proofed. Between modified cars, taxi-drivers and revellers you will get very little sleep. The walls are also very thin as every night we could hear the occupants of the next room get up for their 4am pee. The restaurant has a self-service juicer and due to the design of the hotel atrium you hear it on a fairly constant rate from 7am. It's even worse when you're having your breakfast and hear it in constant use. It's very noisy. The weekend before we went to Australia we stayed at a Holiday Inn on the North Circular in London. It's an extremely busy road with 6 lanes of traffic on one side and two lanes on the other side. The hotel had properly sealed windows so our sleep wasn't disturbed. I think it's time the Old Sydney did the same. I think the convenience of the hotel's location is excellent but I like to get a night's sleep when on holiday so for that reason I'd avoid staying here. Fortunately we stayed in the Blue Mountains before our return home and had no problem sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: neriagechris
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean reliable hotel. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean and well appointed and The Rocks is the most interesting, charming area. You can walk to the harbor and the Circular Quay where you can get transport to just about any attraction in the city. We stayed in this hotel in 2003 and the overall quality has stayed the same. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Late Review, but still the same”
Reviews.Author: Ladyleah
Reviews.Content: This review is realllllly late- but we met a couple from Australia on our recent trip and they jarred my memory that I never wrote a review for this hotel! We stayed here in July of 2005. We loved the location, and found the hotel to be a great value for the money (although the room was small). We also found it to be quiet in the room that we were staying. Again, the location can't be beat for the price. Such views of the Opera House from the rooftop! We would go back to this hotel if we ever make it back to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: offonhol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in May. It's in an ideal location, situated between the bridge and Opera House. (Coming from Newcastle upon Tyne we were interested in comparing bridges!). The Tourist Information is right next door - very handy although the young man we spoke to was definitely in the wrong job -totally unhelpful. We bought 3-day Sydney passes which were worth the money, you can use them on the tour buses, ferries, trains and local buses. Bondi beach was a big disappointment - it's just a small bay. Manly beach is much nicer. I would definately recomend this hotel, rooms were clean and modern., staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of choice at breakfast. And the location is great

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: GeordiesfromNE
Reviews.Content: Located in The Rocks, great for access to Circular Quay Ferries and Trains. Great location with Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour bridge only minutes away. Hotel staff very helpful. Swimming Pool located on 8th floor - great views of Opera House and Bridge Manly Beach far nicer beach to visit than Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robin64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute must if you are coming to Sydney for a a few days. We booked a Deluxe Harbour View Room and you will not be disappointed with the room and stunning views for the extra money paid. This has to be the best value quality hotel in Sydney. We were allocated Room 830 on the top floor- probably the best room in the hotel with amazing views of the Opera House and Bridge. The rooftop pool is small (towels available) but the views are simply fantastic and you can order food and drinks to be delivered. There are plenty of cafes serving a light breakfast nearby especially round the Opera House side of Circular Quay. The staff were friendly and I will most definitely return. The Olympic Park is well worth the visit (take a limited stop train from Circular Quay to Lindale and swap onto Olympic Park Shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mavesv
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Visit .... Stayed for 5 nights in March, 2007. The Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and the roof top pool views were worth a million bucks - and was a great location for a Pizza and wine dinner. We always found our day rounding up around 6 p.m. just in time for the hotel's happy hour prior to an evening out. As friendly as the staff is, their level of advice/knolwedge was lacking.. no matter, because the visitor's center is out the door, across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pahodges
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel the begining of March,excellent hotel, great position, and staff at the desk,bar and restaurant were all great, could not do enough for you, the rooms were spotless, and every thing you needed. We had breakfast in the hotel,at a charge of $24.dollar,eat as much as you wanted,great value. The position of the hotel was great for us seniors, not far from anything, we also found that the people in the bars and cafes near by were all really friendly, and made time to speak to you. Next time in Sydney we would most defiinitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Rocks -- Super Location”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last two nights before departing back to Hawaii â€“ outstanding hotel in a fantastic location (The Rocks with a 3-minute walk to the Bridge; 10 minute walk to the Opera House; and a 5 minute walk to the Ferry/Train Station. Would definitely stay here again as the rooms were very nice, staff was friendly and the service (bar has half price beer/wine between 6 & 7 PM â€“ best price for drinks in Sydney). We also had the breakfast buffet ($24/AUS) and it is a great spread worth the price. The pool is on the roof and makes for a great place to take pictures and look over the harbor. The Rocks area is very historic and there are quite a numerous amounts of great restaurants and bars to visit â€“ we never had a bad meal or a drink with a local aussie â€“ they are great folks.
