(Hint: No need to have a car if you are visiting Sydney â€“ a a taxi from the airport will cost approx $40 AUS and you can purchase a Daytripper Pass for the bus/ferry/train that will let you get around for $16AUS/pp â€“ best deal going). While in Sydney we went to Darling Harbor, Fish Market (best place to get an order of seafood â€“ cooked fresh right there and a wine store in the middle), Botanical Gardens, Manle Beach, Aquarium, Opera House, Bridge, Featherdaleâ€™s Wildlife Park (here is where you can get up close to a Koala and other animals â€“ wife loved it), and many local sites around the city. When we come back, we will definitely sty at the Holiday Inn again â€“ location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sydney Harbor and ships”
Reviews.Author: pennez
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a wonderful location-very close to the harbor, ferries and cruise ships. The rooms were clean and adequate. The pool view was spectacular-of the Opera House and harbor. The staff was very accomodating and there's no problem with storing luggage there. The hotel is adeally situated especially if you're getting on a cruise from Sydney . We wheeled our luggage to the ship from the hotel--only the equivalent of about 2 blocks away. The Rocks weekend market is right outside the hotel door--a nice diversion on Sat/Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -Old Sydney Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Ozzyfootprints
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 day stay at Old Sydney Holiday Inn. The hotel was great. The staff all very friendly and obliging. The room was very spacious and the cleanest I have ever encountered in any hotel anywhere. Location is fantastic - right at Circular Quay. So handy to everything. Windows are double glazed (I think) as there was very little street noise. We visited Sydney for the arrival of the QE11 and QM11 and this was such an excellent location. We took a dinner cruise on the Captain Cook MV 2000 - just fantastic. (Have done this before - recommend the degustation dinner). The hotel is close to public transport - bus train station and ferry. The coffee shop in the hotel - great coffee. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but there is a trade off”
Reviews.Author: DizDave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Feb. The hotel has a great location but there is a trade off to this. As this hotel is in the centre of an etertainment area there are a lot of tired and emotional people out at night, which means this is not a hotel for you if you want to get sleep. If you stay in one of the rooms facing the main road the noise is incredible until at least 3am. I spoke to the hotel staff about it and they said they get complaints all the time but there is nothing they can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, loved the roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: coogie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable but what really sells it is its location. We had views of harbour bridge and opera house from our windows. The roof terrace with its small pool, jacuzzi and sunbeds is lovely if you like a spot of cooling off and sunbathing. There are unlimited fresh pool towels in the shower room on the roof terrace and the hotel will bring food and drinks up to the terrace after you have ordered it by the pool phone. All in all a great value for money hotel where we would return to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jclewis80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in February as part of a 2 week holiday in Australia. Upon check in I asked for a room with a view of the opera house if it was available as I had read some of the previous reviews on here and thought we would try our luck! They advised that if we gave them a couple of hours this would be possible and so we went out and came back later to check in. The front desk staff were very helpful and even though this hotel is officially a 3 star, they were better than staff in some of the 5 star hotels we have stayed in. Upon entering our room, they had already taken our luggage up for us meaning we didn't have to phone around or wait for it to be bought up - most welcome after a long flight! The room was basic enough, but cosy with a clean (but dated) bathroom and new plasma tv. The room was on the 5th floor and overlooked the opera house - fantastic! The only thing we were disappointed with was how small the rooftop pool is, it looks much larger in pictures! You only need 6 people round it and it is cramped with nowhere to sit. Woud definatley recommend this hotel - it is excellent value for money, and in a great location. If you have time make sure you head a couple of doors down to the pub that has live music on at night. There is also a pub on the corner that does $10 meals Monday and Tuesday all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie2801
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights after reading the reviews on this site. Came here from 4 nights in the Oriental in Singapore and were probably a bit disappointed when we first arrived, as we were comparing it with The Oriental. Asked for a room on a high floor to ensure a view of the Opera House and were allocated a room on the 5th floor this was to low and you cannot see the opera house, however after explaining the situation to reception they moved us the next day with no fuss at all which was excellent. The hotel looks a little tired the Breakfast is good but the decor is need of a touch up. The biggest thing this hotel has going for it is its location you are literally 50 metres from the Quay and views of the Bridge and Opera house, also the tourist centre is just around the corner. Tthe Rocks area is buzzing with loads of bars and restaurants and reminded me of Covent Garden in London. Would recommend Doyles on the Quay for great views and Seafood. Also did the Bridge Climb and a heart stopping helicopter ride over the city which was worth every penny. Went on a tour of the Blue Mountains and the Sydney Explorer bus which is great for seeing the city and beaches, there is so much to see and do in Sydney and the surrounding area that you could easily spend a fortnight here and not get bored we loved it and would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: konagirl
Reviews.Content: You won't find a hotel in a better location than the Holiday Inn in The Rocks area of Sydney. Views of the opera house and the harbour bridge are a bonus in some of the rooms (mine had one of the opera house) and in any case the two landmarks can definitely be seen just a few steps out of your front door. On the weekends, a market full of local artists and craftsmen is just next to the hotel, and provides some interesting browsing and shopping opportunities. The hotel itself has a nice lobby ... rooms are clean and mine was large (a deluxe room, though, according to the sign on the door.) The beds are quite comfortable, and the amenities are typical of a 3 or 4-star hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful, although the front desk staff double as concierges and I found their knowledge to be somewhat lacking, plus they don't really have time to deal with extended queries as they are generally busy minding the desk. The pool on the roof deck is nice, but small. I didn't use it, but one could definitely get a tan up there! I think my room was a bit overpriced (something like $300 AUD/night) but I didn't book it, so I didn't have much say in the matter. I stayed at this Holiday Inn while attending a conference at the convention center at Darling Harbour. While the hotel is great for tourists, being right in the Rocks and also next to Circular Quay, where all of the ferries run, it isn't great for access to the Harbour, as you'll likely end up talking cabs. The ferry does run there, but it takes quite a while as there are several stops both ways. All in all, I'd recommend it in a heartbeat for a tourist ... not so much for a business person unless your business is nearby (one terrible thing if you're working is that you are leaving in the morning dressed in a suit when most everyone else staying here is dressed for leisure!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia710
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn for 5 days in November 2006 as part of our 3 week Australian vacation. The room was nice and we had a great view of the Opera House from the 6th floor. The roof-top pool had excellent views as well, though we did not find much time to actually use the pool. We did not eat at the restuarant, so can't comment on the quality there. The only problem we encountered was upon arriving at the hotel very late at night. They did not save a room for us, so we had to travel to the Intercontinental a few blocks away. This was annoying because I specifically called them the day before and told them the time we would be arriving. The Intercontinental people did not really know what was going on, but in the end we stayed there for one night at the same price as the Holiday Inn. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn. The Rocks area is very cool and there are plenty of places to eat and shop (be warned places close early though). The hotel is very conveniently located near Circular Quay for ferry and subway rides to other parts of the city. Definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarriedMumof2
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn with our 16 month old and 4 year old. We had a wonderful stay, The staff were very helpful, even lending us a stroller for our stay and lending us umbrellas when we had brief shower of rain. The room we had was small but fine. Very clean. We had a travel cot put in there for our baby which obviously took up some space. The breakfasts were plentiful and there was a great choice of food, We loved using the roof top swimming pool - the views are amazing! We even requested a room with a balcony and got one even though there are only 5 rooms with them in the hotel. We would recommend this hotel without any hesitation as the location in the Rocks area is so central it's wonderful. You can get to all the main sites within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. Wonderful stay - if we are ever lucky enough to go back to Sydney we would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: m888han
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights on Dec 18. We originally wanted to stay in a hotel with a great view like Shangri-La but on finding out the rates we decided to go for a great location instead! Not to worry anyway because as soon as we entered our room, Sydney Opera House was perfectly framed by our window - what a lovely surprise! We were on either the 4th or 6th floor I can't remember and it was a low numbered room like 402 or 602 (incase you want the same great view). It was an executive room. The room has a hairdryer, iron and ironing board which is great, not having to call reception for it. Also has black out blinds which was so good we woke up a lot later than we expected! The reception staff were friendly but the male receptionist didn't seem to know much information as we would have liked so he may have been new. The only gripe with the hotel is that the internet usage should be free to guests, even if it was half an hour a day. As everyone has said, it is a great location. We did the bridge climb and it was only a 5 minute walk behind the hotel to the climb base. We had dinner at Doyles (seafood) on the Circular Quay which is only minutes away. This restaurant also has a great view, I would recommend it. We turned up with no booking 10 minutes before their last orders with very few people left in the restaurant but we were not rushed at all and received very good service. We also took a ferry to Manly and the best thing about that was the ferry ride over, good tip - sit at the back when leaving Circular Quay so you can a great view of Sydney. I do recommend this hotel very much and believe I got great value for money compared to rates of other 5* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, when you can get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: 1_With_A_Travel_Bug
Reviews.Content: I lucked out with a deal on a room Dec 27-29 - the normal cost would have been way over our budget. As it turns out, the hotel was great, about a 3 minute walk from Circula Quay and ferries and trains which took us all around Syndey. Our room was a Deluxe King Size Harbor View room, which consisted of a king size bed, plazma/lcd television, sofa sleeper, small desk, nice sized bathroom with tub and a wall of closets and drawers. With the sofabed open, the room was cozy, but it did allow our family of four to sleep comfortably. The only strange thing in the room was that the lights by the king size bed were controlled by the main light switch, which meant that when our kids went to bed, we could not turn on the bedside lamps to read. We finally moved the portable lamp from the desk over, so at least one of us could peruse the travel guides. While I thought the staff was very helpful and the on-duty manager always around, I did not think they were very knowledgeable about the city. For example, we asked one night for dinner spot recommendations for our family with two kids. The recommendations were a couple of restaurants close by that upon inspection, seemed to be local touristy selections. Granted, we were tourists, but we did not necessarily want to be reminded about it! Since our room was valued at 1400AUS a night, I feel as though a conceirge service might have been in line with the cost of the room. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay here and would definitely consider it for future visits. Checking wotif.com during our stay, I saw that some deals can be had for last minute bookings. The roof top pool was exciting and the views of the harbor were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: dave62
Reviews.Content: Nice location, very clean and they were VERY nice to us. I would stay here again. The only way they could improve would be, as with much of AU, free internet access, or at least a reasonable price for it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deslorna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week in November and found everything to be brillant. We used the hotel only as a base to see Sydney, the harbour and to do bridge climb and you can not find a better located hotel to do this from. Everything is within a short walking distance, the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast bar was excellent with smoothies and omlettes made to order. Great!. I will be back.....once I saved up again.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting The Rocks, Sydney Australia”
Reviews.Author: MMDavison
Reviews.Content: The Old Sydney Holiday Inn, The Rocks, Sydney, Australia, had all of the conveniences we required for a long trip, including self-service laundry facilities, afternoon snack bar, a breakfast (no lunch though) and dinner restaurant. The biggest asset of the hotel was its location for tourists. It was close to all tourist company offices, including a tourist office where tickets could be purchased for the city's Explorer Bus service, and harbour tours were within close walking distance. There were many restaurants nearby, some more desirable to us than others, including an excellent pasta restaurant and, if desired, a fast food restaurant. Room service at the hotel was very good. There were no self-service ice machines available, but ice was available from room service, or guests could get ice themselves at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bravecrystalpalace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney at the beginning of September 06. The hotel is in a great location and we had views of the Harbour Bridge from our room. Views from the pool area on the roof are even better by day or night. Staff at the hotel were really friendly and helpful and service was good. Just around the corner is the visitor centre and if you are planning any days trips they have tons of info available, will give advice and will make the bookings for you. Would definitely recommend a day trip to the Blue Mountains. Didn't have enough time to do the bridge climb but went up the tower instead which gives excellent views. Also took the ferry to Manly which was gorgeous. All easily accessible from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn from 16thOct-22Oct 2006.The location is fantastic and we had a deluxe room with fab views of The Opera House and the city skyline. It was a great room, lovely food, excellent service. The staff were all really helpful and friendly. Also the view from the rooftop terrace and pool is wonderful, unfortunately it wasn't warm enough to take a dip. We would definately stay there again. Sandra and Russ Stockport England

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JayPDee
Reviews.Content: Location is everything with this hotel. Stayed in an Execeutive Room courtesy of Priority Club, views of bridge from room much appreciated. A trip to the rooftop pool is a must, the views of the Opera House and Bridge are awesome, although it was a little too cold for a swim in early July... The central atrium is a bit dated and there is very little else on offer at the hotel, plenty else locally however. If you want an excellent downtown location then there isn't much better than the Old Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Whadders
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this Hotel is the rooftop pool and the views both day and night over the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay and Opera House. Also well situated for the Rocks with arty shops and resturants. The nearby Orient Hotel and Pub had a great buzz. The rooms in the hotel were a little small but the courtyard open plan foyer is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy at the weekend”
Reviews.Author: DM123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, my room was well equipped and modern with a view of the Opera House, Circular Quay, and the Harbour. The hotel is very noisy at the weekend due to all of the bars and all of the locals in their modified cars... You also get some noise from within the hotel due to the atrium design. Service is generally good though they failed to fix a broken window lock in the 2 weeks that I was there. The choice at breakfast wasnt the best and was overpriced. Far better going to one of the numerous cafes in the area... The dinner and room service menus were pretty limited but the food was good. Hotel internet access is very expensive. There is supposed to be free wireless internet access throughout the rocks area but this didnt work in all the time that I was there...

Reviews.Title: “Would go again”
Reviews.Author: Ian4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated in the Rocks area within easy walking distance of Circular Quay, the Opera House and the Bridge. The accommodation in a standard double is very comfortable and there are nice little extra touches such as free newspapers and free safety deposit boxes. You will need to ask for a high floor room at the front to have any chance of a harbour view. It wasn't really warm enough on my visit to spend too much time up on the roof, but a visit to the rooftop pool area is essential for the fabulous views. Didn't dine in other than for breakfast which is quite substantial and varied, but the bar prices are very reasonable for an hotel of this standard. The dinner menu looked reasonably well varied and competitively priced. Check in isn't normally until 2pm but ask your travel agent to speak nicely to the manager and they may let you in as early as 7am, as they did for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cat3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! It's between the Opera House and the bridge and within walking distance of almost everywhere (hence the reason I rated it so well.) Also right next to the street markets. The hotel itself is nothing special, it did have an excellent view from the roof balcony. The bathroom is tiny and the spa didn't work which was a disappointment but the location makes it worth it. If you do stay here there's an excellent restaurant in Circular Quay called Quayside Brasserie (last one on the strip as you are approaching the Opera House) I started to think that good, flavorful food was hard to come by while I was in Sydney, but this definitely changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Indianabarb
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old neice and I just returned from a trip to Sydney and the Gold Coast. We stayed at the Holiday Inn at The Rocks for four nights. We had a beautiful room on the 3rd floor overlooking the street in front and a nice view of the harbour. We could not see the Opera House because we were not up high enough, but the view we had was nice. Our room was comfortable, with a king bed and a twin. We had satellite tv, a mini fridge (there was room for our milk, water and juice) a very roomy bath, plenty of closet space, a safe, etc. The staff was wonderful and our favorite person was Wendy. She was so helpful with our tour questions and bookings. There is a wonderful gourmet restaurant just across the alley with wonderful breakfast selections. We did not have lunch there, but the menu looked good. The location of the Old Sydney Holiday Inn could not have been better. You can walk everywhere from here, even Darling Harbour. If you don't want to walk, there is all kinds of public transportation availble from here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chick1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once previously for a girl's weekend away and this time I took my mum for her 60th. The location is absolutely fantastic. The staff were really helpful. Everything is within walking distance (Opera House, Bridge, markets, pubs, heaps of places to eat, CBD & shopping) Both times I have stayed I have had a great time. From the moment you book in and they valet park your car(as you won't need it when you stay here!) to the moment of checking out everything was superb.... I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: Short walk from Circular Quay train station that is the same train line from Sydney Airport. Great location in The Rocks, there is The Rocks Market on each week right outside the hotel as well as the depature point for ferries as well as Sydney Bridge & The Opera house only a few minutes walk away. Reception was friendly however seemed strained for staffing levels on the days we were there as there were queues for check in and out at peak times. Likewise there were often queues and waits for elevators. The floors all look down to the reception area as it has been created like an atrium. Luggage storage overfilled from the rooms and were stored on trolleys next to reception. Rooms were clean and had a good view of The Rocks. Great view of Sydney from the roof however the area is small & summer would be the recommended time for using the pool/jacuzzi. This is a good hotel however isn't the best in Sydney. The location makes this very appealing for international visitors as everything is in walking distance or easy access to trains & ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes up for lack of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: trvlm0m2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went straight to the Old Sydney at 7 a.m. after traveling for over 20 hours. We figured there wouldnâ€™t be rooms open for us yet, but at least weâ€™d have a place to store our luggage until check-in time. We were pleasantly surprised when they offered us our room key right away. That, unfortunately, was the last time they pleasantly surprised us. The rest of our stay, there was little staff help or involvement. I canâ€™t say that anything was wrong, just not great. The room was small, but offered all that we needed, though; we found it strange that it had a twin size bed and a double bed. We had requested a queen with a view of the Opera House, but since we arrived so early we didnâ€™t have our pick of rooms and were fine with what we were given. The bathroom was clean, the beds were comfortable, and there was very little noise. We had drinks one evening at the lobby bar, but felt no need to stay. There was nothing the made you feel attached to the hotel; just a place to lay your head. We went to the roof for a soak in the Jacuzzi, but on a cool Sydney evening, what we expected to be a warm inviting hot tub startled us by being barley warmer than the air. When it was time to leave for our next Australian destination, we werenâ€™t moved with sadness to leave, like some hotels weâ€™ve stayed at. There was no connection to the hotel at all. The best thing that this hotel has going for it, and why I would recommend it, is the location for the price canâ€™t be beat. You are right in the center of the Rocks area surrounded by great bars/pubs, shopping, eating establishments, Opera House, Harbor Bridge, Circular Quay, and CBD. The weekend market was also just outside the hotel, which was fun to check out. I will never stay at the Old Sydney again, and will find a hotel with more appeal and attentive staff, but hopefully the next hotel will have just as good of a location.

Reviews.Title: “Totally over-rated”
Reviews.Author: macdap
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of April and chose this hotel for the location and the reviews on this site. I wished we had'nt as it was the worst place we stayed in throughout our 5 week trip in Oz. Everywhere we went in Oz we found the people so friendly and helpful but not here and as with a previous review we found the attitude of the staff to be shocking. The location is great but I'm afraid that was all that I would recommend this hotel for. We booked an executive room and got room 826 on the top floor and initially we thought it was fine but thought the air conditioning was rather noisy. We then realised that it was not the air-con but the a large power unit on the roof directly above our room and the there was no way we could have got some sleep in that room. Again like a previous review, when I politely asked at reception about the noise I was given a blank look, an attitude of 'how dare I complain' and and a denial that no-one had ever complained about it before. I asked if we could be moved but was told that the hotel was full so I returned to the room but had to return to reception to see if there was anything that could be done. I was then told there was rooms available but not executive rooms ( which were available for the next day) but we were not caring about that so we moved rooms at 12.30am and then got moved the next day to another executive room. We did not get an apology for having to move and we then found the attitude of the staff towards us as downright rude and we can only put it down to their childish attitude to us asking to be moved. Although it did not spoil our stay in Sydney we were really glad to check out as we have never felt so uncomfortable and unwelcome in a hotel before. We would never recommend this hotel for anything else other than the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn for five nights on a round the world tour. We have to say that whilst the location was great right in the middle of the Rocks our stay was marred by the awful attitude of some of the staff. The room was nice; spacious and clean with some nice little extra touches included such as high end toiletries. The rooftop pool is tiny but has some of the best views in Sydney. Go up at different times, both day and night to get some great photographs. Those are the positive points of the hotel. However, what spoilt it for us was the way we were treated. Having not had much contact with the front desk staff it was only on our last day that we discovered how incompetent they really were. The hotel is very noisy every night - if you have a room at the front of the hotel. We politely asked at reception if it was like that every night and they seemed to take offence and gave us some 'attitude.' However, we thought no more of it until our problems started with the staff. At this time we asked them to book us an early morning wake up call and we later double-checked that this had been done. This call never arrived and when we telephoned reception to ask why it they had not woken us up, we were rudely put on hold with extremely loud music and the phone was never picked up again. We had also asked at the same time for the reception to book our shuttle to the airport. We were there when the receptionist was on the phone to the company so imagine our surprise when the shuttle did not arrive for us. We know that the shuttle was booked for everyone except four (including myself and my travel companion) so it does not seem to be the shuttle company's mistake. We also know that the woman on the front desk did not mistakenly book us with another company, as we waited in reception for an hour and no other shuttle arrived. Therefore, we can only think that the front desk staff deliberately failed to book our shuttle. Perhaps they did not like us mentioning the noise. Strange I know but they really seemed to take it as a personal slight on their character. I certainly would not be staying at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent views and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Kay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at Old Sydney Holiday Inn. I knew when we booked this hotel that it has a roof top pool but I did not realise how good the view was. It was amazing. The room was what we expected for a Holiday Inn. I would defiantly stay here again and recommend this hotel, for the good location, excellent views and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic view over the harbour”
Reviews.Author: HarryHarris-Johnson
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great which meant that you could walk to most places in the city. The view from the roof top is a view I will never forget - it was amazing!!! The room was a little small but this did not matter as everything else was good. One word of warning - use the safe in the room as our room was entered (not broken into) and valuables stolen. The hotel would not take any responsibility. Although this was a downer it did not spoil our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr_mojo_risin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 night in February 2006. The location of the old holiday inn can not be beaten. This is the second time stayed at the hotel and Sydney was just as enjoyable this time. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Had a deal that included breakfast and this was very good and kept us going through the day. The hotel is right in the middle of the rocks which is handy for restaurants, bars and many tourist attractions. Room was of a moderate size, but only really used for getting our heads down at night as there is so much to do in Sydney both near the hotel and further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 915 rosney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks. Great view of the opera house if you get an up-grade room. All you can eat breakfast was extra. Just a short walk across the street to Circular Quay. Rocks open air market next door on Saturday & Sunday. Helpful staff. Washer & dryer for guests. Ask about the shuttle bus to the airport,much less than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: NellPrz
Reviews.Content: Excellent position. Room typical of any other holiday inn -we paid for an executive room so it was larger than average and we also specified a harbour view which was impressive. Roof top pool was very disappointing - very shabby and not at all like the photos!! So ok but nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Place to stay in Sydney"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during out 3 week trip to Australia. The hotel is superb, outstanding in every way. I would not want to stay anywhere else in Sydney! The hotel reception is bright and modern and the description that it is old and not well kept by the previous reviewer is simply not true. The staff were fantastic, breakfast was plentiful, the restaurant was great and the rooftop pool was amazing. We spent nearly every afternoon in the pool and the views of Sydney harbour are breathtaking. The hotel has excellent standards of cleanliness with staff constantly around keeping things tidy. We stayed in an executive room and the price was brilliant value for money. Our room was spacious with a huge bathroom and the biggest bed I have ever slept in! The guest laundry was right next to our room which was really handy and very cheap to use. The standard rooms are probably smaller but if you pay for a standard room then thats what you have to expect. The location was unbeatable with access to the market, the bridge, the opera house and circular Quay within minutes. You have to stay here if your staying in Sydney its fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like A Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: chchien
Reviews.Content: Got this through Priceline as a "4-star" hotel. It definitely isn't. The hotel is very old and not kept well. Feels dingy and dark throughout. Rooms are small and bathrooms are uncomfortably tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Views of the Opera House”
Reviews.Author: paulandkaren1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Old Holiday Inn, which is the Rocks area of Sydney twice in November for a few nights each time. I loved this location as the Rocks is like a village within the city. It felt very safe with lots of lovely restaurants. Try the Sailor Thai restaurant just opposite. Our room had views of the harbour bridge and the opera house so when booking ask for a room with a view. It is worth upgrading to a superior room as the rooms are not large. We especially liked the roof terrace with the small pool to relax in the afternoon. All in all a great hotel, and not a bad price.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks travelling around the general Sydney area on a budget, my girlfriend and I spent our last night in Oz here as an anniversary treat to ourselves. Although it was the plushest place we stayed in during our holiday, it sadly proved to be the most disappointing too. Walking into reception, we were impressed to find the atrium reaching all the way up to the 7th floor, the walls lined with rooms facing into this impressive, vertigo-inducing space. Unfortunately it was downhill from there. Our room only appeared to be allocated by the receptionist when we checked in ("Oh, did you book a double room?"). Given the room we ended up with, we couldn't help but get the impression she didn't like the look of backpacking youngsters like us. Our room (624) was located in a dimly-lit back corridor (thus no view of the grand atrium). Once the keycard finally allowed us access to our room (both keys were reluctant to work on numerous occasions), we found our well-furnished but small room had a great view of, er, the restaurant and apartment blocks behind the hotel. The bathroom (and bath itself) was laughably small/cramped, literally half of the size of the one we'd had in a hostel we'd stayed at previously! I even had to remove the bin from the bathroom as it took up too much floorspace in there. The other facilities in the room were decent enough though (safe, iron and ironing board, minibar). While we were checking in, another guest was complaining at Reception about the price of his room/breakfast package, one which was apparently $70 AUD cheaper than what we had paid for our room. As it turned out, our room rate didn't even include breakfast, although we only found this out when we asked at Reception later that day (such info wasn't included in any of our booking information, nor was it mentioned at check-in). As mentioned in other reviews here, the rooftop pool does indeed offer good views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Unfortunately half of this area was closed/fenced off for refurbishment when we visited it, as were several other areas in the hotel (most notably various large sections of the Reception floor that were being varnished). It would have been nice to have been advised of these works when we made the booking, or even when we checked into our room. This is undoubtedly a great location for a first-time visitor to Sydney, close to many areas of interest (the Rocks, Circular Quay, etc). However, having paid what we felt was a considerable amount of money for one night's stay in a chain hotel, we couldn't help but feel disappointed, cheated and even belittled. Next time we'll stick to the nearby hostels and budget hotels which not only offer better value for money but also an altogether more pleasant customer service experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and you can't fault the location. It's perfect for tourists to see all the best sights and get around Sydney quickly. The foyer of the hotel is lovely and all rooms opened onto it. This therefore meant that you could hear all the noises, especially the espresso machines at breakfast time (6am onwards!). The rooms were basic (typical holiday inn style) with no character or charm which is a shame as they didn't match the quality of the foyer. I'd still recommend this hotel as it was clean, comfortable, centrally located and quite good value for money but I'm sure there are hotels with more character nearby that enhance your stay in this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: DML
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a very long flight from Aberdeen (UK) to Sydney via London and Auckland. Given room 610 - couldn't believe it when we walked into the room...three windows - one looking straight at the Opera House, one at the CBD and the other out to the harbour. Simply phenomenal!! Lovely soft bed, separate living area and a large bathroom. Broadband available at reasonable rates. Rate of about Â£120 per night (not per person) included a good standard hotel buffet breakfast. As others have stated, easy walking distance to Circular Quay, Opera House etc. Sydney Explorer bus stop outside. But the real jewel in this hotel's crown is the view from the rooftop pool - so good, we got up every morning at 6am to enjoy the sunrise. Mad maybe, but well worth it. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, but clearly we had one of, if not the best room in the whole hotel. See for yourself with the photos uploaded with this review.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, basic, but a Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: johntCardiff_WalesUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel matches its description, it is the "Old Holiday Inn". It is more basic than the normal Holiday Inn, although there is a small pool on the roof. It has seen better days, the breakfasts are Reasonable, but the location on the Rocks just at the end of the harbour bridge and a minute from Circular Quay is superb for the money and ideal for sightseeing. Certainly the Hyatt right on the harbour or the Shangrila a few blocks behind you would be double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel location in Sydney?”
Reviews.Author: MCFC_Steve
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel in October 2005 as part of our Silver Wedding Anniversary Tour. Read the reviews on here, and wasn't disappointed. Price for price, this hotel has to be in the best location in Sydney. Right in the middle of the buzzing Rocks area, with everything you could possibly want within easy walking distance; Circular Quay 2 mins; Sydney Bridge 2 mins; Opera House 5 mins. Views from the rooftop are priceless. Unobstructed views of the Opera House, Bridge and CBD skyline. I relaxed in the heated pool or hottub whilst taking in the views. There is a sauna up there too, though I couldn't get it to work. We were on the 4th floor looking out onto George Street with a view of the Bridge. Room was clean and tidy with everything you'd expect to find, including safe, iron and board, TV, free morning paper and plug in Internet connection for your laptop. Shower was really powerful. Remember to ask for a non-smoking room if you want one. I forgot and there was a slight smell, but not enough to make us ask for a change. Breakfast in the room was a bit of a luxury, but very well presented, and there is enough for two people in one breakfast. If you stay over a weekend, the bonus is that George Street is blocked off just outside the hotel, and the Rocks marketstalls are erected to trade all day Saturday and Sunday. Agree with other comments about the noise, mainly from cars we found, which can go on until 1 am at weekends, but hey, you are in Sydney, not the Outback. I think you can chose a room round the back, but you lose the views. If you need to sleep, ask for some earplugs on your longhaul flight! The keycards for the door were faffy; something we didn't master during our stay. There are plenty of places nearby to eat and drink. A really nice walk is to cross over the road, down the steps to Circular Quay, round to the Opera House, and then follow the walkway through the Botanical Gardens round to Mrs Macquaries Chair, where you get the best views of Sydney. Would recommend the hotel to anyone. Don't forget to read my review of the Bridge Climb. It is a must do, and if a 3 minute walk away. Have fun. Steve.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of The Rocks so for location it is perfect for exploring Sydney. Unfortunately we didn't get the harbour view we'd been promised by our travel agent, but the view out the back over the Rocks and one end of the Harbour Bridge isn't bad either. I would definitely stay here again, if only for the value for money and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stunning Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the Holiday Inn Old Sydney. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on this site, and we weren't dissappointed. Ideal location for touring all the sights. Walking distance to the ferries to Darling Harbour, Manly Beach etc. walking distance to the Opera House. Stunning views from the rooftop pool and hot-tub area of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Staff at the hotel were excellent. Warm friendly atmosphere. Waiters in the lobby bar were first class. Internet access in the lobby. Can't believe that such a reasonably priced hotel is in the heart of Sydney. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Imaginable Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: berkeleydude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Sydney after the *long* flight from SFO early in the morning. I bought a Vodafone SIM card and called up the hotel after taking a shower at the airport. Given that the checkin time was 2PM, I was expecting the worst, but was told that a room might be ready by the time we got there. Sure enough, we were checked-in to the hotel by the very friendly staff as soon as we got there! The room was nice, with no real view (we were on a low floor), and the noise from George St below does make it into the room. The breakfast and internet access are way overpriced, but the views from the rooftop were amazing as were the views from the docks a mere 2 minutes from the front door of the hotel. The location of this hotel is the best I could imagine for Sydney. A short walk to Circular Quay, near a variety of restaurants and eateries, etc.... All this for around $100 (USA) per night bids on Priceline! We returned the following weekend at the tail end of our Australia trip and got similarly great service. The only annoyance we experienced were card keys that were quite flakey. Had to try many times in order to open our doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCass
Reviews.Content: We were here for 2 nights and found the location to be exceptional. We arrived at the hotel very early, 7am, after a flight from London. The very friendly desk clerk allowed us to check in right away. Our room was at the front of the hotel on the 6th floor with fabulous views of the Opera house & Harbour Bridge. Our window was filled with this view, quite wonderful. The room was a decent size with a double and single bed. The bathroom was pretty small, but overall the place was very clean. We thought the breakfast was over priced at $16 for continental, $24 for full English but the choices were quite good, lots of fresh juices, fruits, cheeses, yogurts, breads, cereals, pastries etc. as well as the usual hot fare. The staff were exceptionally helpful & friendly, really a nice bunch. Only downside was the noise from the street which was a bit intrusive throughout the night as there are quite a lot of bars close by. Plus the traffic and police sirens. All in all this is a good place to stay in one of the best locations....just take ear plugs to ensure a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguy6
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent view, veru good customer servise, food is ok, pool and sauna located on the roof with beatiful view. Holiday INN Old Sydney isnice place to stay. Some room need renovation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1701
Reviews.Content: Stunning views from our top floor room set the scene for our stay here. Opposite the Opera House and to our left a view of the Harbour Bridge. Room was clean, bright and well furnished with a decent bathroom and internet access. Hotel is clean and of course the Australian staff are very friendly and helpful. Restaurant was very good - food and value for money great. Only downside in this sunny city - rooftop pool and sundeck are very small and you need somewhere to cool off when the temperature is nudging 40 degrees!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kewpie1
Reviews.Content: You couldn't beat the location of this hotel. It was great being in the heart of The Rocks and Circular Quay. At the roof top, you could see the Opera House and The Harbor Bridge. For the price I got directly @ the Holiday Inn website, (breakfast included), I felt that it was a steal compared to the prices charged in this large city. It wasn't the finest hotel we stayed at but it was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. But the location couldn't be beat! I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! We pretty much walked everywhere from this location too, although the subway and ferries were so accessible too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When staying in Sydnet the location is most important, the Old Sydney has probably the best, it is located near to everything in Sydney, the food is excellent mainly due to the new chef, the rooms are clean and tidy but do need a refurb, staff are very good and friendly. We will stay again

Reviews.Title: “The Real Truth, No not a place for a honey moon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there from July 1st to the 9th, and several of our friends stayed at the same hotel...We all had the same troubles...so it's not just me having a bad day. The staff are very kind, but there were several problems. The room was very small, if you could just imagin the room with a bed and enough room to walk around it, that is all there is. The windows were dusty and the TV was horrible. The channels were in red tones. The bath room was also very small, if you didn't shut the bathroom door all the way it would smack your knees when stittin on the stall. The toilet also ran almost 24 hours a day. Sometimes we couldn't even get it too flush. I don't want to forget....BEWARE of the HOT and COLD water changes when taking a shower! And the walls are as thin as paper, you can hear everyone who walks by. The view on the roof is what you would call the "Million Dollar View," but if you want to go in the hot tub or heated pool...again beware it is freezing. It was very disappointing! The only good thing is that the bed was comfy and it was close to the harbor, which has great live performers! So take it from me, choose somewhere close to the harbor, but not there if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from the 11th- 16th May this year as part of our honeymoon trip and thought the hotel was perfect. It's in a fantastic position, walk out the hotel door across the road and down approx 20 steps and you are on Circular Quay with the bridge to your left and the Opera House directly opposite - what a view, especially at night! Our room was on the 8th floor and we weren't disturbed by traffic noise, neither could we hear people in adjoining rooms. It was on the small side with a compact bathroom, but was spotlessly clean, modern and contained everything we needed. Breakfasts were really good and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is so much to do and see in Sydney you won't spend much time in your hotel, but I would recommend this one to anyway thinking of going to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Slick16
Reviews.Content: What a trifecta. Based in the Rocks area, you are not far from anything with the hop on/hop off tour stop right out the front door. The view from the rooftop pool and hot tub alone was worth the money. The room we stayed in was small, but clean. Staff was helpful in booking tours and providing information. Forget the higher-priced hotels, they are just that, higher priced. We stayed on the seventh floor, so noise was not an issue for us. The one negative is that it not very clearly marked, if you take a cab back from your night out, expect the driver to drive right past the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel for the price”
Reviews.Content: For the price and location this hotel can't be beat. We were really happy with our room - no chintz in sight, modern styling. Both days we needed wake-up calls, and they brought up complimentary coffee and crossiants at the time of the call - nice touch, and a good way to start the day. The hotel is built around an atrium. We had drinks in the hotel lobby bar, which was nice. The roof area and pool is small, but has great views. I would highly recommend this hotel to people who are coming to Sydney as tourists. It's really, really close to the Opera House, Circular Key and the bridge, in a nice area.
